title: Aide-Assembleur (Temps plein)
description:
• On te veut dans notre équipe de Salaberry-de-Valleyfield dès que possible!
  • Notre usine se situe au 1300 boul., Gérard-Cadieux, suite 101 à Salaberry-de-Valleyfield
  • Poste permanent et régulier / Salaire pouvant aller jusqu'à 17.15 $ de l'heure
  • Prime de soir de 0.75 $ de l'heure / Prime de nuit de 1.15 $ de l'heure / Prime de fin de semaine de 5 $ de l'heure
  • Prime de 1 000$ pour tous les nouveaux employés pour leur première année avec nous!
  • Progression salariale rapide, et tout ça avant même la fin de ta période de probation!
  • Horaire de jour de 8h00 à 20h15 / Horaire de nuit de 20h00 à 8h15
  • Semaine de travail de type "3-2-2-3" / Tu travailles donc 7 jours par 2 semaines!

TU SOUHAITES TRAVAILLER AU SEIN D’ÉQUIPES FIÈRES D’ÊTRE LEADERS MONDIAUX DANS LA CONCEPTION ET LA FABRICATION D’EMBARCATIONS NAUTIQUES ? TU VEUX CONTRIBUER À NOURRIR LA PASSION DES MORDUS DE SPORTS NAUTIQUES ?

Pelican international est à la recherche d’un Aide à l’assemblage au sein de son équipe de production. On a besoin de toi pour assurer la satisfaction de nos nombreux clients. Le kayak n’aura jamais été aussi populaire qu’aujourd’hui !

UNE JOURNÉE TYPE À L'ASSEMBLAGE C'EST :

Contribuer à l’effort de production en utilisant au quotidien des outils pneumatiques et électriques afin de percer des trous, visser et riveter les composantes propres aux kayaks. Tu devras aussi porter une attention particulière à la qualité de nos produits assemblés pour ensuite les empiler et emballer, prêts à être expédier.

Ta participation à la fabrication et à l’assemblage des produits nautiques évoluera grâce à l’effort des équipes, notre croissance d’entreprise et notre engagement envers l’amélioration continue. Tu contribueras ainsi à mettre les gens en contact avec les produits qu’ils aiment.

CE QU’ON ATTEND DE TOI :

Tu détiens une expérience dans la production et la fabrication ou dans un poste similaire. Même si tu n’as pas cette expérience, tu auras tout autant de succès grâce à notre processus de formation de ligne-école et ta détermination, tu seras formé dès ta première semaine parmi nous et prêt à intégrer avec confiance ton équipe.

Tu te démarques par ta facilité à utiliser des outils qui demandent une forte habileté manuelle. Ton énergie positive t’aidera à être reconnu comme un joueur d’équipe sur qui tes collègues pourront compter. Tu accordes une grande importance à la santé et sécurité dans ton lieu de travail. Tu es sensible aux risques et tu participes à notre objectif de « zéro accident ». Petit plus, tu es en plein contrôle lorsque tu travailles sous pression.

LES AVANTAGES À REJOINDRE NOTRE ÉQUIPE :

  • Un régime complet d'avantages sociaux incluant un programme d'assurances collectives combiné à notre participation à tes REER et un service de télémédecine ;
  • Des rabais corporatifs sur nos produits ;
  • Des oppportunités de développement et d'avancement ;
  • Un ambiance de travail dynamique et un esprit d'équipe solide.

Pelican, c’est avant tout une équipe de passionnés qui souhaitent mettre des produits de qualité à la portée de tous les amateurs de pleins air. Ici, nous vivons chaque jour comme une aventure, où nous restons unis en travaillant en collaboration. Nos valeurs nous servent de boussole et nous explorons un océan de possibilités pour créer une expérience récréative et durable pour nos clients.

SI TU VEUX FAIRE PARTIE D’UNE ÉQUIPE DE GENS PASSIONNÉS ET MOTIVÉS, EN PLUS DE T’ÉPANOUIR DANS UN EMPLOI DES PLUS STIMULANTS, MAINTENANT EST LE MOMENT DE METTRE TES CAPS D’ACIER ET DE TE JOINDRE À NOUS !


L'utilisation du genre masculin ne vise qu'à alléger le texte. Pelican souscrit au principe d'équité en matière d'emploi et de confidentialité. Pelican International remercie les personnes qui manifestent leur intérêt en déposant leur candidature. Toutefois, seules les personnes dont la candidature aura été retenue seront contactées.

title: Sheet Metal Worker
description:
As a Sheetmetal Worker and CNC Press Brake Operator at IMARK Architectural Metals you will be working in our state of the art fabrication facility. An operators daily duties are physically demanding and may range from operating our laser/punch to shearing or braking on the shop floor, requiring skills in all areas of metal fabrication.

Type of Machines and Operations

Primarily Press Brake but may also be asked to learn and use Lasers, CNC Equipment, Shears, Power presses, Punches, Saws, Plate rolls, Drills, Brakes, Slitters, Punch presses, Riveters (power), Hand tools

Specific Skills

  • Lay out, set up and operate one or more light or heavy metalworking machines
  • Cut, bend, roll, ream, punch, drill, weld or otherwise shape and form metal stock into parts or products
  • Operate machines or equipment which bolt, screw or rivet metal parts together, Check products for correct shapes, dimensions and other specifications
  • Troubleshoot, perform corrective action or minor repairs, Select and transport material to work area manually or using crane or hoist
  • Document work completed
  • Clean and lubricate equipment

Employment Requirements

  • High School degree required
  • Post-Secondary is considered an asset
  • 3-5 years of directly related experience
  • Reading text and document use
  • Numeracy, writing and oral communication in English
  • Working with others
  • Decision making, critical thinking and problem solving
  • Job task planning and organizing
  • Significant use of memory
  • Computer use
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada

Compensation

  • Competitive wages
  • Comprehensive benefits
  • Health and Wellness benefits
  • Corporate Wellness program
  • COR Certified Safety Program

If you are a reliable individual who meets the above criteria, we look forward to hearing from you.

IMARK thanks all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Monteur / Assembler
description:
Monteur / Assembler

Qui nous sommes?
Chez Pratt & Whitney, nous croyons que le vol motorisé a transformé, et continuera de transformer, le monde. C'est pourquoi nous travaillons avec un cœur d'explorateur et un acharnement de perfectionniste à concevoir, produire et entretenir les moteurs d'avion les plus avancés et les plus fiables du monde.

Notre portefeuille diversifié - composé de moteurs commerciaux et militaires ainsi que de moteurs destinés à l'aviation d'affaires, générale et régionale, et aux hélicoptères – nous permet, ainsi qu’à nos clients, de passer du possible au réel.

C'est ainsi que, chez Pratt & Whitney, nous abordons notre travail et ce qui nous inspire à nous dépasser.

Nos Attentes

Monte les moteurs conformément aux instructions écrites ou verbales. Utilise des gabarits, accessoires et outils de montages standards et spéciaux pour placer, fixer et asseoir, les pièces selon les tolérances et méthodes spécifiées. S’assure d’avoir les bonnes pièces par une concordance de l’identification avec la liste des pièces (pick list). S’assure visuellement que les pièces ne sont pas endommagées.

Règle, ajuste et conduit des appareils à équilibrage vertical et horizontal de basse et haute vitesse. Lit et interprète les données pour déterminer la localisation et l’amplitude du déséquilibre ainsi que l’endroit du matériel à enlever (par rectification manuelle) ou à ajouter pour ramener la pièce à l’équilibre. Pèse les aubes pour répartir uniformément le poids. Règle le montage des machines à riveter les aubes, centre le poinçon et ajuste l’angle, la hauteur, la course et la pression. Enlève les rivets pour désassembler les aubes.

Démonte les moteurs conformément aux instructions écrites ou verbales. Utilise des accessoires et outils de démontages standards et spéciaux pour retirer les pièces endommagées ou coincées. Signale les dommages ou conditions inusités.

Mesure les pièces pendant le montage avec un assortiment d’instruments de mesure et calcule les jeux de tolérances. Effectue des essais de pression et d’écoulement. Fait une audition visuelle de l’état externe du moteur avant l’envoi aux essais et à son retour. Observe le déroulement et les résultats d’opération de montage réalisés par d’autres pour témoigner du respect des normes en confirmant les résultats obtenus.

S’assure que la documentation est correctement complétée puis signe et / ou appose son timbre en fin d’exécution du travail. Effectue une vérification finale du moteur et le prépare à l’expédition en l’emballant et le mettant en boîte. S’assure d’y inclure la documentation, les pièces d’appoints et les préservatifs nécessaires. Tient à jour les registres appropriés des divers paramètres afin d’établir des opérations efficaces avec le contrôle statistique des procédés.

Peut être appelé à travailler sur les opérations les plus simples pour installer et tester une variété limitée de configurations de moteurs.

À quoi ressemblera votre quotidien?

Participe au développement des nouveaux procédés, produits et reprises pour le choix des méthodes et outils.

Lave, préserve, emballe, identifie et déplace les pièces tout en s’assurant de rencontrer les normes et spécifications. Prend les articles nécessaires dans les magasins et colonnes et signale les sorties et les besoins de matériel au responsable. Effectue les routines d’entretien pour s’assurer que, entre autres, les niveaux des fluides sont adéquats, que les filtres sont propres et que la condition générale de la machine est conforme à la liste de vérification. Maintien son équipement et son environnement de travail propres et en bonne condition. Participe à la formation et partage ses connaissances à ses coéquipiers sur les différents équipements et tâches.

Effectue d’autres tâches similaires de complexité moindre ou égale en lien avec les fonctions ci-haut mentionnées. Signale les difficultés au responsable du service.

Ce dont vous avez besoin pour réussir

  • Titulaire d’un DEP en montage mécanique ou l’équivalent

  • Expérience pertinente : 2 à 5 ans dans le domaine de l’aéronautique;

  • Maîtrise du français (oral et écrit) - connaissance de l’anglais un atout

  • Capacités interpersonnelles : travail d’équipe et attitude positive

Ce qui vous attend

  • Entreprise d’envergure mondiale de renom

  • Produits innovateurs à la fine pointe de la technologie : moteurs d’avions et d’hélicoptères de nouvelle génération (PW800, PT6E-series, F135, etc.)

  • Développement de technologies vertes et durables

  • Programmes d’avancement professionnel et de scolarisation

  • Programmes de formation sur le leadership et mentorat

  • Gamme d’avantages sociaux, régime d’épargne et régime de retraite

  • Pratiques reconnues en matière de santé, sécurité et environnement

  • Programme de santé-mieux -être en entreprise et groupes de ressources pour les employés

  • Programme d’aide pour les congés parentaux

  • Culture d’entreprise valorisant la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion et l’engagement communautaire

Informations additionnelles

Horaire selon les modalités de la convention collective en vigueur.

Bien que toutes les demandes d'emplois soient prises en considération, seuls les candidats retenus seront contactés.

Diversité et inclusion

Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte. P&WC souscrit au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi et est déterminé à encourager la diversité et l’inclusion. Nous sommes heureux d’étudier la demande d’emploi de tous les candidats qualifiés, sans égard à leur race, couleur, religion, orientation sexuelle, genre, nationalité d’origine, âge, handicap, statut d’ancien combattant ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi.


-

About Us
At Pratt & Whitney, we believe that powered flight has transformed — and will continue to transform — the world. That's why we work with an explorer's heart and a perfectionist's grit to design, build and service the world's most advanced and unrelenting aircraft engines.

We do this across a diverse portfolio – including Commercial Engines, Military Engines, Business Aviation, General Aviation, Regional Aviation, and Helicopter Aviation – and as a way of turning possibilities into realities for our customers.

This is how we at Pratt & Whitney approach our work, and this is why we are inspired to go beyond.


What are Our Expectations

Assemble engines according to verbal or written instructions. Use fixtures, accessories and standard and special assembly tools to place, fix and seat parts in position according to specified tolerances and procedures. By comparing identification with the pick list, ensure use of the right parts. Visually inspect parts to ensure that they are undamaged.

Set up, adjust and operate low- and high-speed vertical and horizontal balancing equipment. Read and interpret data to determine location and extent of unbalance, as well as location of material to be removed (by manual milling) or added, in order properly balance part. Weigh blades to spread the weight equally. Set up blade riveting machines, center the punch and adjust the angle, height, motion and pressure. Remove rivets in order to disassemble blades.

Disassemble engines according to verbal or written instructions. Use accessories and standard and special disassembly tools to remove stuck or damaged parts. Report unusual conditions or damages.

Measure parts during assembly operations, using an array of precision measuring instruments, and calculate tolerance range. Perform pressure and flow tests.

Visually audit external condition of engine before and after tests. Observe progress and results of assembly operation performed by others in order to witness compliance with standards by confirming results obtained. After completion of task, ensure that documents are properly completed, then signed and/or stamped. Perform final inspection of engine and prepare for shipping by packaging and placing it in the box. Ensure that documentation, backup parts and required preservatives are included. Keep appropriate records of various parameters used to establish efficient operations while maintaining statistical process control.

May be called to perform the simplest operations in order to install and test a limited variety of engine configurations.

What You Will Be Doing

You will perform visual and dimensional checks of parts, identify faults and sort parts that do not comply with specifications, based on working instructions.

As part of this core work, your careful attention to detail and analytical mind-set will prove essential when:

  • Regulating, adjusting and using precision measuring instruments for dimensional inspections

  • Using basic functions and predefined programming on CMMs and other specialized equipment

  • Performing associated tasks such as simple deburring, polishing, cleanliness tests and pressure/flow tests

  • Using the IT systems required for your role (SAP, Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)

You will actively contribute to a smooth workflow and efficient, compliant manufacturing environment by:

  • Ensuring that standards and specifications are met

  • Ordering materials needed to ensure a continuous flow of materials

  • Keeping the relevant logbooks up to date with various parameters in order to establish efficient operations using statistical process control

  • Performing other tasks such as cleaning, marking, protecting and packing parts

Your will also work with colleagues to drive improvements and raise the bar for quality in the manufacturing centre:

  • Collaborating with the production department to correct quality problems

  • Participating in quality improvement clinics

What You Need to Succeed

Participate in the development of new processes, products and redesigns regarding the selection of methods and tools. Wash, preserve, package, identify and move parts so that they meet all standards and specifications. Take items required from the stores and columns and refer all releases and needs of material to the person in charge. Perform maintenance routines to make sure, namely, that fluid levels are adequate, that filters are clean and that the general condition of the machine complies with the checklist. Keep equipment and work station clean and in good working condition.

Participate and share knowledge with teammates regarding the various equipment and tasks.

Perform other duties of equal or less complexity related to duties mentioned above. Refer difficulties to the head of department.

What You Can Expect

  • A renowned, global company

  • Innovative, state-of-the-art products and technology: next-generation aircraft and helicopter engines (PW800, PT6E-series, F135, etc.)

  • Development of green and sustainable technologies

  • Career development and education programs

  • Leadership training programs and mentoring

  • Range of employee benefits, savings plan and pension plan

  • Recognized environmental, health and safety practices

  • Corporate health and wellness programs and employee resource groups

  • Assistance program for parental leave

  • A corporate culture that values diversity, equality, inclusion and community involvement

Additional Information

Working hours in accordance with the terms of the current collective agreement.


Although all applications will be considered, only successful candidates will be contacted.


Diversity and Inclusion

We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

title: Supply Chain / Hangar Support
description:
We are all about the craft.


GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Under direct supervision of the Supply Chain/Hangar Support SC/HS Supervisor, this role performs a wide variety of duties in the areas of Shipping, Tool Control and Counter Support. Daily duties will be directed by the Supervisor and performed in a manner that will ensure a high standard of effectiveness to operations.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for the day-to-day completion of tasks, as assigned by the SC/HS Supervisor, this role requires flexibility and foresight in prioritizing work to ensure effective support to Hamilton Maintenance operations. Tasks may consist of any of the following:

TOOL CONTROL

  • Investigate lost or missing tools in concert with HS. Report all missing tooling or discrepancies
  • Ensure serviceability of tools, tool components and completeness of tool kits
  • Ensure returned damaged tooling is red tagged as unserviceable with the appropriate documentation to facilitate repair or replacement. Arrange repairs, as required
  • Action Scheduled Services Report for calibrated tooling. Communicate pending calibrations to stakeholders and facilitate turnaround requirements with aircraft scheduling
  • Track status of tools at vendors for repair or calibration
  • Process distribution orders to other facilities and work orders for internal repairs
  • Interpret requests for tooling. Research/recommend new or replacement tooling through YLW
  • Request calibration extensions through QA
  • Complete preventative maintenance for cherry max riveters
  • Remove and replace pressure gauges from line vehicles, O2 room and facility
  • Ensure tracking of shared and moved tools between facilities
  • Assist IM Group as spokesperson/liaison during internal and external audits and counts
  • Assist Hangar Support staff with issuing and returning tools

SHIPPING

  • Retrieval and verification of inbound/outbound goods against invoices or other Bills of Lading
  • Exercising diligent packaging techniques for aircraft parts to ensure all regulatory requirements are maintained and all preventative measures are taken when packaging item(s) to prevent damage in transit
  • Creating commercial invoices and export documentation, ensuring customs requirements are fulfilled for international shipments. Ensuring effective completion of all shipping documentation
  • Observance of/compliance to DOA when committing to freight spend
  • Preparing all outgoing shipments (incl 3rd party), utilizing approved courier systems
  • Entering data into approved Carrier and KF Aerospace ERP systems
  • Shipping of Dangerous/Hazardous Goods ensuring all defined SOP’s are adhered to
  • Applying ESD procedures
  • Maintaining records of incoming/outgoing shipments
  • Preparing quotes for internal/external customers
  • Building customized containers for fragile freight
  • Assisting with the loading and verification of shipments while applying the proper/safe use of material handling equipment
  • Assisting other departments with packaging or freight concerns

COUNTER SUPPORT

  • Maintain Tool Crib bins and shelf tidiness, shadow shelves, as required
  • Manage overdue tooling issued to technicians
  • Issue inventory to Production staff, including WHMIS product & raw material
  • Pick requested materials for delivery in a timely manner
  • Complete parts put-away process
  • Process Aircraft-On-Ground (AOG) requirements
  • Process time expired inventory
  • Process re-stock items

MISC TASKS

  • General housekeeping
  • Any other duties as assigned by the SC/HS Supervisor

REQUIRED CERTIFICATION, EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE or SKILLS

  • Working knowledge of aircraft tooling, parts & material
  • Mechanical aptitude and ability to perform basic repairs and calibrations
  • Mandatory Controlled Goods certification required (completed in-house and requires background check)
  • Mandatory Dangerous and Hazardous Goods certifications (completed in-house)
  • Must have a valid driver’s license
  • Forklift certification required (certification provided in-house)
  • Ability to comprehend and complete detailed shipping documentation
  • Shipping experience will be an asset
  • Physical ability to stand for extended periods and to move and handle freight throughout the company, which entails heavy lifting including, bending, stooping, reaching, twisting, lifting, pushing and pulling
  • Intermediate to advanced computer skills in MS Office programs, specifically Excel, M3, Photo-exporting with an understanding of inventory databases & PowerBi
  • Planning and organizing skills and attention to detail are required
  • Work independently as well as in a team environment
  • Constantly display a positive professional attitude toward co-workers, customers, management and the company
  • Proactive problem solving and advanced trouble shooting skills
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Demonstrated interpersonal communication skills
  • Detail oriented

title: Journalier
description:
Journalier


Emploi - Opérateur - N/A


Siège social - Saint-Lambert-de-Lauzon Québec G0S 2W0

Début:

Horaire: Lundi au vendredi (Soir)

Description:


EMPLOI STIMULANT/ENVIRONNEMENT SÉCURITAIRE/ÉQUIPE DYNAMIQUE/

SALAIRE ENTRE 17.70$ et 21.07$

JOUR DU LUNDI AU JEUDI 6H15 À À 15H15 ET VENDREDI DE 6H00 À 12H00 OU SOIR DU LUNDI AU JEUDI 15H15 À 2h00

Les avantages que Métal Bernard peut t’offrir:

  • Un poste permanent
  • Possibilité d'avoir un horaire permanent de JOUR ou de SOIR
  • Paye chaque semaine. Révision salariale en mai.
  • Assurances Collectives comprenant médicament et dentaire
  • Montant de 300$ alloué pour les équipements de travail
  • REER participatif
  • Club Social
  • Programme de reconnaissance
  • Comité santé et sécurité
  • Programme d'aide aux employés
  • Assurance voyage
  • Formation continue
  • Être accueilli(e) par un « coach » attitré, une équipe sympathique et des gestionnaires humains qui t’écoute, te soutienne et respecte ton rythme d’apprentissage.

Responsabilités:


Le rôle des opérateurs d’usinage manuel dans notre équipe:

  • Analyse le travail en fonction des feuilles de travail, des plans et des exigences clients.
  • Travailler avec des outils tels que des perceuses, fraiseuses afin d'ébavurer, percer, tarauder, riveter et couper au plasma lorsque requis
  • Assembler les pièces à partir d'un plan donné
  • Contrôler la qualité et la quantité des pièces produites

Exigences:


Tu n’as pas besoin d’avoir une formation pour travailler chez nous! Ce qu’on recherche c’est…

  • C’est quelqu’un qui a « une bonne forme physique », du talent pour les taches manuelles et qui travaille avec cœur.
  • C’est quelqu’un qui a déjà des habiletés manuelles et qui sait manier différents outils.
  • C’est quelqu’un qui cherche toujours à s’améliorer et qui a le souci du travail bien fait.

Remarque:

Métal Bernard, division du Groupe Mundial, constitue un véritable chef de file dans la transformation de métal en feuille depuis 40 ans en sous-traitance industrielle, particulièrement en découpe au laser, pliage, roulage, soudage et usinage de tous les types de métaux.

Travailler chez nous, c’est travailler dans une usine en pleine expansion, dans un environnement sécuritaire, où l’ambiance est des plus conviviale et où l'on prône la sécurité d'emploi en offrant des postes permanents. Nous sommes qu'à 10 minutes des ponts et qu'à 15 minutes du centre-ville de Ste-Marie

Nous sommes qu'à 10 minutes des ponts et qu'à 15 minutes du centre-ville de Ste-Marie"]

title: Assembler
description:
What is offered

  • Family business founded in 1978.
  • Permanent job within a high-growth company.
  • Year-round employment stability (40 hours per week).
  • Job site easily accessible by public transport / on-site parking.
  • Competitive Group Insurance Plan.
  • Night bonus of 2,15$ per hour.
  • RRSP (Registered Retirement Savings Plan) and DPSP (Deferred Profit-Sharing Plan) with Employer contribution.
  • Employee and family Help Plan.
  • Comprehensive integration plan.
  • Specific training programs according to job title.
  • Numerous internal career development possibilities.
  • Cafeteria service subsidized by the Employer.
  • Allowance for purchasing safety boots and clothing.
  • Referral Program with $1000 premium.
  • Social Club activities and more!!

Your Skills

  • High school diploma or professional diploma completed (asset)
  • 6 months to 1 year of solid experience in the manufacturing field particularly in assembling products
  • Capability to reading instructions, measurement plans and using measurement tools
  • Very good dexterity, attention to detail and quality
  • Must have experience in manipulating a variety of tools (drill, tape measure, pop riveter gun, cutter knife)
  • Must be able to adapt to a fast-paced environment and be autonomous
  • Good understanding of French language (spoken and written)
  • Very good physical ability (able to lift loads of less than 50 pounds)

Your challenge

As an assembler, you will have to assemble components of truck bodies of all kinds on production lines using pneumatic or other tools.

  • Read the order form and, if necessary, technical drawings;

  • Bolt, screw, tighten the assembled parts and parts of the truck box;

  • Connect cables and wires;

  • Perform the interior finishing of the box;

  • Performs moderately complex tasks according to pre-established time and quality standards;

  • Assist other production centers (if required).

Our Corporate Culture

Our Mission:
Together, we are building the transport solutions of the future.

Our vision:
A human and efficient company, Transit will be recognized for its quality truck bodies offering a wide range of configurations and designed for eco-responsible logistics.

Our values:
respect, pride, collaboration, fun

title: Labourer, Fabrication Shop
description:
Company Description


WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.


Job Description


WHAT’S THE JOB?
Join our NRB Modular Solutions team, where our people are driven by a desire to innovate, do social good, and move construction forward..

The Labourer works as part of the light metal fabrication team, reporting directly to the Supervisor or Lead Hand in that department. You will be responsible for general labour duties as assigned.

Your work will include:

  • General labour duties as related to the manufacture of metal building components.
  • Light assembly of duct work and metal vents.
  • Packaging of finished products in preparation for shipping to customer.
  • General shop maintenance.
  • Adherence to all legislative and company safety policies and procedures.

Starting Rate for this position is $20.00/hour.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • An award winning safety culture
  • Extended health and dental benefits, HCSA, RRSP matching plan, Wellness program, EAP.
  • Whereas other companies are downsizing, we are growing!
  • Be #1 on day 1 by joining an industry leader

NOTE: all cadidates must be fully vaccinated against Covid-19.

Follow NRB Modular Solutions on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn


Qualifications


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • Cooperative team player
  • Good mechanical skills, including good eye/hand coordination.
  • Ability to lift 45 lbs comfortably, walk and stand for long periods of time and perform physical work.
  • Experience in the use of band saws, drills, pneumatic drills and riveters.
  • Excellent attention to detail.
  • Ablility to follow direction with minimum supervision.
  • Previous experience working in a metal fabrication environment is an asset but not required.

Additional Information


Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.

title: newAerospace Technician
description:
W.R. Davis Engineering Ltd (Davis) is a dynamic mid-sized company specializing in the design of infrared (IR) signature solutions for both naval and aerospace platforms. Davis performs ground-up design, development and manufacturing at our Ottawa, Canada facility. More background available at www.davis-eng.com

Our production team consists of some of the best thin gauge fitter/fabricators in the world and we are currently looking to expand. Are you interested in joining a team of metal working professionals providing industry leading technology to global customers? Are you bored with your current job and need a challenge? If so, we’d love to hear from you. We are currently looking for:

Aerospace Technician

Primary Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Will be required to form thin gauge metal through rolling, bending, stretching and shrinking to Military Standards
  • Will be required grind and buff thin gauge metals of .025 to .040 thickness.
  • Will be required to drill close tolerance holes in Stainless Steel, Inconel, Titanium, and Aluminum
  • Require use of hand and drill press with correct speeds and pressure on different metals
  • Will be required to rivet with different fasteners using rivet gun and bucking bar, hand squeeze guns, and floor squeezers in thin gauge metals .025 - .040.
  • Sound knowledge of riveting required.
  • De-riveting experience when required
  • Required to have a working knowledge of manufacturing equipment, shear, roll. press brake, drills, riveters
  • Capable of accurate measurement using venires, micrometers, etc.
  • Will require a knowledge of Aerospace blue prints and related terminology
  • Must be capable of good communication
  • Working with tight tolerances
  • Able to follow all Health and Safety rules and procedure
  • Other related duties

Experience/Assets

  • Precision Aerospace training or field experience preferred
  • Experience working within an ISO Quality Program preferred
  • Must be able to obtain and maintain Controlled Goods

What we offer:

  • Exciting products and a great atmosphere.
  • Centrally located with free parking.
  • Shifts Mon-Fri 7:00 AM – 3:30 PM with occasional overtime as needed.
  • Clean, climate controlled facility
  • Top industry wages based on experience & qualifications
  • Comprehensive benefits program and DPSP matching
  • Skills development, training and advancement opportunities
  • Secure industry
  • Safety Boot Allowance
  • Employee referral bonuses

We thank you for your interest in this role. Please note that only those qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Profit sharing

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Ottawa, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Education:

  • AEC / DEP or Skilled Trade Certificate (preferred)

title: (B) Ferblantier / Apprenti ferblantier
description:
Si vous fleurissez dans un milieu de travail axé sur l'esprit d’équipe, un environnement qui met au défi vos compétences, favorise le développement de votre carrière, favorise la diversité et récompense l'innovation, et ce, avec des salaires compétitifs, et de bons programmes pour les employés, Joignez-vous à l'équipe d'Ainsworth dès aujourd’hui !

Responsabilités :
  • tracer, fabriquer et installer toutes sortes d'objets en métal en feuilles;
  • lire des dessins techniques et d'architecture, des schémas et des devis, et agencer, mesurer et marquer la tôle conformément aux dessins ou aux gabarits;
  • effectuer le montage et la réparation de systèmes de distribution de l'air (ventilation, climatisation, chauffage à air chaud) et de tout système pour l'évacuation de matières diverses, telles que vapeurs, fumées ou poussières;
  • utiliser des machines légères, telles que cisailles, emboutisseuses, presses et poinçonneuses, et aussi du matériel à commande numérique, pour couper, cintrer, poinçonner, percer, profiler ou redresser la tôle;
  • ajuster et assembler les pièces métalliques au moyen de matériel à riveter, à souder et à braser;
  • poser les isolants intérieurs en rapport avec ces systèmes et mettre en place des appareils préfabriqués;
  • réaliser le revêtement métallique de lanterneaux, de corniches, de coupe-feu et de solins;

Qualifications
  • Carte de compétence CCQ;
  • Expérience dans l’installation de gaines de ventilation dans édifices à bureaux
Horaire : Temps plein
Quart de travail : Jour, Soir
Durée du contrat : N/A
Lieu de travail : Montréal, Centre-ville

Bien que nous appréciions toutes les applications que nous recevons, prenez note que seuls les candidats considérés seront contactés.

Ainsworth s'engage à bâtir un milieu de travail diversifié et inclusif. Les membres des groupes désignés admissibles sont encouragés à postuler, tout accommodement raisonnable des qualifications sera pris en compte conformément à notre politique en matière d'accommodement, disponible sur demande.

La forme masculine désigne, lorsqu’il y a lieu, aussi bien les femmes que les hommes, l’emploi du masculin a pour but d’alléger la lecture du texte.

Ainsworth est une compagnie multisectorielle intégrée qui offre des services et des solutions de pour toutes les exigences de maintenance et de remise à neuf de ses clients. Nous nous efforçons continuellement de créer des produits de meilleure qualité et plus avancés, tout en offrant un service de la plus haute qualité. Nous sommes en pleine croissance et avons besoin de professionnels talentueux pour nous aider à devenir la meilleure entreprise multi-commerce au pays ! Joignez-vous à nous…. Faites une différence.

title: Fiberglass and anti-rust specialist
description:
What is offered

  • Family business founded in 1978.
  • Permanent job within a high-growth company.
  • Year-round employment stability (40 hours per week).
  • Job site easily accessible by public transport / on-site parking.
  • Competitive Group Insurance Plan.
  • Night bonus of 2,15$ per hour.
  • RRSP (Registered Retirement Savings Plan) and DPSP (Deferred Profit-Sharing Plan) with Employer contribution.
  • Employee and family Help Plan.
  • Comprehensive integration plan.
  • Specific training programs according to job title.
  • Numerous internal career development possibilities.
  • Cafeteria service subsidized by the Employer.
  • Allowance for purchasing safety boots and clothing.
  • Referral Program with $1000 premium.
  • Social Club activities and more!!

Your Skills

  • DES or DEP completed with relevant experience
  • 1 to 2 years of experience in the production of products in a manufacturing environment
  • Ability to read plan
  • Very good dexterity, thoroughness and quality oriented
  • Have experience handling various tools
  • Being versatile, resourceful and able to work in a team
  • Good knowledge of French, both oral and written
  • Very good physical ability (lifting weights of less than 50 pounds)
  • Good ease in working in an environment with changing climatic conditions

Your challenge

Reporting to the Supervisor of the Painting and Interior Finishing Department, the designated person will have to apply the fiberglass inside the truck boxes and the anti-rust under the truck box. More specifically, the chosen person will have as main tasks, but not limited to:

  • Read and interpret blueprints to establish the amount of insulating materials needed
  • Use with care the tools necessary for the manufacture of vans (drill, riveter, floor nailer, tape measure, etc.)
  • Apply and fix the fiberglass and rust remover.
  • Perform visual inspection and ensure product quality according to predetermined specifications
  • Do preventive maintenance of tools
  • Keep your work environment clean
  • Perform all tasks according to predetermined time standards
  • Compliance with the company's health and safety rules and procedures
  • Perform any other related tasks as required.

Our Corporate Culture

Our Mission:
Together, we are building the transport solutions of the future.

Our vision:
A human and efficient company, Transit will be recognized for its quality truck bodies offering a wide range of configurations and designed for eco-responsible logistics.

Our values:
respect, pride, collaboration, fun

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Selkirk Canada Corp

Location: CAN-Nobel, Ontario

Company Description

Selkirk Canada Corporation is looking for Full-Time Maintenance Technician to be a part of our team! As an industrial leader in stove venting systems committed to helping customers win everywhere, every day. Selkirk is an environment where employees can use their talent, skill, teamwork and commitment to safety, quality and growth to build a rewarding career! Selkirk offers a competitive salary, excellent benefits package and company matching pension plan!

$1000.00 Signing Bonus for all New Hires! (90 day probation)

Apply today!

The maintenance technician is responsible for supporting general maintenance and repairs on the facility equipment and property structures. Responsibilities include experience in spot welding, riveters, rollers, and lock formers. Working knowledge of Paint Line Equipment and Press Operations. Demonstrated experience in basic mechanics and understanding of hydraulic systems.

Job Responsibilities

Responsibilities will include:

· To report directly to Shift Supervisor(s) on an ongoing basis with effective communication and report all relevant matters pertaining to regular duties of operations.

· Safety-safety conscious and team player to promote a safe work environment

· Maintain a clean, safe and organized work area.

· Support the Press Operations when required

· Assist in troubleshooting Paint Line Work Center, to the extent needed.

· Repair machines such as riveters, rollers, lock formers, spot welders, etc. when necessary.

· Closing work orders on maintenance software when required.

· Additional duties and tasks outside of job description will be performed at the discretion of Supervisor(s).

Qualifications

The ideal candidate will have:

· Valid Lift Truck License.

· Must be able to effectively weld in a variety of repair/build jobs.

· Strong problem solving and decision-making abilities

· Excellent communication, Inter-personal and organization skills

· 1+ year of manufacturing experience.

· Press machine operation experience considered an asset.

· Strong working knowledge in basic mechanics

Working Conditions

Safety Glasses and CSA-Certified Footwear required.

Selkirk Canada Corporation and each of its Canadian subsidiaries are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants, candidates and employees with disabilities, in accordance with applicable human rights legislation and, in Ontario, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (“AODA”). When requested, accommodations will be provided throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $28.07 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift
  • Overtime

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Nobel, ON P0G 1G0: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Experience:

  • maintenance: 3 years (preferred)
  • Welding: 2 years (preferred)
  • Manufacturing: 1 year (preferred)

Shift availability:

  • Day Shift (preferred)
  • Night Shift (preferred)

title: Assembleur(e) - Sans expérience - Laval (SLG)
description:
Vous êtes à la recherche d'un poste PERMANENT? Si vous êtes passionné par les métiers de l'assemblage et avez envie d'apprendre, nous sommes présentement à la recherche d'assembleur(e)s intéressés à travailler pour une compagnie à Laval.


Condition de travail:


  • Salaire: 16.73 + prime
  • Horaire: Lundi au vendredi
    • Soir : 15h15-23h15 + $0.80
    • Nuit : 23h15-7h15 + $1.20
  • Emplacement: Laval
  • Avantage: Assurance après 3 mois

Les taches:


  • Utiliser des outils électriques et pneumatiques
  • Percer des trous, visser et riveter les composantes
  • Lire et interpréter des dessins techniques et des instructions d’assemblage
  • Assurer l'organisation de son environnement de travail (rangement, propreté, entretien de l’équipement)
  • Une formation sera donnée

Les exigences du poste:


  • Bottes de sécurité (Obligatoire)
  • Habiletés manuelles, minutie et souci du détail
  • À l'aise avec les perceuses
  • Être capable de soulever régulièrement (20-50lbs avec quelqu’un)

Les entrevues débutent dès maintenant!


N'hésitez pas à nous contacter par courriel à cvlaval@fuzehr.com ou au 514-227-4640 poste 283, nous avons plusieurs postes similaires et connexes disponibles en ce moment.


Au plaisir de vous rencontrer!

title: Hardware Specialist/Spécialite du Matériel
description:
Role and Responsibilities

Site Chief/Chef du site
Vous êtes un passionné dans votre domaine? Vous recherchez un milieu travail où vous pourrez relever des défis, innover, utiliser des outils à la fine pointe de la technologie et collaborer avec des experts provenant de secteurs variés? Vous aimeriez vous joindre à une entreprise d’envergure mondiale qui est un chef de file dans son domaine et dont vous seriez fier de contribuer aux projets? Venez faire partie de notre équipe et partagez votre passion avec nous!
À CAE, nos équipes ont à cœur de toujours être innovatrices et de rester à l’avant-garde. Il est donc primordial de faire évoluer l’ensemble des outils et logiciels que nous avons développés. C’est pourquoi nous avons besoin de votre expertise et de votre passion pour compléter notre équipe!
Les candidats devront effectuer la réparation, la modification et l'assemblage final de précision de tout type de pièces de systèmes mécaniques, électromécaniques ou hydrauliques selon les conditions, les critères et les précisions exigés pour le poste.
Le rôle que nous vous proposons :
  • Interpréter des plans mécaniques complexes, des schémas électroniques et hydrauliques, et analyser le fonctionnement du circuit (à partir de dessins de détail, d’illustrations présentant un mode d’assemblage et de consignes de travail (aéronautique)).
  • Assembler, réparer ou modifier un système mécanique, électromécanique et hydraulique à partir des dessins et des procédures de travail, des outils, des instruments de mesure et des matières premières appropriés.
  • Effectuer des opérations d’usinage manuel au banc ou sur des machines-outils conventionnelles telles que mesurer, riveter, scier, percer, limer, rectifier, fileter, tarauder, extraire des vis, des boulons et des tarauds, utiliser une plieuse à tuyau.
  • Calculer les épaisseurs de cales requises permettant d’assembler de façon à rencontrer les tolérances géométriques (concentricité – parallélisme – coaxialité, etc) des dessins.
  • Mesurer et contrôler à l’aide d’instruments de précision des pièces de formes diverses (micromètre, vernier, microscope, appareils de mesure électronique).
Le passionné que nous recherchons possède :
  • D.E.P. en électromécanique. Toute autre combinaison équivalente aux qualifications requises sera considérée.
  • Minimum de six (6) mois d’expérience pertinente.
  • Connaître les normes de précision.
  • Connaître les règles de santé et de sécurité au travail, notamment le SIMDUT.
  • Posséder une connaissance fonctionnelle du français.
Alors, venez partager votre passion avec nous!
Avec plus de 10 000 employés présents à travers 35 pays, CAE est un chef de file mondial en formation dans les domaines de l’aviation civile, de la défense et sécurité, et de la santé. Pour en apprendre plus : www.cae.com
*******
Job summary
Are you looking for a work environment where you can innovate, reach greater heights and collaborate with experts from a wide range of sectors? You want to join a world class company and industry leader with projects to which you would be proud to contribute? Come share your passion with us!
At CAE, our teams are committed to staying innovative and on the leading edge. It is therefore essential to keep improving all the tools and software we have developed. That’s why we need your expertise and passion to complete our team!
The candidates must be able to repair, modify and perform the final precision assembly of any type or mechanical, electromechanical and hydraulic system parts according to the conditions, criteria and details required for the position
The role we are offering you:
  • Interpret mechanical assembly plans, circuit and hydraulic diagrams, and assess the operation of the circuit (using detail drawings, illustrations showing an assembly method and work procedures (aeronautics)).
  • Assemble mechanical, electromechanical and hydraulic systems based on instructions, assembly drawings, system subassemblies, components and appropriate raw materials.
  • Perform manual bench machining operations or on conventional machine tools (e.g. measure, rivet, saw, drill, file, rectify, thread, remove screws, bolts and threads, use a pipe-bending machine and rotate wire bobbins (AIMS)).
  • Calculate the thickness of shims required to meet the geometric tolerances (runout, parallelism, coaxially) of the drawings.
  • Use precision instruments to measure and control parts of various shapes (e.g. micrometer, vernier scale, microscope and electronic measuring devices).
Our ideal candidate has:
  • Professional Study Diploma in Electromechanic. Any other equivalent combination of the required qualifications will be considered.
  • A minimum of six (6) months of relevant experience.
  • Be familiar with precision standards.
  • Be familiar with occupational health and safety standards, especially WHMIS.
  • Have a functional knowledge of French.
Come share your passion with us!
With over 10,000 employees located in 35 countries, CAE is a global leader in training for the civil aviation, defence and security, and healthcare markets. To learn more: www.cae.com
Position Type

Regular
CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.
Equal Employment Opportunity
At CAE, everyone is welcome to contribute to our success. With no exception.
As captured in our overarching value "One CAE", we’re proud to work as one passionate, boundaryless and inclusive team.
At CAE, all employees are welcome regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability or age.
The masculine form may be used in this job description solely for ease of reading, but refers to men, women and the gender diverse.

title: Lab Technician - Grills
description:
R&D Lab Technician

Reporting to the Validation Manager, The Lab Technician is responsible for Product Validation; ensure products being tested meet or exceed applicable safety standards, and internal (WSL) performance, appearance and durability requirements.
Supports New Product Development by participating in all aspects of new product design, development, fabrication, assembly and testing. Additionally provides input as part of a cross functional team to aid in the resolution of field issues with current and past production units.
Key Responsibilities:

  • Perform performance & validation testing; including but not limited to:
  • Input Rates, leakage, Combustion, surface, enclosure and component temperatures, P.4, BOC’s, POC’s, Delayed Ignition, Wind, and Durability. Proficient at 5G3 Emission testing, (specialized skill – some candidates).
  • CSA/UL Standard, drop test, airflow, speed voltage/current testing, control logic and function, PCB and electronical component/sub assembly testing etc.
  • Validation of technical documentation; including assembly, installation and service procedures for appliances and accessories.
  • Accurately using and calibrating, R&D equipment; including but not limited to:
  • Mechanical: Data acquisition, Combustion Analyzer, Thermometers, Thermocouples, Voltmeters, Manometers, Flow Meters, Thermesthesiometer, IR Gun, IR Camera, Camera and 5G3.
  • Electrical: Digital Multimeter, (voltage, current, resistance, continuity, etc.), Electrical safety compliance tester, (hipot dielectric, ground bond, resistance tester, megger, etc.), function generator, oscilloscope, clamp ammeter, leakage current tester, power analyzer, ac / dc fixed and variable power supplies.
  • Data collection, analysis and reporting focusing on accuracy and completeness. Storing all raw data, photographs, processed data, videos, reports etc. correctly in company testing project folders. Appropriately recording, analyzing and interpreting results to generate appropriate conclusions and recommendations.
  • Effectively collaborate with project / production coordinators for product reviews, (DFM, DFA, DFI, DFS), benchmarking (competitors and existing products), design review, testing reviews and in doing so provide relevant data, recommendations and conclusions regarding manufacturability, performance, cost reduction or durability.
  • Where applicable collaborate with QA to provide support for root cause analysis.
  • Sheet Metal Layout and Fabrication: Creating hand sketches for self or others to use for the purpose of making sample parts, limited prototypes and communicating changes to project coordinators or designers. Producing sample parts from sketches using R&D equipment.
  • Build and assemble prototype units: Assemble prototypes from production parts, prototype, or modified components or samples. Modify parts as required for prototypes using a variety of techniques.
  • Consistently report relevant findings and new information in company ‘Lessons Learned’ spreadsheet / database with a view to improve future products and/or test procedures.
  • Planning daily, weekly and monthly work for assigned projects based on timing deadlines and test input from project coordinators. Including determining the time and materials required to complete; where necessary informing the project coordinator regarding constraints, resources required and recommendations to ensure on time completion at reasonable cost. Meet assigned deadlines, where necessary taking corrective actions to recover lost time or use of preapproved overtime.
  • Safe use and operation, (where applicable after training), of R&D construction equipment. Including but not limited to: Welder, Plasma Cutter, Band Saw, Drill Press, Glass Cutter, Belt Sander, Bench Grinder, Paint Booth operation, Paint Storage, Metal Shear, Metal Break etc.
  • Power Tools: Disc Grinder, Drills, Air Nailer, Air riveters, Jig Saw, Sawzall, and Circular Saw etc.
  • Hand tools: driver/gum etc.
  • Safe operation of forklift, (where licensed and authorized)
  • Use of company prescribed health and safety equipment appropriate for the tool and/or work area.
  • Ensuring a safe and professional work area is maintained, including proper storage of all tools and equipment, work area to be clean, well-organized and presentable on a daily basis, considering the application of 5S. Promptly identify safety concerns to lab project coordinator, supervisor and or manager and advise other associates in the event of observing unsafe practices.
  • Undertake certification testing for assigned projects in collaboration with project coordinator and 3rd party testing agency ensuring a focus on correct testing methods and procedures to the relevant standard.
  • General Daily responsibilities:

Be on time and adequately prepared for all meetings

  • Work to the project direction of their assigned PC or Technology manager during product development
  • Report SR&ED time and materials weekly
  • Keep Task Board up to date
  • Know companies monthly core value and how it is intended to be applied
  • Dress code in effect
  • Technical Support for Production Department
  • Maintain and Calibrate Lab Equipment
  • Work independently or in conjunction with Hearth R&D team, Review and Update Work Instructions and Forms
  • Provide occasional support for sample / show set-up for events within the company and at third party locations.

Education & Experience:

  • College Diploma in Engineering Technology or equivalent and/or Directly Related Experience
  • Minimum 2 years relevant experience, ideally as Engineering Technician/Technologist, 5 years with Directly Related Experience in gas or HVAC products and applications and/or sheet metal manufacturing including product assembly.
  • Required: Blue Print reading. Gas/Wood: G3 or WETT (to be completed within 2 years) National Fireplace Institute (NFI) gas, wood and/or pellet (superior candidates), G2 (superior candidate).
  • HVAC: ODP Certificate
  • Microsoft Office, (strong excel is a recognized asset; i.e. data analysis, charting, macros, formula, etc.), Visual, Internet Research Skills, Solidworks fundamentals (is an asset), Labview (superior candidates)
  • Specialized Skills: Welder/Fitter (preferred), SolidWorks Fundamentals (preferred), GD&T Tolerance, WSL Forklift License (preferred), trained in problem solving, DFMEA, risk assessment six sigma (superior candidates)
  • Demonstrated knowledge of AC/DC fundamentals, DC circuity, PCB and power calculations for electrical technicians.
  • HVAC: Clear understanding of refrigeration cycles, brazing, charging systems, refrigeration piping, layout, AC circuitry up to 600 volts.

IGNITE YOUR CAREER,
Some of our competitive benefits include:

  • Competitive Compensation / Wages
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP/DPSP)
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Life insurance and disability coverage
  • Associate Purchase Programs, Product Discounts, In-house Sales
  • Appreciation Events, Raffles, Draws, Fundraising, BBQ’s, Competitions
  • Napoleon Cares – Associates helping Associates
  • Employee Assistance Plan
  • Napoleon Recognition Program
  • GOevisits, virtual doctor visits
  • And more!

The Napoleon Group of Companies is committed to fair and accessible employment practices that attract and retain Associates with disabilities. This includes providing accessibility across all stages of the employment cycle. Accommodation is available upon request.
We thank you for your interest in The Napoleon Group of Companies and for participating in our competition. Only those candidates selected for consideration will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Building maintenance attendant
description:
What is offered

  • Family business founded in 1978.
  • Permanent job within a high-growth company.
  • Year-round employment stability (40 hours per week).
  • Job site easily accessible by public transport / on-site parking.
  • Competitive Group Insurance Plan.
  • Night bonus of 2,15$ per hour.
  • RRSP (Registered Retirement Savings Plan) and DPSP (Deferred Profit-Sharing Plan) with Employer contribution.
  • Employee and family Help Plan.
  • Comprehensive integration plan.
  • Specific training programs according to job title.
  • Numerous internal career development possibilities.
  • Cafeteria service subsidized by the Employer.
  • Allowance for purchasing safety boots and clothing.
  • Referral Program with $1000 premium.
  • Social Club activities and more!!

Your Skills

  • Have 3 to 5 years of experience in production in a manufacturing environment or other relevant experience (asset).
  • Hold a DEP in building maintenance or other relevant training.
  • Possess problem-solving skills and good analytical skills.
  • Ability to perform basic calculations and read a tape measure (imperial).
  • Be able to use different tools such as knife (exacto), pliers, drill, riveter, glue gun, etc.
  • Have good physical capacity and be able to lift a load of at least 50 pounds (22 kilos).
  • Be a team player and have a sense of collaboration with colleagues and superiors.
  • Respect work methods and work procedures.
  • Comply with health and safety rules and procedures required by the company.
  • Have a sense of diligence and autonomy.

Your challenge

  • Perform minor repair and maintenance work on building mechanical systems (fire protection, ventilation and air conditioning, carpentry, plumbing and heating, electrical equipment).
  • Perform tasks related to the general maintenance and housekeeping of a building.
  • Perform preventive maintenance of air or electric tools, mechanical and hydraulic machinery, as well as the building's electricity, while respecting the schedule according to the frequency.
  • When machinery breaks down, lock it out.
  • Maintain tools.
  • Make basic emergency calls.
  • Clean and keep your workplace clean (5 “S”). Comply with the health and safety rules and procedures required by the company.
  • Perform any other task requested by the team leader or a member of the supervisory team.

Our Corporate Culture

Our Mission:
Together, we are building the transport solutions of the future.

Our vision:
A human and efficient company, Transit will be recognized for its quality truck bodies offering a wide range of configurations and designed for eco-responsible logistics.

Our values:
respect, pride, collaboration, fun

description:

  • Avoir des habiletés manuelles et avec des outils tel que percer des trous, visser, riveter, meuler, plier, coller des produits
  • Effectuer le montage mécanique.
  • Inspecter la qualité des différentes étapes de production ;
  • Garder son environnement de travail propre et ordonné
  • Avoir des habiletés manuelles et avec des outils
  • Être en mesure de lever certaine charge lourde
  • Aimer le travail d’équipe
  • Être autonome et ponctuel

Type d'emploi : Temps plein

Salaire : 18,00$ à 25,00$ par heure

Avantages :

  • Assurance Dentaire
  • Assurance Maladie Complémentaire
  • Assurance Vision
  • Congés de Vacances et Compensatoires
  • Tenue Décontractée

  • Du Lundi au Vendredi

title: Mécanicien(ne) de véhicules lourds
description:
Opti-Van, une entreprise familiale depuis 30 ans, recherche un spécialiste en carrosserie de semi-remorques avec expérience. Tu es mécanicien/mécanicienne de semi-remorque/camion? Tu cherches un nouveau défi, un emploi stable, dans une entreprise dynamique et respectueuse? Si oui, nous voulons te rencontrer!

Voici une description brève de tes tâches:

  • Réparer/riveter des panneaux.
  • Réparer/remplacer des portes.
  • Réparer des éléments de structures. (longerons/corner casting/poteau de coin)
  • Réparer/remplacer toiture. etc.

Pourquoi tu devrais venir travailler chez nous?

  • Tu développeras un sentiment d'appartenance, ici nous sommes une grande famille!
  • Les patrons sont humains et compréhensifs.
  • L'équipe aime travailler dans la bonne humeur et avoir du plaisir.
  • Après 40 heures, les heures supplémentaires sont payées à temps et demi.
  • Le taux horaire débute à 24.00 $/h et sera ajusté selon ton expérience. Tu recevras une augmentation de salaire annuellement.
  • Tu n'as pas d'expérience, mais tu es motivé à travailler et tu as le goût d'apprendre? Nous te formerons.
  • Horaire d'été, le vendredi, tu termineras à 11h30.
  • Chaque dernier vendredi du mois, nous t'offrons ton dîner.
  • Des collations sont fournies.

Compétences recherchées:

  • DEP en véhicule lourd, en réparation de carrosserie de semi-remorque/camion ou tout autre expérience significative.

Type d'emploi : Temps plein

Salaire : à partir de 24,00$ par heure

Avantages :

  • Horaires flexibles
  • Nourriture à Prix Réduit ou Gratuite
  • REER Collectif
  • Stationnement sur place

Horaire :

  • 8 Heures
  • Du Lundi au Vendredi
  • Heures supplémentaires
  • Quart de jour
  • Repos la fin de semaine

Rémunération supplémentaire :

  • Heures supplémentaires majorées

Mesures COVID-19:
Port du masque obligatoire pour les clients.
skills: ['Des collations sont fournies.', "Chaque dernier vendredi du mois, nous t'offrons ton dîner.", 'Salaire\xa0: à partir de 24,00$ par heure']

title: Ajusteur mécanique / Mechanical Fitter
description:
Role and Responsibilities

(English to follow)
Les candidats devront effectuer la réparation, la modification et l'assemblage final de précision de tout type de pièces de systèmes mécaniques, électromécaniques ou hydrauliques selon les conditions, les critères et les précisions exigés pour le poste.
Le rôle que nous vous proposons :
  • Interpréter des plans mécaniques complexes, des schémas électroniques et hydrauliques, et analyser le fonctionnement du circuit (à partir de dessins de détail, d’illustrations présentant un mode d’assemblage et de consignes de travail (aéronautique)).
  • Assembler, réparer ou modifier un système mécanique, électromécanique et hydraulique à partir des dessins et des procédures de travail, des outils, des instruments de mesure et des matières premières appropriés.
  • Effectuer des opérations d’usinage manuel au banc ou sur des machines-outils conventionnelles telles que mesurer, riveter, scier, percer, limer, rectifier, fileter, tarauder, extraire des vis, des boulons et des tarauds, utiliser une plieuse à tuyau.
  • Calculer les épaisseurs de cales requises permettant d’assembler de façon à rencontrer les tolérances géométriques (concentricité – parallélisme – coaxialité, etc) des dessins.
  • Mesurer et contrôler à l’aide d’instruments de précision des pièces de formes diverses (micromètre, vernier, microscope, appareils de mesure électronique).
Le/la passionné(e) que nous recherchons possède :
  • D.E.P. en électromécanique. Toute autre combinaison équivalente aux qualifications requises sera considérée.
  • Un minimum de 6 mois d’expérience pertinente.
  • Connaître les normes de précision.
  • Connaître les règles de santé et de sécurité au travail, notamment le SIMDUT.
CAE vous propose :
  • Un environnement où vos initiatives seront reconnues et valorisées.
  • L’opportunité de travailler sur une diversité de projets en équipe multidisciplinaire.
  • Des avantages sociaux intéressants.
Alors, venez partager votre passion avec nous!
Avec plus de 10 000 employés présents à travers 35 pays, CAE est un chef de file mondial en formation dans les domaines de l’aviation civile, de la défense et sécurité, et de la santé. Pour en apprendre plus :
www.cae.com
.
****************************************
The candidates must be able to repair, modify and perform the final precision assembly of any type or mechanical, electromechanical and hydraulic system parts according to the conditions, criteria and details required for the position.
The role that we are proposing:
  • Interpret mechanical assembly plans, circuit and hydraulic diagrams, and assess the operation of the circuit (using detail drawings, illustrations showing an assembly method and work procedures (aeronautics)).
  • Assemble mechanical, electromechanical and hydraulic systems based on instructions, assembly drawings, system subassemblies, components and appropriate raw materials.
  • Perform manual bench machining operations or on conventional machine tools (e.g. measure, rivet, saw, drill, file, rectify, thread, remove screws, bolts and threads, use a pipe-bending machine and rotate wire bobbins (AIMS)).
  • Calculate the thickness of shims required to meet the geometric tolerances (runout, parallelism, coaxially) of the drawings.
  • Use precision instruments to measure and control parts of various shapes (e.g. micrometer, vernier scale, microscope and electronic measuring devices).
The candidate we are looking for has:
  • Professional Study Diploma in Electromechanic. Any other equivalent combination of the required qualifications will be considered.
  • A minimum of 6 months of relevant experience.
  • Be familiar with precision standards.
  • Be familiar with occupational health and safety standards, especially WHMIS.
CAE is offering:
  • An environment where your initiatives will be recognized and valued.
  • The opportunity to work on a variety of projects in a multidisciplinary team.
  • Attractive benefits.
Come share your passion with us!
With more than 10,000 employees in 35 countries, CAE is a world leader in training in the fields of civil aviation, defense and security, and healthcare. To learn more:
www.cae.com
.
#LI-JJ1
Position Type

Temporary (Fixed Term)
CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.
Equal Employment Opportunity
At CAE, everyone is welcome to contribute to our success. With no exception.
As captured in our overarching value "One CAE", we’re proud to work as one passionate, boundaryless and inclusive team.
At CAE, all employees are welcome regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability or age.
The masculine form may be used in this job description solely for ease of reading, but refers to men, women and the gender diverse.

title: power brake operator - metal fabrication
description:
• or equivalent experience

Metal Forming or Shaping Operations Experience

  • Upsetting
  • Straightening
  • Splitting
  • Punching
  • Piercing
  • Forming
  • Flattening
  • Drawing
  • Cutting machine
  • Coining
  • Bending
  • Metal twisting

Credentials (certificates, licences, memberships, courses, etc.)

  • Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) Certificate
  • Overhead Crane Certification
  • Forklift Operator Certification

Equipment and Machinery Experience

  • Soldering or welding equipment
  • Saws
  • Riveters (power)
  • Punch presses
  • Power presses
  • Overhead crane
  • Lifting device
  • Hand tools
  • Furnace hand tongs
  • Drills
  • Automatic conveyor
  • Micrometers

Weight Handling

  • Up to 23 kg (50 lbs)

Work Setting

  • Structural steel fabrication company
  • Machinery manufacturer

Specific Skills

  • Select and transport material to work area manually or using crane or hoist
  • Remove metal pieces from furnace when colour or metal indicates proper forging temperature
  • Read and interpret specifications or follow verbal instructions
  • Position and adjust dies on anvil of forging machinery
  • Position heated or cooled metal pieces on die of press or other forging machinery
  • Place metal pieces in furnace
  • Operate presses or other forging machines to perform hot or cold forging to shape or form metal
  • Operate machines or equipment which weld, solder, bolt, screw or rivet metal parts together
  • Operate gas or oil fired furnace to heat metal to proper temperatures prior to forging
  • Clean and lubricate machinery and equipment
  • Check products for correct shapes, dimensions and other specifications
  • Document work completed
  • Build staging or erect scaffolding for heavy metalworking jobs
  • Cut, bend, roll, ream, punch, drill, weld or otherwise shape and form metal stock into parts or products

Work Site Environment

  • Noisy
  • Odours
  • Dusty

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities

  • Repetitive tasks
  • Handling heavy loads
  • Physically demanding
  • Manual dexterity
  • Attention to detail
  • Hand-eye co-ordination
  • Standing for extended periods

Personal Suitability

  • Flexibility
  • Team player
  • Excellent oral communication
  • Judgement
  • Organized

Health benefits

  • Health care plan
  • Disability benefits
  • Paramedical services coverage

Long term benefits

  • Group insurance benefits
  • Life insurance
  • Registered retirement savings plan (RRSP)
  • Long-term care insurance

Other benefits

  • Team building opportunities
  • Parking available
  • Travel insurance
  • Wellness program

Screening questions

  • Are you currently legally able to work in Canada?
  • Do you currently reside in proximity to the advertised location?
  • Are you willing to relocate for this position?
  • Do you have previous experience in this field of employment?

title: Electromécanicien, entretien de machines CNC et conventionne...
description:
Role and Responsibilities

Electromécanicien, entretien de machines CNC et conventionnelles

Vos défis

  • Réparer les machines-outils conventionnelles et numériques dont les équipements CNC 5 axe, tour, fraiseuses, etc.
  • Faire les entretiens préventifs, correctifs et des détections des anomalie mécanique, pneumatique et hydraulique.
  • Réparer divers systèmes liés à la production et leurs composantes mécaniques. hydrauliques et pneumatiques.
  • Réparer les outils hydropneumatiques tels que les riveteuses, perceuses et meuleuses.
  • Effectuer les ajustements, réglages et l’étalonnage des machines-outils.
  • Installer des composantes mécaniques sur les machines de production.
  • Lire et interpréter des plans techniques (électriques et mécanique, schéma de contrôle)
  • Rechercher les pièces et composantes pour réparation machines
  • Répondre aux divers appels d`urgence de bris de machine en dehors du quart de travail

Vos forces

  • Diplôme d’études collégiales (AEC ou DEC) en électromécanique, électronique ou autres études connexes.
  • 5 ans d’expérience dans la réparation de machine CNC ou autres machines-outils.
  • Essentiel : expérience de travail dans un environnement industriel.
  • Essentiel: connaître les différents types d’équipements : usinage, pompes industrielles. Essentiel : excellente connaissance en mécanique et en contrôle.
  • Posséder une connaissance du machinage et du fonctionnement des équipements CNC, un atout.
  • Connaissance de l’électricité, un atout.
  • Connaissance des techniques avancées d'entretien (alignement au laser, ultrasons, analyse d’huile, analyse de vibrations, etc.) un atout.
  • Bonne maîtrise des normes de santé et sécurité au travail.
  • Axé sur la résolution de problèmes.
  • Bon travailleur d’équipe.

Alors, venez partager votre passion avec nous!

Avec plus de 10 000 employés présents à travers 35 pays, CAE est un chef de file mondial en formation dans les domaines de l’aviation civile, de la défense et sécurité, et de la santé. Pour en apprendre plus :
www.cae.com
.
**********************************
Electromechanic, Maintenance of CNC and Conventional Machines
Your challenges
  • Repair conventional and digital machine tools including 5-axis CNC equipment, lathes, milling machines, etc.
  • Perform preventive and corrective maintenance and detect mechanical, pneumatic and hydraulic anomalies.
  • Repair various production-related systems and their mechanical, hydraulic and pneumatic components.
  • Repair hydropneumatic tools such as riveters, drills and grinders.
  • Adjust, set and calibrate machine tools.
  • Install mechanical components on production machines.
  • Read and interpret engineering drawings (electrical and mechanical, control diagrams).
  • Research parts and pieces for equipment repair
  • Answer and support off-shift emergency calls for broken equipment

Your strengths
  • College diploma (AEC or DEC) in electromechanics, electronics or other related studies.
  • 5 years' experience in CNC machine or other machine tool repair.
  • Essential: Experience in an industrial environment.
  • Essential: Knowledge of the various types of equipment: machining equipment, industrial pumps. Essential: excellent mechanics and control knowledge.
  • Knowledge of machining and operation of CNC equipment an asset.
  • Electrical knowledge an asset.
  • Knowledge of advanced maintenance techniques (laser alignment, ultrasounds, oil analysis, vibration analysis. etc.) an asset.
  • Knowledge of workplace health and safety standards.
  • Problem solver.
  • Good team player.
Come share your passion with us!

With more than 10,000 employees in 35 countries, CAE is a world leader in training in the fields of civil aviation, defense and security, and healthcare. To learn more:
www.cae.com
.
#LI-JJ1
Position Type

Regular
CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.

At CAE, everyone is welcome to contribute to our success. With no exception.
As captured in our overarching value "One CAE", we’re proud to work as one passionate, boundaryless and inclusive team.
At CAE, all employees are welcome regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability or age.

title: Industrial Mechanic / Millwright
description:
Do you like to fix things? Better yet do mainteance to prevent things from breaking?

Then please read bellow and let us know you are interested, because we are!

We are currently looking for an Industrial Mechanic / Millwright to join our winning team.

You have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple projects. You will also be responsible for the daily repair and upkeep of machinery to keep it running for a production environment.

What you'll do
Responsibilities

Troubleshooting emergency breakdowns

Preventative maintenance, fixing breakdowns and/or replacing parts on many different production machines such as: rollers, dimple punches, riveters, benders, brakes, presses, punches, and other machinery

Fabrication by drilling, milling, lathing, welding, operating many power tools as required to fix machines or build new parts

Working with different systems including pneumatic, hydraulic, power transmission, vacuums, clutches, some electrical, and more

Assisting on new projects or improvement plans for older machines

  • Reading blueprints, diagrams, and schematic drawings to determine work procedures
Inspecting and monitoring machinery and equipment for pinch points and safety hazards; installing safety devices as required

Changing and setting dies in certain departments

All other duties as assigned

What you'll need
Qualifications

  • Licensed Journeyman or comparable experience
  • Demonstrated ability to follow safe work practices and procedures
  • Able to problem solve and use critical thinking and decision-making skills
  • Able to follow oral and written directions
  • Able to function well in a team environment and to communicate clearly with others
  • Being flexible and adaptable
  • Having a proactive/preventive approach
  • Able to work with minimal supervision
  • Being punctual and reliable
  • Experience as an Industrial Mechanic in a similar environment would be a definite asset
A little bit about us
Imperial Manufacturing Group

Imperial Manufacturing Group is a leading manufacturer and supplier of heating, ventilation and structural building products for residential and commercial applications. Recognized as one of "Canada's Best Managed Companies - Platinum Club", our employees are valued and recognized as the key to our success; their growth is continually challenged and supported within our dynamic and diversified organization.

IMG believes that our entrepreneurial culture creates an environment that encourages and enables our employees to be at their best every day. Encouraging them to think on their feet, to take an idea from start to finish, to take ownership of their job, and to ultimately stay ahead of the competition.

Are you interested?
Work With Us

Competitve wages

Complete benefits package effective from your first day including:

Retirement savings plan

Paid personal days

Paid vacation time

Conituing Education / training programs

Paid volunteer day

Footwear and uniform program

Employee recognition programs

Employee Family Assistance Program

Leaders who support your development

Work with a diverse, dynamic, high-performing team

Imperial Manufacturing Group is a leading manufacturer and supplier of heating, ventilation and structural building products for residential and commercial applications. Imperial Manufacturing Group's remarkable story began 1979 in the small Atlantic Canadian community of Richibucto, New Brunswick. Today, we are world-class manufacturer, with facilities across Canada and the United States.

Recognized as one of "Canada's Best Managed Companies - Platinum Member", our employees are valued and recognized as the key to our success; their growth is continually challenged and supported within our dynamic and diversified organization.
