title: Lab Technician
description:
R&D Lab Technician

Reporting to the Validation Manager, The Lab Technician is responsible for Product Validation; ensure products being tested meet or exceed applicable safety standards, and internal (WSL) performance, appearance and durability requirements. Supports New Product Development by participating in all aspects of new product design, development, fabrication, assembly and testing. Additionally provides input as part of a cross functional team to aid in the resolution of field issues with current and past production units.
Key Responsibilities:

  • Perform performance & validation testing; including but not limited to:
  • Input Rates, leakage, Combustion, surface, enclosure and component temperatures, P.4, BOC’s, POC’s, Delayed Ignition, Wind, and Durability. Proficient at 5G3 Emission testing, (specialized skill – some candidates).
  • CSA/UL Standard, drop test, airflow, speed voltage/current testing, control logic and function, PCB and electronical component/sub assembly testing etc.
  • Validation of technical documentation; including assembly, installation and service procedures for appliances and accessories.
  • Accurately using and calibrating, R&D equipment; including but not limited to:
  • Mechanical: Data acquisition, Combustion Analyzer, Thermometers, Thermocouples, Voltmeters, Manometers, Flow Meters, Thermesthesiometer, IR Gun, IR Camera, Camera and 5G3.
  • Electrical: Digital Multimeter, (voltage, current, resistance, continuity, etc.), Electrical safety compliance tester, (hipot dielectric, ground bond, resistance tester, megger, etc.), function generator, oscilloscope, clamp ammeter, leakage current tester, power analyzer, ac / dc fixed and variable power supplies.
  • Data collection, analysis and reporting focusing on accuracy and completeness. Storing all raw data, photographs, processed data, videos, reports etc. correctly in company testing project folders. Appropriately recording, analyzing and interpreting results to generate appropriate conclusions and recommendations.
  • Effectively collaborate with project / production coordinators for product reviews, (DFM, DFA, DFI, DFS), benchmarking (competitors and existing products), design review, testing reviews and in doing so provide relevant data, recommendations and conclusions regarding manufacturability, performance, cost reduction or durability.
  • Where applicable collaborate with QA to provide support for root cause analysis.
  • Sheet Metal Layout and Fabrication: Creating hand sketches for self or others to use for the purpose of making sample parts, limited prototypes and communicating changes to project coordinators or designers. Producing sample parts from sketches using R&D equipment.
  • Build and assemble prototype units: Assemble prototypes from production parts, prototype, or modified components or samples. Modify parts as required for prototypes using a variety of techniques.
  • Consistently report relevant findings and new information in company ‘Lessons Learned’ spreadsheet / database with a view to improve future products and/or test procedures.
  • Planning daily, weekly and monthly work for assigned projects based on timing deadlines and test input from project coordinators. Including determining the time and materials required to complete; where necessary informing the project coordinator regarding constraints, resources required and recommendations to ensure on time completion at reasonable cost. Meet assigned deadlines, where necessary taking corrective actions to recover lost time or use of preapproved overtime.
  • Safe use and operation, (where applicable after training), of R&D construction equipment. Including but not limited to: Welder, Plasma Cutter, Band Saw, Drill Press, Glass Cutter, Belt Sander, Bench Grinder, Paint Booth operation, Paint Storage, Metal Shear, Metal Break etc.
  • Power Tools: Disc Grinder, Drills, Air Nailer, Air riveters, Jig Saw, Sawzall, and Circular Saw etc.
  • Hand tools: driver/gum etc.
  • Safe operation of forklift, (where licensed and authorized)
  • Use of company prescribed health and safety equipment appropriate for the tool and/or work area.
  • Ensuring a safe and professional work area is maintained, including proper storage of all tools and equipment, work area to be clean, well-organized and presentable on a daily basis, considering the application of 5S. Promptly identify safety concerns to lab project coordinator, supervisor and or manager and advise other associates in the event of observing unsafe practices.
  • Undertake certification testing for assigned projects in collaboration with project coordinator and 3rd party testing agency ensuring a focus on correct testing methods and procedures to the relevant standard.

General Daily responsibilities:

  • Be on time and adequately prepared for all meetings
  • Work to the project direction of their assigned PC or Technology manager during product development
  • Report SR&ED time and materials weekly
  • Keep Task Board up to date
  • Know companies monthly core value and how it is intended to be applied
  • Dress code in effect
  • Technical Support for Production Department
  • Maintain and Calibrate Lab Equipment
  • Work independently or in conjunction with Hearth R&D team, Review and Update Work Instructions and Forms
  • Provide occasional support for sample / show set-up for events within the company and at third party locations.

Education & Experience:

  • College Diploma in Engineering Technology or equivalent and/or Directly Related Experience
  • Minimum 2 years relevant experience, ideally as Engineering Technician/Technologist, 5 years with Directly Related Experience in gas or HVAC products and applications and/or sheet metal manufacturing including product assembly.
  • Required: Blue Print reading. Gas/Wood: G3 or WETT (to be completed within 2 years) National Fireplace Institute (NFI) gas, wood and/or pellet (superior candidates), G2 (superior candidate).
  • HVAC: ODP Certificate
  • Microsoft Office, (strong excel is a recognized asset; i.e. data analysis, charting, macros, formula, etc.), Visual, Internet Research Skills, Solidworks fundamentals (is an asset), Labview (superior candidates)
  • Specialized Skills: Welder/Fitter (preferred), SolidWorks Fundamentals (preferred), GD&T Tolerance, WSL Forklift License (preferred), trained in problem solving, DFMEA, risk assessment six sigma (superior candidates)
  • Demonstrated knowledge of AC/DC fundamentals, DC circuity, PCB and power calculations for electrical technicians.
  • HVAC: Clear understanding of refrigeration cycles, brazing, charging systems, refrigeration piping, layout, AC circuitry up to 600 volts.

IGNITE YOUR CAREER,
Some of our competitive benefits include:

  • Competitive Compensation / Wages
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP/DPSP)
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Life insurance and disability coverage
  • Associate Purchase Programs, Product Discounts, In-house Sales
  • Appreciation Events, Raffles, Draws, Fundraising, BBQ’s, Competitions
  • Napoleon Cares – Associates helping Associates
  • Employee Assistance Plan
  • Napoleon Recognition Program
  • GOevisits, virtual doctor visits
  • And more!

The Napoleon Group of Companies is committed to fair and accessible employment practices that attract and retain Associates with disabilities. This includes providing accessibility across all stages of the employment cycle. Accommodation is available upon request.
We thank you for your interest in The Napoleon Group of Companies and for participating in our competition. Only those candidates selected for consideration will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Barrie, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Laboratory Technicians: 1 year (preferred)

title: Structural Assembler / Fitter (Aircraft)
description:
A well reputed multinational company from Aerospace Industry having its operations in the USA & Canada is looking for the following position preferably Kelowna BC, Canada or nearby area.

Position: Structural Assembler / Fitter (Aircraft)

Description:

Looking for the independent, a self-starter and experience aircraft structural assembler / Fitter specialized for Boeing 737, 757 & 767 with a wide range technician services with focus on customer satisfaction. Willing to accept challenges and take initiatives regarding Boeing aircrafts assembling / fitting technical works. 

Aircraft Structures Technicians perform line and heavy maintenance as well as repairs and modifications. In this role you can be working on interior modifications, cargo door installations, winglet installations, cargo conversions air tanker conversions, and other interesting projects on aircraft Boeing 737, 757, 767 respectively.

Our client KF Aerospace is fast growing and worth mentioning as one of the best shop for the assembling, fitting and conversion dedicated to customer satisfaction sincere to their core values.

Requirements:

Technical

  • Cleanliness and organized work perimeters is required.
  • HSE (Health, Safety & Environmental) Compliance is mandatory.
  • Inspection and completing repairs of aircraft structures in accordance with Service Bulletins (SB), Airworthiness Directives (AD), Aircraft Manuals and Engineering drawings
  • Inspection and assessment of corrosion and damage to aircraft structures
  • Design and layout repairs according to the Structural Repair Manual (SRM)
  • Construction and set up of jigs and fixtures
  • Sealant of metal and composite surfaces
  • Installation of fasteners
  • Treatment of metals and corrosion
  • Assembly and fitting of parts
  • Repair, replace, and modify metal alloy and composite structures
  • Fabrication of sheet metal parts
  • Ability to source and use correct composite materials for bonding a fastener or simple repair
  • Understanding of aircraft fastener codes and uses/installations
  • Source appropriate calibrated tooling for the jobs
Work Ethics & Peer Relation
  • Professionalism when dealing with peers.
  • Respect each employee.
  • Follow up as and when required regarding employees and departments.
  • Suggest communication protocols for healthy communication.
  • Punctual attendance is required.
  • Accurate, clarity, precision and focused approach.
Other responsibilities

Documentation & Administration

  • Ensures appropriate documentation is completed accurately and on time and submitted to a senior Technician or Shift Lead for ACA approval
  • Sources required technical information in maintenance manuals
  • Ability to complete ERP processes and procedures correctly
  • Other Misc. duties as and when required assigned by the supervisor.
Safety Responsibilities:

Applying safe work practices in all job duties, including:

  • Wearing all appropriate PPE (personal protective equipment)
  • Understanding and applying the Risk Management System
  • Understanding and applying Health & Safety Policies
  • Maintaining good housekeeping and cleanliness standards
  • Understanding and applying safe handling practices with the aircraft

Experience:

  • Transport Canada Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (Structures) License and minimum 3 years’ experience performing maintenance and/or modifications on commercial aircraft, including large Boeing Aircraft; or
  • Equivalent license from foreign country (would be considered unlicensed in Canada) and minimum 5 years of experience performing maintenance and/or modifications on commercial aircraft, including large Boeing Aircraft 737, 757, 767.
  • Minimum of 7 years’ experience performing maintenance and/or modifications on commercial aircraft, including large Boeing Aircraft.
  • Unlicensed mechanics are expected to have the willingness and qualifications to obtain a Transport Canada license within 1 year.

Education:

Diploma Equivalent

Professional Qualification:

Transport Canada Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (Structures) License.

Skills & Professional Requirements:

  • Experienced Boeing assembling, fitting and conversion.
  • Pass all drug/alcohol screening tests, background, and reference checks provided eligibility to work in Canada..
  • Excellent listener and a problem solver.
  • Teamwork and independent worker as required.
  • Precise and clear communicator
  • Work under pressure and handle change management
  • Positive attitude and strong work ethic
  • Demonstrated organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to learn and understand the company's organizational systems and workflow
  • Ability to work effectively independently and as part of a team
  • Good oral and written communication skills
  • Able to effectively train apprentices
  • Ability to accept constructive criticism
  • Basic computer skills and familiarity with Intranet
  • Willing to pursue additional company training as required

Physical Skills:

  • Walk; lift up to 75lbs, crawl, and bend, climb, stretch and willing to work tiresome position for long time as required.
  • Can climb ladders.
  • Not having high Height phobia.
  • Must be able to meet the physical demands of the position
  • Flexibility to work any type of shift rotation
  • Work is conducted in English

HSE & Work Environment skills:

  • Work under extreme temperatures and inclement weather as required.
  • Can work up to 50 feet in height.
  • Shall accept to work for long hours, available in emergency, work over time and may require weekends.
  • Ability to deal with extensive exposure to noise, dust, smells, fumes present in an aviation environment.

Remuneration:

Compensation is dependent on experience and is negotiable that fits the company needs in terms of Professional Qualifications and skill set.

Job Location:

Kelowna BC, Canada.

Note: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)

title: Modifications Associate - Assembler
description:

Reports To: Modifications and Plastic Lumber Supervisor or Operations Manager


Job Purpose:  

A Modifications Associate is responsible for the timely and accurate building of waste and recycling containers which are assembled to the customer’s specifications.


Key Responsibilities and Accountability:

  • Product Assembly
  • Comfortable using hand/power tools, power drills, saws, levels, etc.
  • Assist with lifting and moving product on the production floor and moving inventory to various locations using a pallet jack
  • Maintain a clean and safe working environment by sweeping, emptying garbage containers, tidying up materials, keeping walkways free from obstructions etc.
  • General maintenance & other warehouse duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

· Previous experience in wood working, cabinet making and/or construction would be considered an asset but not required

· Ability to complete repetitive tasks at times

· Must be able to lift 50lbs and stand for extended periods of time.

· Positive Attitude and Team Player



Other Responsibilities:

Every employee of Busch Systems, Including the Modifications Associate is responsible for acknowledging and striving to uphold the following statement:


“At Busch Systems, our core philosophy of ‘People, Planet, Product’ is central to our values and corporate culture. Specifically, in our sustainability practices, we recognize that by constantly striving to reach a higher standard of environmental accountability, we can encourage our colleagues, suppliers and clients to do the same. By making a conscious commitment to be eco-responsible in our business practices, Busch Systems aims to be sustainably impactful in communities on a local, national and worldwide level.”

title: Assembler
description:
Welcome to Mir, firm specializing in the recruitment of technical, administrative and executives, for companies in the grandeur of Quebec.

We are currently looking for assemblers for our industrial partner, a family business Québécoise based in Laval, manufactures high quality vans, designed to carry all types of goods.

Main tasks:

  • Assemble the different van components;
  • use with care the tools needed for the manufacture of vans (drill, riveter, floor nailer, measuring tape, etc.);
  • Respect the rules and Health and safety procedures;
  • perform any other related tasks as needed.

Requirements:

  • own 6 months to 1 year of production in manufacturing production or other relevant experience (asset);
  • have a very good dexterity and be meticulous;
  • Experience in manipulation of various and specialized tools (drill, riveter, pneumatic shock, grinder, etc.);
  • reading plans;
  • have good physical capacity (capacity to lift loads of less than 50 pounds).

working conditions:

  • Permanent posts- 40h / week, day and evening;
  • day schedule: from 6:15 to 14:45, 6:30 to 15:00 or 7:00 to 15:30, Monday to Friday,
  • evening schedule: from 16h00 to 2h30 , from Monday to Thursday,
  • salary: $ 18.00 / h at hiring, $ 18.90 / h after 3 months of probation and $ 19.85 / h after 1 year;
  • evening premium offered $ 2.15 / h.

Advantages:

  • competitive program d 'collective assurances (medical and paramedical expense insurance, dental insurance, short and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, travel assistance);
  • RRSP (registered retirement savings plan) and RPDB (Deferred Participation Plan for Bene in contribution from the employer;
  • employment stability year round (40 hours a week) and possibility to make extra time (more bonus);
  • easily accessible by public transport / on-site parking;
  • Competitive remuneration and first salary overhaul after 3 months;
  • $ 2.15 / hour evening bonus;
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program;
  • Full Integration Plan;
  • Specific Training Programs by Post;
  • Numerous possibilities of Internal career path;
  • Employer-funded cafeteria service;
  • allowance for the purchase of clothing and safety boots;
  • Reference program with $ 1,000 bonus;
  • activities of the social club and more !!

Please note that only the successful candidate (e) s will be contacted.
Communicate with us:
Phone: 514 494-4414 / Fax: 514 494-5374

title: Structures Technician (AME S License)
description:
Company Description

Kenn Borek Air (KBA) is a diversified worldwide aircraft charter and leasing operation.  The KBA Maintenance team is currently seeking an individual to join the Structures team in the role of Structures Technician. This full time position is based in Calgary, AB working Monday to Friday 7:30 am to 4:00 pm. Opportunity for overtime through project based weekend hours.

Job Description

The Structures Shop Technician is responsible for all aeronautical product repair or overhaul assigned; for the standards of their work, and that all work performed is in accordance with the requirements of the Company MCM, and the Canadian Aviation Regulations.

  • Shall ensure that all maintenance activities carried out are accomplished in strict conformity with the Canadian Aviation Regulations and Standards, and Company Policies and Procedures.
  • Shall supervise all Structures Shop Trainees and apprentices for which they are assigned in order to guide the trainee in his / her duties and to ensure that they comply with all applicable requirements of the Company MCM and the Canadian Aviation Regulations.
  • Shall identify and recommend to the Structures Shop Supervisor improvements and/or necessary changes to the shop component build sheets, or to any shop standards or procedures.
  • Shall inform the Structures Shop Supervisor of any defective tooling and recommend new tooling or enhancements to present tooling as required.
  • Shall ensure that all shop areas are kept clean, orderly, and organized.
  • Shall carry out any other task as assigned by the Structures Shop Supervisor.
  • Shall inspect and certify aircraft and aeronautical products on behalf of the organization in accordance with their applicable Company Certification Authorization.
  • Shall, in a courteous and professional manner work with customers, vendors and coworkers to ensure a safe and efficient operation.
Qualifications

  • Transport Canada certified AME-S license preferred
  • Minimum 3 years experience
  • DHC-6 and/or DC-3T experience preferred
  • Ability to read and interpret mechanical/engineering drawings and technical instructions
  • Must be familiar with a variety of hand tools, and sheet-metal equipment


Additional Information

Kenn Borek Air offers a comprehensive employment package containing competitive wages, excellent company funded benefits program, a wellness flexible spending account and a RRSP matching program. And sometimes it is the little gestures such as receiving paid time off to enjoy your birthday!

Pre-employment Drug and Alcohol screening, resulting in a negative test result, is a condition of employment. Screening is provided at KBA expense and will be conducted, where possible, on the first day of employment.

Mandatory full immunization against Covid-19 is a condition of employment.

title: Assemblers (Afternoon Shift)
description:
Assemblers

Curtiss-Wright are looking for three Assembler for our afternoon shift (3.30pm -- 2am) to join our Indal team at our Mississauga position. These new roles are to support our growing business in implementing an afternoon shift to support our increased workload.

If you are passionate about your work and interested in progressing your career with a global company, we want to hear from you! Immediate interviews and start dates available.

Location: Mississauga, ON

Your Challenge:


* Preparing material for welding using various processes, including chemical etching
* Performing drill press operations (drill, tap and read to drawing specification, counterbore and countersink, sharpen drill bits)
* Installing bushings and bearings, helicoils and rivets
* Setting up and test assembled products as required by test procedures
* Operating brake press, punch press, drills (radial and spindle), shear, saw(s)

Your Expertise:


* Must have a minimum of 5 years industrial fabricating/fitting experience, or assembly experience and must be able to assembly complex, high precision machined components to drawing requirements in an accurate and cost-effective manner
* Must have the potential to fabricate and/or assemble complete tube assemblies and hydraulic assemblies to drawings and hydraulic schematics
* Experience setting up and running both conventional and programmable brake presses an asset
* Must be to read and work from work orders and engineering drawings
* Ability to operate forklifts, overhead cranes, plate clamps, slings and chains
* Experience working with height gauges, dial indicators, steel square, tape rules, angle plates, layout table, micrometers and verniers, radius gauges, thread gauges, protractors and combination squares, gauge blocks and parallels
* Proficient in the use of electric and pneumatic tools, riveting tools, helicoil insert tools, tapping machines, bench grinders, circular saws, jig saws, portable nibbler, band saws and cut off saws

This position may require exposure to export-controlled information and subject to additional security screening. In the event information provided during the security screening reveals ineligibility to access export-controlled information, any offer of employment may be reconsidered or withdrawn.

Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Aircraft Structures (AME "S") / Sheet-metal Technician - Peterborough Location
description:
Flying Colours Corp is a global leader in all aspects of aircraft completions and maintenance. With facilities in Canada, USA, and Singapore our continued growth and success is driven by our talented workforce that embody our core values: integrity, innovation and flexibility.

Due to continued growth in our businesses, we have a requirement for an Aircraft Structures / Sheet-metal Technician to join our Team at our Peterborough, Ontario location.



General Accountability

Work with aircraft structural materials and is involved in the repair, installation, modification and inspection of these materials. Responsible for assembly, fit and install of aircraft skins, frames and structural parts. Technicians assemble and install structures including sheet metal extrusion and composite structures and possess knowledge of assembly jigs and tools. Future structural technicians will work with completed assemblies and will be systems integrators


Specific Accountabilities

  • Sheet Metal Technicians are expected to work safely and efficiently at all times.
  • Candidates should have general knowledge of aircraft structural fabrication, including repairing, modifying, refurbishing, and fabricating structural and other components.
  • Candidates must be able to understand and work from mechanical drawings as well as other written instructions and design specifications. Strong mathematical knowledge is required, as is the ability to make accurate measurements and finish materials to a high level of quality and precision.
  • Performs work in a productive, diligent, careful and safe manner.
  • Complete any special projects or other tasks as required or assigned. May be assigned to other areas of operations, based on business or customer requirements.
  • Works in compliance with all Administrative, Health & Safety policies and procedures as per legislative requirements and as outlined in Company policies.

Experience and Education Requirements

    • Completion of secondary school is required.
    • Completion of College/CEGEP/vocational/technical training in Structural Repair.
    • Completed a recognized apprenticeship program, and/or have a minimum of +4 years industry related experience.
    • Possession or working towards a Transport Canada AME "S" license is highly preferred.

Skills/Abilities

  • Ability to read and interpret mechanical/engineering drawings and technical instructions.
  • Must be familiar with a variety of hand tools, and sheet-metal equipment.
  • Ability to understand and follow direction with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to work as part of a team, where tasks may be shared or reallocated daily.
  • Good mobility, manual dexterity and physical condition to work in areas within the aircraft where access may be limited.
  • Proven ability to communicate effectively orally and written.
  • Positive attitude and willingness to learn.
  • Ability to trouble-shoot and problem-solve.
  • Ability to maintain professional work habits at all times.
  • Excellent planning, organization and coordination skills.
  • Excellent judgement and strong attention to detail.

Working Conditions

  • Regular periods during which physical effort is required, e.g., walking standing, stooping, climbing, lifting material or equipment, some of which may be heavy or awkward.
  • Exposure to factors such as temperature variations/extremes, fumes, moving machinery, humidity, and materials which can cause periods of discomfort.
  • Frequent need to give concentrated attention, with one or two senses at a time, where stimuli are changing.
  • Noticeable direct and indirect pressure from deadlines, production quotas, accuracy or similar demands.

Working Hours

This is a full-time (FT) position where hours will change due to business operational needs and flexibility is required. Shifts can be of any of the following assignments:

  • Rotational shift (2 weeks on days) from 7am to 4pm and (2 weeks on afternoons) from 3pm to 12am
  • 4 on 4 off (12 hrs/day) from 6:30am to 6:30pm
  • Mon-Fri from 3pm to 12am

Compensation

We offer competitive compensation to qualified and highly motivated candidates. Please note that applicants for these positions must have current status to work in Canada in order to be considered for this opportunity.


While we appreciate all resumes received,we can only contact directly those applicants under consideration for interview.


Flying Colours Corp. is proud to participate in the Legislated Employment Equity Program (LEEP). We welcome applications from all qualified candidates including candidates representing the four designated groups: Women, member of Visible Minorities, Aboriginal Peoples and Persons with Disabilities.

title: Structures Technician
description:
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

The Structures Engineer or Technician maintains or modifies different types of aircraft to aviation standards. The incumbent possesses the ability to interpret drawings and complete.

Responsibilities

  •  Maintain and modify aircraft to an aviation standard. Be able to read drawings and take instruction and work to industry standards
  • Looking for high quality workmanship with attention paid to detail
  • Maintain a tidy work area and be able to keep accurate work records
  • Work in a high paced environment. A willingness to get the job done
  • Open to the idea of travel and working in and outside of Canada

Requirements:

  • All levels of experience will be considered.
  • Approved aviation course preferred.
  • AME (S) rated is preferred. (Pay scale is based on experience)
  • Experience preferred but not required. Must hold a clean driving abstract
  • Approved training course completed is preferred (ICS also accepted)
  • Interpret Manuals/Drawings/Technical Data/Process standards
  • Good Hand skills
  • Communication (Spoken and written) take direction
  • Ability to work at heights and confined spaces
  • Able to work independently and in a team environment.
  • Reliable and punctual

title: ASSEMBLEUR-MONTEUR
description:
Poste d'électromécanicien - permanent - jour - Montréal

Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d'un électromécanicien de jour pour venir rejoindre une compagnie en pleine expansion.

A titre d'électromécanicien, vous aurez à effectuer le montage des modules mécaniques. Vous aurez aussi à faire la réparation, l'entretien électrique, pneumatique et hydraulique.



Avantages
- Horaire de jour (lundi au jeudi de 8h à 17h et vendredi de 8h à 14h30)
- Salaire entre 24$ et 28$ selon l'expérience
- Avantages sociaux payés à 50% par l'employeur

Responsabilités
Montage de panneaux ou colonnes, structure, boulonnage des modules des équipements et carrosserie et de mécanique.
Assister les électromécaniciens à faire la réparation et l’entretien électrique, pneumatique et hydraulique de l’équipement de garagiste chez les clients sur l’île de Montréal et les environs.
Travail sur la route; camion fourni.

Qualifications
- DEP en assemblage métallique, mécanique industrielle ou électromécanique
- Lecture de plan


Sommaire
Votre prochain emploi n’est peut-être qu’à un clic… Postulez et appelez Jean-Daniel pour discuter des détails de l’offre ou des différentes opportunités d’emploi disponibles.

Contactez-nous au 514-206-3577. Vous pouvez aussi nous envoyer directement votre CV à jean-daniel.paquet@randstad.ca

Si vous connaissez des gens qui pourraient être intéressés par cette opportunité, référez-les nous! Vous pourriez obtenir une prime de référencement de 200$. Ils n’ont qu’à mentionner votre nom.

Vous êtes déjà à l’emploi et cherchez à améliorer vos conditions de travail? Postulez sans crainte! Nos politiques en matière de confidentialité sont très claires : nous ne communiquerons pas avec votre employeur actuel sans votre accord.

title: Machine Assembler (Custom)
description:
Machine Assembler (Custom)
Location: Mississauga, ON

Our client is looking for skilled Custom Machine Assemblers for brand new machinery, who have experience in customized machine assembly. 
Our client operates a safe, clean facility and considers security and safety their top priority.

The Assembler would be working on various machines designed for the plastic industry. Some travel will be required once the Assembler is quite familiar and comfortable in the role.

Skills: 
 
  • Extensive knowledge of custom equipment and machinery.
  • Some pneumatics experience and plastics industry knowledge is an asset
  • Efficient time-management skills
  • High school diploma/GED required

Responsibilities:
  • Read and interpret blueprints, schematics and detailed drawings for custom designed equipment and machinery. Plastics industry knowledge is an asset. 
  • Assembling parts and fitting sections of production machinery.
  • Align and calibrate machinery and equipment parts as required for efficient and safe operation
  • Dismantle equipment when required for repair or transportation and reassemble it at the appropriate time.
  • Set up of equipment at designated location

Compensation and benefits
  • 100% company paid benefits (after probationary period)
  • 3 paid sick days per calendar year, vacation (2 weeks/3 weeks after 5 years/ 4 weeks after 10 years)
  • RRSP with company match at 2%

Day Shift only:
Monday to Thursday - 6:50am to 3:50pm
Friday - 6:50am to 12:50pm

All qualified candidates are invited to apply

Keywords: Brampton, Oakville, Georgetown, Bolton, Toronto, Etobicoke, Vaughan, Acton, Milton, Mechanical Assembler, Custom Machine Assembler, Mechanical Machine Assembler, Machine Builder

title: Textile Assembly Associate
description:
Job Title: Textile Assembly Associate

Employee Classification: Full-Time, Day Shift

Location: Barrie, Ontario

Start Date: June, 2022

We are looking for people who have a positive attitude, willingness to learn and enjoy a stimulating and fast-paced environment. We offer training onsite with opportunities for growth in a culturally inclusive atmosphere. Cober is a family owned business operating over 105 years and has expanded to three locations in Ontario with more than 190 employees. We are one of Canada’s largest commercial printers and ship over 2 million orders a year! We are proud of our technical innovations and are constantly investing in our manufacturing capabilities.

Why Choose Cober?

  • Eligible for comprehensive Family Health Care after 90 days
  • We offer stable secure employment (a company who has grown during the pandemic)
  • Overtime available
  • Referral bonus program
  • Lunches, contests and fun events hosted by our Social Committee

Job Summary:

This position will report directly to the Production Supervisor. They will be responsible for operating sewing machines to assemble pillows with accuracy and speed, to meet company production demands and quality standards.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Operate sewing machines, replacing needle and thread as needed.
  • Prepare textiles such as blankets and pillows for customer orders.
  • Enter orders into the computer system, create labels and compare quality to monitor.
  • Monitor stock to ensure adequate levels of supplies are available.
  • Fill finished casing with appropriate inserts.
  • Bag finished products using Belco machines.
  • Bag sealers for inventory.
  • Scan images into inventory.
  • Stack finished products in appropriate locations for shipping.
  • Maintain a clean and safe working environment.
  • Comply with all OSHA rules and regulations.
  • Complete other duties as assigned by the production supervisor.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Previous experience working in a warehouse environment is considered an asset.
  • Basic sewing experience is preferred.
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Computer proficiency with the ability to navigate basic software/internet functions.
  • Strong hand eye coordination.
  • Excellent time management skills with the ability to focus on tasks at hand.
  • Self-motivated with the initiative to learn and be trained on various types of equipment and processes.

If this opportunity sounds like a great fit for you, please apply today!

Cober Printing Limited is an equal opportunity employer and committed to providing an inclusive, diverse and barrier-free work environment. Through a diverse and inclusive workforce we aim to combat inequity and have a positive impact both with our staff and our community, beginning with our hiring process.

If, at any time during the evaluation process, you require accommodation, please use the contact information to make arrangements for specialized accommodation. Any information received regarding accommodation will be kept confidential.

We thank all applicants for their interest in Cober however, only candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted.





PI177171881

title: Assembleur - jour ou soir
description:
Tu es à la recherche de stabilité et d’un emploi à long terme dans les environs de Saint-Léonard ?
Tu veux débuter une carrière au sein d’une entreprise reconnue et en pleine croissance ?
Tu es à l’aise à travailler dans des environnements divers, stimulants et variés ?

Nous avons un super poste d’assembleur dans lequel il faudra assurer la préparation, l’assemblage et l’emballage des commandes et produits de l'entreprise.


Avantages
Quels sont les AVANTAGES de ce poste d’assembleur à Saint-Léonard ?

- Grande facilité d’accès en transports en commun.
- Le stationnement pour les employés est disponible.
- Plusieurs avantages sociaux après l’embauche.
- Temps plein (40h).
- Un salaire de 16.00 à 18.00$.


Responsabilités
Quelles sont les RESPONSABILITÉS de ce poste d’assembleur à Saint-Léonard ?

- Manutention des boites.
- Manipuler le matériel avec soin en combinant sécurité et rapidité.
- Préparation et assemblage des commandes.
- Emballage de la marchandise.
- Suivi minutieux des stocks.
- Trier et manipuler les colis.
- Conduite de transpalettes si nécessaire.
- Autres tâches connexes.

Qualifications
Quelles sont les QUALIFICATIONS de ce poste d’assembleur à Saint-Léonard ?

- De l’expérience dans le domaine industriel.
- Une bonne condition physique.
- Travail précis et minutieux.
- De l’autonomie.
- De la ponctualité.
- Être travaillant et motivé.

Sommaire
Est-ce que ce poste vous intéresse ? Si vous souhaitez rejoindre une belle équipe de travail expérimentée et bien établie, contactez-nous rapidement.
N'hésitez pas à suivre notre page Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/JobsemploiMTL pour ne manquer aucune opportunité !!
Pour postuler :

- Contactez-nous à l’adresse suivante : selma.harrous@randstad.ca ou stephaniealain-trudel@randstad.ca.
- Pour nous texter : 438-340-6815
- Par téléphone au 514-745-9981.

Ce poste n’est pas ce que vous cherchez ? N’hésitez pas à nous contacter quand même : nous avons assurément d’autres postes qui pourraient sûrement vous convenir.

Profitez de notre programme de référencement. Référez nous un ami et vous aurez la chance de recevoir un bonus de 100$ sur votre paie.

title: Junior Production Technician (12 month term) (Ottawa, ON, CA)
description:
BWXT Medical Ltd. provides its customers, who conduct life-saving medical procedures for patients around the world, the benefit of decades of experience in the development, manufacturing, packaging and delivery of medical isotopes and radiopharmaceuticals. Headquartered in Kanata, Ontario, BWXT Medical Ltd. employs over 300 highly-skilled people in Kanata and Vancouver, British Columbia. BWXT Medical Ltd. is part of the BWXT nuclear power segment (NPG) of BWX Technologies, Inc.

 

We are recruiting for a Junior Production Technician (12-month term) for our facility in Kanata, Ontario.


JOB SUMMARY

 

The Junior Production Technician must have the ability to learn, understand and implement Medical Isotope process and procedures as well as procedures pertaining to radiation and industrial safety.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

 

  • Routinely perform duties related to the processing of highly regulated products within the Medical Isotopes production area.
  • Perform the complete production process cycle which consists of material, equipment and facility preparation, product processing, order dispensing, product packaging, process documentation and execute emergency shutdown procedures.
  • Perform general housekeeping and other related duties as required.


QUALIFICATIONS

 

  • Normally, candidates must have a minimum post-secondary graduate (3 years) education or related experience in an appropriate science discipline and approximately 12 months experience in radioisotope production.

 

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

 

  • Work with manipulators: therefore the candidate must have good grip strength to move materials around behind a lead glass window on a frequent basis and full range of motion of fingers, wrists, elbows and shoulders.
  • Be able to push and pull hand carts with an initial and end force of up to 25kgs on an occasional basis.
  • Be able to safely lift up to 5kgs on a frequent basis and 10kgs on an occasional basis.
  • Have good vision either corrected or uncorrected.
  • Be able to stand for up to 3 hours at a time.
  • Must be able to remain in a clean room for potentially up to 3 hours at a time.
  • Shift work and overtime requirements.

 

We thank you for your interest, however, only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.

 

BWXT Medical Ltd. embraces diversity of thought, values individuality, encourages new perspectives and provides equal opportunity in employment for all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, disability, a conviction for which a pardon has been granted or a record suspended or any other category protected by federal law.

title: Assembly, assembly and wiring of control panels
description:
ProKontrolestle plus important distributeur en contrôles de chauffage, ventilation, air climatisé et réfrigération (CVACR) pour bâtiments commerciaux au Canada. Nous offrons les principales marques de contrôles CVAC sous le même toit.

Plus qu’un fournisseur…une solution!En plus des produits et du support pour les pièces, nous offrons des services de mise à niveau « retrofit », de mise en marche, de support technique téléphonique et sur chantier, d’ingénierie, d’assemblage de panneaux, de dessins et plan de câblage et de programmation et configuration.  Depuis plus de 35 ans, ProKontrol connaît une croissance continue et constante avec des succursales à Laval, Longueuil, Québec, Toronto et Halifax en plus de nos installations de combustion.

Une carrière au sein de notre équipe vous intéresse?  

Assemblage, Montage & Câblage de Panneaux de contrôles

Principales responsabilités

  • Analyser les dessins d'atelier et les schémas électriques
  • Préparer le matériel, les outils et l’équipement nécessaire pour l’assemblage
  • Procéder à la fabrication de panneaux de contrôle (perçage, assemblage, etc.)
  • Effectuer le câblage selon les normes de l’industrie (CVAC et Combustion)
  • Monter les boîtes VAV et les panneaux de contrôles selon les spécifications aux dessins d’atelier
  • Collaborer au montage des trains de gaz et autres équipements de combustion
  • S’assurer du contrôle de qualité sur les produits avant la livraison chez le client
  • Effectuer la configuration, le paramétrage, les tests et les ajustements des systèmes Prolon
  • Aider à la réception/expédition selon les besoins
  • S’assurer de maintenir à jour ses connaissances de l'évolution des produits au niveau technologique
  • Effectuer l’entretien des aires de travail de l’atelier

Qualifications requises

  • DEC en mécanique du bâtiment, instrumentation ou électricité
  • Minimum de 2 à 3 ans d’expérience dans un environnement d’atelier
  • Être capable de lire et comprendre des diagrammes électriques
  • À l’aise avec l’informatique et la manipulation de rapports
  • Bilingue, un atout

Compétences

  • Travail d’équipe
  • Polyvalence
  • Minutie et bonne dextérité manuelle
  • Capacité d’apprentissage
  • Bonne vitesse d’exécution
  • Initiative
  • Ponctualité

Bénéfices

  • Rémunération compétitive
  • Gamme complète d’avantages sociaux
  • Place de stationnement, cuisine et café offert
  • Possibilité d’évoluer au sein de l’entreprise
  • Formation continue offerte à tous
  • BBQ et autres festivités
  • Défis techniques et nombreux produits à découvrir!

Poste Permanent • Temps Plein • Succursale Laval

title: Electrical Assembler
description:
Calling all electic assemblers!

Can you read blueprints? Are you good with your hands? Are you detailed and focused? Are you looking for a new ongoing position?

We're currently looking for some legendary assemblers in Cambridge.

This is for a long-term contract opportunity! Read on if you're interested!

Advantages
- $22 - $27/hr
- Straight afternoons, 2:30 pm-11 pm Monday to Friday
- Qualify for discounted benefits as a Randstad employee
- Weekly pay
- Opportunity to a world-class company with a recognizable brand
- Contract position with the possibility of extension

Responsibilities
- Plan and carry out assembly work from drawings, pick lists, and bills of material
- Carry out mechanical assembly
- Troubleshoot, repair, or modify units and occasionally make design change recommendations
- Communicate with drafting/engineering and other assembly personnel in order to solve issues.
- Train and/or assist other employees as required.
- Observe safe working practices
- Maintain the work area in a clean and orderly manner.


Qualifications
-Previous assembly experience
-Grade 12 or equivalent
-Basic Computer skills
-Physical Demand Level: Regular lifting of up to 35 lbs
-Experienced with hand tools and reading plans/blueprints


Summary
- apply directly on www.randstad.ca
- email an updated resume to diane.wilson@randstad.ca or sam.chasty@randstad.ca subject: assembler
- Call us at 519-740-6944 x 1.


Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: SATURDAYS General Line Assembly - Days and Afternoons
description:
GENERAL LABOUR
Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?
Do you consider yourself a team player? Are you double-vaccinated and eligible to work in Canada? If so, we want to hear from you! At MLF Speedvale, we pride ourselves on our commitment to our team members and producing quality products!

Who we are!
A Sustainable, Forward Thinking Protein Company
Maple Leaf Foods is a leading meat and plant-based protein company, employing over 11,500 people and publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. We are proud of our roots, which trace back well over 100 years, but our vision and purpose are decidedly forward looking. As we pursue our vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, we are committed to creating shared value – creative business value through addressing some of the world’s most critical social and environmental challenges. Our goal is to build a more sustainable food system, which provides nutritious affordable food, operates within planetary limits, cares for animals responsibly, and meaningfully engages with our communities to advance a more just society. We are advancing bold changes within Maple Leaf and more broadly within society to pursue our vision. We deeply believe this is the sustainable path to growth.
The Role:
Maple Leaf Foods at 643 Speedvale Ave. W., in Guelph is accepting applications for General Labourers within our Prepared Meats Plant which specializes in Lunches, Snacking, & Charcuterie products.Duties may include:
  • Putting empty trays into the denester and placing appropriate quantities of components into the trays.
  • Rotating competently within all positions of the work cell
  • Taking an active role in changeover procedures and achieving line speed efficiencies
  • Visual quality checks of product against customer and internal specifications (Including foreign materials, weight checks, gas and program settings)
  • Ability to maintain cleanliness of areas of responsibility
  • Demonstrated ability to wear proper PPE and comply with safety requirements including ensuring power is shut down on equipment prior to specified tasks (Lockout / Tagout may be applicable)
  • Frequent reaching and standing are required
  • Other duties as assigned

Hours of Work:
  • Monday to Friday with occasional Saturday overtime.
  • Shift times are:
    • 6:30am – 3:00pm
    • 3:15pm – 11:45pm

What we are looking for:
  • Ability to read, write and communicate in English.
  • Interact and share information with employees at all levels (Team members, Lead Hands, Supervisors, Others). Actively participates in their work group.
  • Actively finds new and improved ways of completing tasks. Is willing to try new things and assume additional responsibilities (assists with changeovers, keeps up with line speed requirements)
  • Must be able to handle all food/pork products, stand for an extended period of timeand work in a cold environment
  • Employees will receive the necessary training and may be required to complete an evaluation in order to receive the higher wage rate within this categories progression

Why Choose Maple Leaf Foods?
  • Leading Consumer Protein Company
  • Essential business during COVID-19
  • Competitive Wages: Starting rate is $16.91/hour with ability to earn up to $17.66/hour
  • Afternoon shift premium of $0.35/hour
  • Comprehensive benefits package (Extended Health, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, and Long-Term Disability)
  • Pension Program
  • Referral Bonus Program
  • Gain Sharing Program – Potential to earn up to $0.60/hour extra!
  • Clean and safe environment
  • Personal Protective Equipment provided
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Equal Opportunity Employer
Please apply online or in-person today!

* New Walk-In Fridays! *
Onsite interviews every Friday from 10:00am - 2:00pm
643 Speedvale Ave W

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employeestobe fully vaccinated byMarch 31, 2022and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination prior to their first day of work.. We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws

We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team ataccommodations@mapleleaf.comor 905-285-5862. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: Production Technician
description:
PRODUCTION TECHNICIAN – MAPLE LEAF FOODS

Maple Leaf Foods at 100 McLeod Avenue, in Saskatoon, is a boutique sausage facility. As a team we create great tasting quality products and are looking for more great people like YOU!

We are currently accepting applications for our Production Technician position that offers a variety of flexible shifts:

Start dates: ASAP
Shift times: 5:30AM – 2:00PM
6:00AM – 2:30PM
2:00PM-10:30PM
2:30PM-11:00PM
5:15PM-1:45AM
*Shift start times may vary based on production needs*
How to apply: Email resumes to McLeodApplications@mapleleaf.com


Our job is to make great food
Maple Leaf Foods embraces a strong values-based culture, where our people are deeply engaged in work that is purposeful, fast-paced and challenging. We cultivate an open, non-bureaucratic and inclusive workplace that fosters safety and transparency, along with individual leadership and accountability. Each Maple Leaf team member has a voice and plays an active role in helping all of us achieve our goals with passion and discipline. We support one another to grow professionally, to learn new skills and to take on challenging experiences in the spirit of continuous improvement.

Raise the Good in Food
We have united behind a shared purpose – to Raise the Good in Food. This spans a dramatic transformation of our flagship Maple Leaf brand, replacing anything artificial with simple, natural ingredients; investments and process changes to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025; building a diverse and inclusive culture where all talent thrives; becoming a leader in animal care; and advancing food security through our charitable foundation, the Maple Leaf Centre for Action on Food Security.

Main Duties
Demonstrated ability to wear proper PPE (steel toe-rubber boots, hard hats, hair nets, gloves, safety glasses, face coverings etc.)and comply with safety requirements
  • Pushing, pulling and overhead reaching, bending andprolonged standing
  • Transport raw materials, finished products and equipment throughout plant manually or using powered equipment
  • Check and weigh materials and products
  • Sort, pack, crate and package materials and products
  • Assist machine operators, assemblers and other workers
  • Clean work areas and equipment
  • Perform other general labour tasks

What We Offer
  • Development, growth, and career opportunities available
  • Earn up to $16.15/hour as a Production Technician
  • Earn up to $20.60/hour as you grow with us
  • $1.00/hour shift premium for time worked between 6 pm – 6 am
  • Competitive benefits offered
  • Company pension plan
  • Bi-weekly pay
  • Regular wage increases as per CBA
  • Opportunity for over-time
  • Employee Staff Sales Program
  • Employee Referral Program

RequiredSkills and Abilities
  • Understand, read and write numbers and text
  • Oral/verbal communication
  • Working with others
  • Manual dexterity
  • Attention to detail
  • Perform repetitive tasks
  • Hand-eye co-ordination
  • Standing for extended periods
  • Lifting heavy materials
    • Up to 23 kg (50 lbs)

Work Setting
  • High volume packaging company
  • Fast-paced environment
  • Loud machine noises (PPE provided for hearing protection)
  • Cool environment, refrigeration-level temperature (1-5 Degrees Celsius)

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022). We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

title: Assembly & General Laborer
description:
Plainsman Mfg. Inc. is looking to hire an Assembly/General Labour ASAP!
Job Description:
  • Assemble parts, general clean up, inventory counts, deliveries and pickups as needed. Immediate start!
  • Hours: 8-4:30 pm Mon-Fri.
  • High-pressure team environment.

Company Description:
  • Plainsman Mfg. Inc. is a locally owned manufacturing and distribution company operating out of Edmonton, Alberta since 1966.
  • We manufacture and distribute products for oilfield production, pipeline maintenance, construction and gas, and water distribution.
  • We have an in-house engineering department and a full-service manufacturing facility that enables us to respond efficiently to customer and industry needs.

Habits:
  • Adherence to Plainsman Mfg quality standards.
  • Thoroughness and pride at ANY task assigned by supervisor.
  • Adhere to the safety program.
  • Keep work area tidy and organized.
  • Initiate and complete small projects/improvements.

Skills or Experience Requirements:
  • *Must have mechanical aptitude.
  • High School Diploma or student.
  • Ability to read and write English.
  • Physically able.
  • Must have a valid driver's license.
  • Must be able to quickly learn and be willing to ask.
  • Follow written and verbal procedures as well as be able to clearly document their own work.
  • Able to prioritize and make decisions using lean, risk, customer needs, and Plainsman core values.
  • Work with a team (conflict resolution, collaboration).
  • Able to assemble multiple Plainsman product categories without supervision.
  • Troubleshoot small issues and make corrections.

title: Assembler / Machine Operator - Days & Evenings
description:
Job Description

We offer:

  • A competitive starting rate
  • Above average shift premium (Evening Shift) 
  • Plant Incentive Program
  • Competitive group benefits for full-time associates
  • An employer matched RRSP plan,
  • And great company discounts and benefits.

POSITIONS ARE AVAILABLE ON DAYS, and EVENING

Day shift: 7:00 AM - 3:30 PM

Evening Shift: 4:00 PM - 12:30 AM

About Us:

MasterBrand Cabinets (known in Winnipeg as Kitchen Craft Cabinetry, and Urban Effects), is a dynamic supplier of high quality kitchen cabinetry and countertops with facilities and sales throughout North America.  As a growing company we have current and future opportunities in our Manufacturing plant (located on Springfield Road in Winnipeg) for Assemblers, and Machine Operators

·       Assemblersare responsible for the assembly of cabinets, ensuring the assembly meets quality standards.  Applicants must have the ability to read and interpret various gauges and measuring devices, pay attention to detail and have previous experience utilizing various hand tools; ability and willingness to work in a fast-paced and physical environment is mandatory.

·       Machine Operators - Previous experience in operating entry level to complex machinery in the woodworking industry is ideal.  Strong working mechanical knowledge of machines and tools including their designs, uses, repair, and maintenance is required. Must have the ability to read and understand schematics and work instructions. Ability to troubleshoot machine operations and willingness to work in a fast-paced, and physical environment are necessary. CNC experience is considered an asset.   

 

Successful applicants must be eligible to work in Canada, speak, read, write English, have satisfactory math skills, a strong work ethic, ability to work as a functioning member of a team, work in a safe and responsible manner, and display a commitment to quality and safety.  In addition, all positions require the successful candidate to have the physical ability to lift, bend, push, pull, and move material up to 50 pounds, as well as stand for prolonged period of time. All other duties as may be assigned at management's discretion. Reliable transportation is required (Facility is not on a bus route).

 

Additional Information

MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc. offers a wide spectrum of cabinetry products designed to satisfy every budget and lifestyle. With a large North America footprint and diverse team of nearly 13,000 employees, we help people fulfill their dreams of a comfortable, inviting home through innovations in fashion and functionality that bring family and friends together. We invite you to visit www.masterbrand.com to learn more about how we build employee opportunity, purpose, and reward into everything we do.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY 
MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

REASONABLE ACCOMMODATIONS
MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc. is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to staffing@masterbrand.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

title: Agent(e) de réservation
description:
Dans le cadre de son plan développement en Amérique du Nord, le groupe Huttopia recherche un/une Agent(e) de réservation qui sera basé à Montréal.

Le groupe Huttopia, chef de file dans l’industrie du glamping et de l’écotourisme, conçoit, construit et exploite des sites dans des espaces naturels uniques. Fondé il y a 20 ans en France, Huttopia s’est implanté en Amérique du Nord en 2007. L’entreprise exploite aujourd’hui 80 sites dans 6 pays sur 3 continents. Inscrit dans un marché en pleine croissance, Huttopia a basé son développement sur un fort esprit entrepreneurial, l’innovation et la préservation de la nature.

Tâches et responsabilité:
  • Répondre au téléphone et aux courriels.
  • Assurer la prise des réservations des séjours dans le logiciel de réservation.
  • Conseiller la clientèle sur les différents produits et destinations.
  • Optimiser les ventes.
  • Toutes tâches connexes.

Profil:
  • Fortes compétences interpersonnelles et d'écoute.
  • La connaissance du français et de l'anglais est requise (écrit et oral).

Conditions de travail:
  • Emploi temporaire (jusqu'à octobre 2022).
  • Temps plein, disponibilité la fin de semaine.
  • Date de début: Aussitôt que possible.

Comment nous soumettre votre candidature?
Si cette offre d’emploi vous intéresse, veuillez nous envoyer votre CV via cet offre d’emploi ou directement à recrutementhna@huttopia.com en précisant le poste et le lieu souhaité.
Nous vous remercions pour votre intérêt envers notre entreprise. Cependant, prenez note que seuls les candidats retenus pour une entrevue seront contactés.

L’usage du masculin inclut le féminin et est uniquement utilisé dans le but d'alléger le texte.

title: Production Assembler/Technician
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

 

Lonza in Kingston, Ontario is actively seeking a Production Assembler/Technician to help with the assembly and testing of cutting edgetechnology such as the Cocoon® Platform . The responsibilitiesinclude:removing parts from inventory, inspecting parts for quality, prepare required tools, fixtures and test equipment, assemble product, test for performance, and package. Measurements, assembly, record keeping among other activities, will require your continued precision, focus and care.

We are looking for individuals who enjoy the manufacturing/production environment and being hands-on.

 

Key responsibilities:

  • Working hygienically in a controlled environment

  • Maintaining accurate documentation and record keeping

  • Work within a self-directed team environment

  • Precision in: Measurements, Assembly, Testing (as per protocols), Record Keeping, Hygiene, Health & Safety 

Key requirements:

  • Must have High School Diploma or equivalent

  • Ability to read technical documentation

  • Ability to use tools, fixtures, and test equipment

  • Working experience in a manufacturing/operations/production role

  • Must enjoy the manufacturing environment and being hands-on

  • Computer skills, MS Office

  • Company Quality System Training

  • Company specified health and safety training

 

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

 

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

 

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Opérateur de production (permanent - quart de nuit)
description:
Nous sommes présentement à la recherche de quelques candidats afin de combler des postes permanents de nuitdans notre usine.

Salaire : 27.02$ / heure

Votre contribution :

  • Démonter, monter et nettoyer les différents équipements;
  • Effectuer les dégagements et les engagements de ligne;
  • Inspection visuelle, prise d’échantillons, et manutention du matériel de fabrication;
  • Maintenir les cadences de production, tout en respectant les bonnes pratiques de fabrication et les règles de Santé et Sécurité.

Votre profil:

  • Disponible pour affectation sur le quart de nuit;
  • Détenir un diplôme d’études secondaires;
  • 1 à 3 ans expérience dans une industrie manufacturière;
  • Habileté mécanique pour le montage, démontage et l’opération d’équipements divers;
  • A l’aise dans un environnement informatisé;
  • Maîtrise de la Langue française;
  • A l’aise d’évoluer dans un environnement fortement régi par de bonnes pratiques documentaires;
  • Souci du travail bien fait, précision et rigueur au travail;
  • Travail d’équipe, capacité d’apprentissage, faire preuve d’autonomie et d’initiative;
  • Carte de cariste (atout).

Pourquoi venir travailler avec nous : 

  • Notre mission nous rend fier : nos produits injectables contribuent à sauver ou prolonger la vie de plusieurs millions de patients!
  • Salaire très compétitif : pouvant atteindre près de 30$/hr après seulement environ 1 an;
  • Prime pour quart de soir (+$1.05/hr) et de nuit (+$1,35/hr);
  • Possibilité de temps supplémentaire volontaire;
  • Avantages sociaux complets : (assurances collectives, régime de retraite);
  • Nombre de jours fériés plus élevé que la moyenne;
  • Travail à temps plein, sans saisonnalité, dans un secteur peu sensible aux cycles économiques;
  • Environnement ultra propre, sécuritaire, climatisé et peu bruyant;
  • Programme de formation très rigoureux pour assurer la qualité de nos produits à toutes les étapes;
  • Situé sur la rive-sud de Montréal, tout près des autoroutes principales, stationnement gratuit, bornes électriques en mode dépannageà votre disposition sur le site, réseau d’autobus et pistes cyclables à proximité de l’établissement.

title: TECHNICIEN DE PRODUCTION
description:
Description de l'entreprise

EACOM EN BREF

Chez EACOM, nous transformons bien plus que du bois. Notre équipe talentueuse compte plus de 1 100 employés déterminés à travailler, construire et grandir ensemble. Enracinées dans les collectivités du nord de l’Ontario et du Québec, nos scieries ont une longue et riche histoire. Nous gérons et transformons les ressources forestières de manière responsable pour obtenir des produits de bois de grande qualité. Des forêts canadiennes jusqu’au marché de la construction nord-américain, nous visons le développement durable, la collaboration, la sécurité et l’amélioration continue. 

Description du poste

Tu dois en voir plusieurs des postes de technicien de production, mais l’être chez EACOM Ear Falls, une filiale d'INTERFOR, c’est avoir les deux mains dans le plus grand que nature. Tu vas manipuler du bois, pis encore du bois. Tes yeux à l’affût de tout ce qui se passe vont permettre de garder la cour et l’usine propres et à l’ordre. On se fie sur toi pour que tout soit à sa place et que ça roule à planche. Tu vas vivre d’un travail de chez nous, dans nos scieries enracinées dans les régions du nord de l’Ontario et du Québec. Tu vas découvrir qu’elles transforment bien plus que du bois, elles améliorent nos communautés !

Tu es travaillant, tu es dégourdi et tu passes à l’action de façon efficace ? Viens voir chez EACOM, on va se fendre en quatre pour que ça marche.  L’équipe t’attend.

Ce que tu vas faire concrètement :

  • Attacher les paquets de bois brut pour le séchage à l’extérieur;
  • Refaire et empiler les paquets de bois brut et de bois plané, dans la cour;
  • Effectuer le nettoyage de la cour et de l’usine;
  • Effectuer le ménage au sciage intérieur et extérieur;
  • Nettoyer pendant les arrêts de travail les endroits inaccessibles en cours d’opération;
  • Compléter d’autres tâches connexes (ça, ça fait souvent peur, mais tu vas apprendre plein de nouvelles choses qui te serviront).

Qu’as-tu besoin pour bien réussir chez nous ?

  • Bien vivre le travail d’équipe;
  • Être autonome et plein d’initiatives;
  • Faire preuve de vigilance et de souci pour la santé/sécurité.
Qualifications

Ton passé te donnera un coup de main :

  • D.E.S., D.E.P. ou équivalent;
  • Avoir travailler en usine est un atout;
  • Être disponible pour travailler sur des quarts de travail de jour et/ou de nuit.


Informations complémentaires

Chez EACOM, on est là pour toi.

EACOM supporte l’équité en matière d’emploi, la diversité est la bienvenue chez nous, en fait, on l’encourage !  Nous te contacterons si tu es sélectionné pour une entrevue et si tu as besoin d’accommodations particulières, laisse-le nous savoir. Toute information que tu nous envoies sera traitée avec respect et en toute confidentialité. Nos postes sont écrits au masculin pour répondre aux algorithmes de référencement, mais sache que tu es aussi LA BIENVENUE !
skills: ['Refaire et empiler les paquets de bois brut et de bois plané, dans la cour;']

title: Production Assembler - Server Chassis
description:
Working in production, you will be part of the manufacturing group that assembles our products. 
 

Responsibilities:

  • Assemble frames and servers according to detailed assembly drawings
  • Preparing and installing cabling  
  • Loading and running software using LINUX

Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with electronic components
  • Hand soldering experience would be an asset
  • Basic knowledge of computers
  • Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment that places a high emphasis on team work
  • High school diploma
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

What we offer:

  • Employer funded benefits program
  • Competitive total compensation package
  • Work-life balance
  • Employee Assistance plan
  • Employee Discount Platform
  • Career progression
  • Casual work environment
  • Social events and sports teams

About Us:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery.

Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertz’ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers.

With over 1700 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz!

title: Production Technician
description:
Mitrex, an Integrated solar and construction solution provider, is looking for a experienced Production Technician/Stringer to operate highly automated machines in a manufacturing setting to reach the production goal
At Mitrex, we develop and manufacture solar construction materials for buildings and large structures (Mitrex
com)
As the world's first manufacturer to develop customizable solar solutions, we are revolutionizing the construction industry, while helping to move the world toward clean, sustainable energy production
We are an equal opportunity employer with great company culture
The successful candidate will join our production team in Etobicoke, and report to the Production Supervisor
COMPETENCIES Minimum 2 years Technical College Diploma or equivalent training and experience, Minimum of 5 years experience in a similar production role within an automated high-volume manufacturing environment, Able to read and understand production assembly drawings, Must have a good mechanical aptitude and be detail-oriented, Must have experience developing best quality practices, analyzing quality testing/inspection data, and developing test procedures, Proven proficiency with computers and statistical software packages, Able to work efficiently both independently and as a team
RESPONSIBILITIES Read, interpret, and execute production schedules and assembly drawings, Perform work and quality practices as per Standardized Work Instructions, Monitor the creation of scrap/non-conforming material – Trouble-shoot scrap generating issues, perform root cause analysis and implement corrective actions, Support training of new staff, audit existing work instructions, and participate in Continuous Improvement initiatives/projects, Facilitate material movement within the plant and adhere to inventory control practices, Perform shipping/receiving functions as directed, Perform all other duties as assigned by Supervisor/Management WHAT WE OFFER Salary of $25+/hour based on experience, plus an annual bonus based on performance
Extended medical and health coverage (including vision, dental, and life) Wellness program including free healthy foods, medicinal provisions, and discounted gym and fitness class memberships Competitive RRSP Matching for tenured employees Free charging and reserved parking for electric vehicles Collaborative and diverse culture, open concept modern office space Unlimited room for advancement and growth Backed by 20 years of experience through our parent company, GCAT Group Full-time and permanent position AODA Considerations Mitrex Inc
welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities
Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process
Process We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes all candidates from diverse backgrounds
Candidates who are legally entitled to work in Canada (without employer sponsorship) and can commute to the office every day are welcome to apply
We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in our company
However, due to the number of applications we receive, only qualified candidates will be contacted
No phone calls (except for accommodation requests) or unsolicited agency calls, please

title: Assembleur soir (Hood)
description:
Boni de rétention après 1 an - 2000$

500$ -  payable après 6 mois travaillés

1 500$ - payable après 1 an travaillé

Travaille 36h - Payé 40h (4 soirs)

Prime de soir

 

SOMMAIRE DU POSTE

En tant qu’assembleur/assembleuse, vous devrez effectuer le montage, l’ajustement et l’installation des panneaux et de certaines composantes de l’unité de ventilation.

 

PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS

  • Assembler, ajuster et installer les panneaux extérieurs et le plancher sur la structure;
  • Préparer la structure en fonction du type de panneau à installer;
  • Sceller les panneaux et certaines composantes pour en assurer l'étanchéité;
  • Lire et interpréter les plans;
  • Effectuer des opérations d’assemblage de différents types de charpentes métalliques. 
  • Procéder au nettoyage à la finition des pièces.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUISES

  • Connaissance des unités de mesure (métrique et impérial);
  • Habileté à utiliser différents outils (manuels, pneumatiques et électriques);
  • Bonne condition physique;
  • Dextérité manuelle;

AVANTAGES

  • REER
  • Bonus de rétention après 1 an 2000$
  • Vêtements fournis
  • Congés personnels
  • Programme d’aide aux employés
  • Club social
