title: Electrical Assembler
description:
Description:

Agilus is recruiting for a Electrical Assembler in the Warehousing/Distribution Sector in Airdrie, Alberta.
Reporting to the Production Manager, this position is responsible for mounting and basic wiring of components with standard layouts/options, performs sub-assembly functions, as required, and developing enhanced wiring skills under the direction of a more experienced Electrical Assembler
Responsibilities:
  • Assemble and mount electrical, mechanical and sub-assembly components onto pan, into enclosures, structures etc. by following standard layouts
  • Wire electrical products with basic/standard options as required by following customer drawing packages and schematics
  • Wire electrical products with a non-standard option by following customer drawing packages and schematics under the direction of a more experienced Electrical Assembler
  • Check for functionality by performing continuity check , e.g., buzzing out
  • Complete checklists as required
  • Assemble enclosures/structures where applicable
  • Deliver sub-assemblies to the production areas
  • Support inventory maintenance in sub-assembly area by performing cycle counts, following standard materials procedures, accessing information through CSSM

Successful candidates will have:
  • Must have Grade 12 or equivalent level of education
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills
  • Be a team player
  • Knowledge/experience with basic wiring schematic symbols is an asset

What's in it for you:
  • Pay rate: $18 / hr
  • Morning Shift: 7 am to 3:30 pm
  • Location: Airdrie, AB
  • 6 month - 1 year contract

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email ktejeda@agilus.ca or by text 403.777.9000
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Production Assembler/Technician
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

 

Lonza in Kingston, Ontario is actively seeking a Production Assembler/Technician to help with the assembly and testing of cutting edge technology such as the Cocoon® Platform. The responsibilities include: removing parts from inventory, inspecting parts for quality, prepare required tools, fixtures and test equipment, assemble product, test for performance, and package. Measurements, assembly, record keeping among other activities, will require your continued precision, focus and care.

We are looking for individuals who enjoy the manufacturing/production environment and being hands-on.

 

Key responsibilities:

  • Working hygienically in a controlled environment

  • Maintaining accurate documentation and record keeping

  • Work within a self-directed team environment

  • Precision in: Measurements, Assembly, Testing (as per protocols), Record Keeping, Hygiene, Health & Safety  

Key requirements:

  • Must have High School Diploma or equivalent

  • Ability to read technical documentation

  • Ability to use tools, fixtures, and test equipment

  • Working experience in a manufacturing/operations/production role

  • Must enjoy the manufacturing environment and being hands-on

  • Computer skills, MS Office

  • Company Quality System Training

  • Company specified health and safety training

 

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

 

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

 

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Electrical Assembler
description:
Eaton’s Electrical Division is currently seeking an Electrical Assembler to join our first shift team.

This position is based at our Perth, Ontario facility.

This position is responsible for assembly and wiring standard & engineered control assemblies as well as full functional and electrical testing on products.

Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each and every day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours.

Position Overview:

  • Work from drawings, specifications, schematics, wiring diagrams as well as other verbal or written instructions and perform electrical and mechanical assembly.
  • Determine wiring sequence, layout and location.
  • Perform testing to verify work.
  • Work to CSA, UL, CEC codes and company quality requirements.
  • Provide input and recommendations to improve the effectiveness of work area.
  • Actively support and participate in corporate initiatives/programs including department meetings, safety programs, lean manufacturing, continuous improvement initiatives, and quality management programs.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned in the facility as required.
  • Comply with all safety requirements, including proper use of personal protective equipment and operation of equipment in a safe and competent manner.
  • Perform all job functions with adherence to Eaton’s Philosophy and Values, Code of Ethics as well as safety and environmental standards.

When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

Qualifications

Required (Basic) Qualifications:

  • Minimum Grade 12 or equivalent level of education from an accredited institution
  • Must be able to work in Canada without corporate sponsorship now and within the future
  • No relocation benefit is being offered for this position. Only candidates within an 80-kilometer radius of the work location will be considered

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in a manufacturing / assembly environment will be an asset, but not required, as training will be provided
  • Two-year community college diploma, or greater
  • Minimum one year of manufacturing / assembly experience
  • Experience in machining operations, particularly in the use of milling and drilling equipment
  • Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing/continuous improvement principles

Position Criteria:

  • Computer skills with a working knowledge of Microsoft Office programs
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work efficiently as a team member
  • Ability to grasp new tasks and concepts quickly
  • Strong work ethic

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

What you will get from us

Eaton’s mission is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services. We provide sustainable solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power – more safely, more efficiently and more reliably. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. Eaton’s 2020 revenues were $17.9 billion, and we sell products to customers in more than 175 countries. We have approximately 85,000 employees.

We make work exciting, engaging and meaningful for our employees through our dedication to tackling some of the toughest power management challenges on the planet and by never losing sight of what matters. Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We pledge to always foster a diverse and inclusive environment, including inclusion resource groups that bring together employees who share a common purpose, interest or background. In the past year, our company has received top employment recognition by the Human Rights Campaign and almost fifty percent of our Board of Directors represented diverse groups. When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the recent announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030. We are ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and committed to learning. We are confident we can deliver on our promise to improve the quality of life and the environment because of the attributes that our employees embody.

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Job: Manufacturing & Operations

Region: North America – Canada
Organization: ESSG CA Canada

Job Level: Individual Contributor
Schedule: Full-time
Does this position offer relocation?: No
Travel: No

title: Assembly Technician
description:
Description:
Full-time role with one of the biggest manufacturing company in the world. Apply now with Agilus Work Solutions!
Agilus is recruiting for multiple Assembly Technicians in the Manufacturing Sector in Mississauga, Ontario.
This is a Full-time role (evening shift) in a ever growing manufacturing company. The Assembly Technician will assist in the basic operation, cleaning and ongoing maintenance of materials, laboratory tools and equipment.
A day in the life:
  • Cleaning products and dotting for QA
  • Help in sorting/ arranging orders
  • Help with receiving and unpacking
  • Assist in the basic operation, cleaning and ongoing maintenance of laboratory tools and equipment by in accordance with to established maintenance procedures and calendars

You bring:
  • Experience with machine operation preferred 6 months to one year in a manufacturing environment
  • Must be able to work in a fast paced, high-volume environment
  • Must be well organized, detail oriented, have excellent time management and multi-tasking abilities
  • Continuous learning is a large part of this position
  • Must be able to work in a team atmosphere as well as an individual with minimal supervision

What's in it for you:
  • Be working with one of the largest and a well know manufacturing company in the world
  • Competitive salary with $17/hour rate + &1 afternoon shift premium
  • Bus accessible location and free parking provided

Let's connect!

title: Opérateur de production
description:
Job Summary

L'opérateur de production participe à la fabrication des composantes des tests de diagnostics, incluant l’étiquetage et la mise en trousse des produits.

Key Duties

  • Opérer les équipements sur la ligne de production;
  • Effectuer l’étiquetage et la mise en trousse des produits;
  • Mettre en forme les matières premières;
  • Participer à l’entretien de certains équipements de production;
  • S’assurer de l’atteinte des standards d’efficacité et de productivité;
  • Documenter les dossiers de production ou tout autre documentation requise;
  • S’assurer du maintien de la qualité du produit;
  • Respecter les procédures en place;
  • Participer aux projets d’amélioration continue.

Qualifications

Connaissances, compétences et aptitudes:

  • Minutie et bonne dextérité manuelle;
  • Travail d’équipe.

Formation et expérience:

  • AEC en production pharmaceutique ou diplôme d’études secondaires complété;
  • 1 à 3 ans d’expérience en production;
  • Expérience dans un environnement réglementé, idéalement biomédical (ISO 13485, ISO 9001).

title: Assembly Technician
description:
Motion Canada, a leading distributor of industrial MRO (maintenance, repair and operation replacement) parts, and the largest Bearing and Power Transmission Company in NA is currently recruiting an Assembly Technician in our North Bay, Ontario location.  Our North Bay facility provides a number of different services within its 120,000 square-foot facility, including assembly.  The key responsibilities include producing components by assembling parts and subassemblies.

Motion Canada is an industry leader with approximately $500 million in sales and over 50 branches across Canada. With a national platform, a track record of success, an entrepreneurial executive team, and the backing of a multi-billion-dollar parent company (Motion Industries) Motion Canada is positioned for strong growth across Canada.

Job Responsibilities
  • Produces components by assembling parts and subassemblies
  • Reads and deciphers schematics, blueprints, and assembly instructions
  • Positions or aligns components and parts, either manually or with hoists
  • Uses hand tools or machines to assemble parts
  • Conducts quality control checks
  • Cleans and maintains work area and equipment, including tools
  • Prepares work to be accomplished by studying part lists and gathering parts, subassemblies, tools, and materials
  • Positions parts and subassemblies by using templates or reading measurements
  • Assembles components by examining connections for correct fit, fastening parts and subassemblies
  • Verifies specifications by measuring completed component
  • Keeps equipment operational by completing preventive maintenance requirements, following manufacturer's instructions, troubleshooting malfunctions, and calling for repairs
  • Maintains a safe and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations
  • Documents actions by completing production and quality forms
  • Willingness to work overtime when necessary
The work experience at Motion Canada includes
  • Comprehensive flex benefits
  • Competitive wage
  • A generous pension plan
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • Great company culture with a strong leadership team
  • Open and frequent communication
  • Timely feedback on individual performance and career development opportunities

Calgary, AB
At Hexagon Geosystems, we know that the success of our business is a direct result of our highly motivated and collaborative staff. And we stand by this fact: We value our people as much as we value our business. title: Aide au chargé.e à la livraison/installation d'appareils électroménagers usagés - Proliko Électros
description:
QUI EST PROLIKO ÉLECTROS ?

Depuis sa création en fin 2020, Proliko Électros à toujours eu à coeur d'offrir le meilleur des services à ces clients. Notre but principal est d'offrir des électroménagers usagés garanties avec un service rapide et proffessionnel qui correspondent à ces valeurs : Proffessionnalisme, Rapidité et Relation Client Impeccable. Notre fondateur, Maxime Di-Mattéo, s'est donné pour mission d'offrir le meilleur service client. Aujourd'hui, nous continuons d'honorer cette mission en travaillant vers plus de transparence et de coopération.

Nous recherchons actuellement notre prochain.e aide au chargé.e à la livraison/installation d'électroménagers usagés.

Missions principales

  • ﻿Aider le chargé à la livraison/installation des électroménagers usagés

  • Livrer les produits loués à l'heure indiqué 

  • Effectuer la mise à jour sur l'étât des stocks (fichier inventaire en ligne) au chemin du retour 

  • ﻿Effectuer une inspection visuel et de fonctionnement avant la livraison
  • Installer le(s) produit(s) chez le client
  • Faire les décompte de tout l'équipement dans la van

Conditions :

  • Travail rapide et simple (généralement, moins de 5 minutes à forcer)

  • Payé à la fin de la journée possible 

  • Sur appel (selon les demandes de nos clients)

  • Travail flexible

  • Salaire :

    14,25

    $/heure 

    +

    pourboire

    (Quelques fois)

Ce que nous offrons :

  • Horaires flexibles selon les ventes

  • Travail saisonnier (estivale)
  • Possibilité de travailler plus (Autres postes : tâches)
  • Accès à un portail simple et efficace pour communiquer
  • Une équipe jovial se surpassant à chaque jour

Profil recherché

  • Avoir un minimum de 16 ans, détenir un permis de conduire classe 5 minimum valide et une voiture (idéalement une van)


  • Être capable de soulever des charges lourdes (diable disponible et courroie de déménagement professionnel)
  • Aimer le soleil et le plein-air

  • Avoir une bonne condition physique et être autonome 


    *Nous acceptons avec plaisir les étudiants

title: Opérateurs de production
description:
Vous recherchez un emploi sur une chaîne de production avec des possibilités davancement? Vous aimeriez travailler sur des horaires rotatifs de jour ET de soir?


Nous sommes actuellement en recrutement pour un poste dopérateur de production sur des quarts rotatifs (jour/soir) à notre usine de production située à Papineauville. 

Voici les principales fonctions de ce poste:

  • Régler et ajuster les différents paramètres de l’équipement de production avant le début du quart de travail.
  • Réaliser les tests en cours de production et faire les ajustements adéquats.
  • S’assurer de la qualité du produit.
  • Enregistrer et transmettre au chef d’équipe en fin de quart les contrôles et évènements particuliers du quart sur le rapport quotidien.
  • Intervenir pour lever les blocages au besoin.
  • Respecter et appliquer le programme dentretien préventif.
  • Nettoyer l’équipement en fin de quart et s’assurer de garder son environnement de travail propre.
  • Accompagner l’électromécanicien dans ses interventions (ajustements, réparations, modification) et l’aider si nécessaire


Profil

  • Vous êtes manuel et vous appréciez le travail debout
  • Vous aimez bouger
  • Vous aimez apprendre et développer de nouvelles compétences
  • Vous comprenez bien la mécanique de la chaîne de production 
  • Vous comprenez les logiciels de production
  • Vous êtes autonome


Informations contractuelles

Horaire:
Lhoraire est de jour et soir en alternance aux semaines.
  • De jour: du lundi au vendredi de 6h-15h30
  • De soir: du lundi au jeudi de 15h45-2h15

Salaire:
Le salaire est de 16.63$/h à 18,08$/hre en débutant selon l’expérience, avec progression salariale aux 3 mois pendant 18-24 mois. Salaire pouvant atteindre 22,03$/hre
  • + prime de soir de 2$/hre
  • + Boni de performance jusqu’à 300$/mois
  • + Prime d’engagement de 500$ à 2000$/à chaque année

Avantages sociaux:
  • Assurances collectives (50%-50%), incluant les médicaments, les professionnels, télémédecine et PAE
  • REER collectif
  • Rabais sur planchers et granules
  • Prime de référence
  • Allocation pour chaussures de sécurité (150-300$/an)



Vous êtes manuel et vous appréciez le travail debout Vous aimez bouger Vous aimez apprendre et développer de nouvelles compétences Vous comprenez bien la mécanique de la chaîne de production Vous comprenez les logiciels de production Vous êtes autonome

title: OUVRIER(ÈRE) DE PRODUCTION
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Chantier Davie Canada inc. est le plus important chantier de construction et réparation navale au Canada. Axé sur des valeurs tel que ; Le succès, le dynamisme, la responsabilité et les relations.

Vous avez le goût de l'aventure, vous désirez entreprendre une carrière exceptionnelle dans un environnement ou vous aurez l'occasion de grandir. 

Venez supporter la nation avec nous. Nous fabriquons et réparons les navires canadiens du ministère de la Défense nationale, de Transports Canada et de la Garde côtière canadienne.

 

Description du poste

À titre d'ouvrier(ère) de production, vous devrez notamment supporter les salariés des différents métiers dans l’exécution de leurs fonctions. Plus spécifiquement, vous aurez à : 

  • Assister et supporter les salariés des différents métiers pour des tâches tels qu’appliquer de peinture, poser des matériaux d’isolation, conduire les camions, pré-couper le câblage, etc.
  • Meuler les surplus de soudure à l’aide des outils appropriés. Au besoin, fabriquer, nettoyer et polir des chanfreins sur des plaques de métal ou des pièces de métal.
  • Balayer et nettoyer les réservoirs, l’intérieur des navires, des roulottes, des ateliers, des aires de repos et entretenir les salles de toilettes des ateliers de production.
  • Démanteler, rassembler, classer et ramasse les produits considérés comme rebuts ou les retailles.
  • Déplacer, remuer, ramasser avec différents outils du ciment, du sable, de la neige, du gazon, de l’eau etc.
  • Aptitude à travailler dans les endroits restreints en hauteur ou dans les espaces clos.
  • Respecter, selon les normes de qualité de la Compagnie, les exigences prescrites aux procédures d’exécution de son travail et signale à son contremaître tout ce qui n’est pas conforme aux normes.
  • Effectuer  et démontrer les aptitudes pour toute autre tâche connexe à la demande de son supérieur.
Qualifications

  • Détenir l’un des diplômes suivants un diplôme d’études secondaires ou l’équivalent ou l’ASP Journalier/journalière
  • Expérience en milieu industriel (atout)
  • Être disponible pour travailler le jour, soir, nuit et fin de semaine.


Informations complémentaires

Pour être retenu, vous devrez vous soumettre au processus d’enquête et d’obtention de l’attestation de sécurité exigée dans le cadre du Programme de sécurité des contrats du gouvernement fédéral.

Nous fabriquons et réparons les navires canadiens du ministère de la Défense nationale, de Transports Canada et de la Garde côtière canadienne.', 'Assister et supporter les salariés des différents métiers pour des tâches tels qu’appliquer de peinture, poser des matériaux d’isolation, conduire les camions, pré-couper le câblage, etc.', "Vous\xa0avez\xa0le goût de l'aventure, vous\xa0désirez\xa0entreprendre une carrière exceptionnelle dans un environnement ou vous\xa0aurez\xa0l'occasion de grandir."]

title: Assembler IC
description:
Cardinal Health Canada, with over 1300 employees nationwide, is an essential link in the Canadian healthcare supply chain, providing over 70,000 products to healthcare facilities and medical professionals across the country.

Cardinal Health-Gananoque manufactures many life impacting medical devices that help our customers thrive in a changing world. We are your humble partners, striving each day to make healthcare more efficient and effective and our patients as healthy as possible. We are more than 350 employees with 112 years of Canadian history, a deep understanding of the medical devices we manufacture every day and a passion for innovation.

We are looking for positive and team-oriented individuals to join our Gananoque manufacturing center to support the production department.

For more information on what it is like to work for us, please watch this video: Cardinal Health - Wings.

What Our Assembly Team contributes to Cardinal Health

The team performs a variety of tasks ranging from repetitive to non-repetitive production to put together component parts to make assemblies, sub-assemblies or completed units, using standard operating procedures. They may conduct quality inspections on processing line in accordance with quality specifications.

Pay: $17.00 - $18.50 an hour + $1000 Sign-On Bonus



Job Requirements:

  • Accountability for Product Quality and Safety Compliance

  • Ability to work in a team/cellular environment assembling various Infant Care Products

  • Ability to analyze and document various functions in the process

  • Set up and operation of packaging equipment required.

  • Ability to follow good documentation practices.

  • Understanding of Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and 5S methodology.

  • Perform line clearance procedures and set-up to support efficient and timely change-overs

  • Participate in Non-Conformance investigation and resolution where applicable

  • Knowledge of the Infant Care Department would be a definite asset.



Minimum Requirements:

  • High school diploma preferred

  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

  • Ability to interpret and follow instructions

  • Excellent hand/eye coordination and dexterity

  • Ability to sustain repetitive duties

Our Employees all benefit from:

  • Full dental and health benefits including life insurance from day 1

  • Pension plan with employer matching level contribution

  • Incentive plan participation

  • Paid vacation days

  • Tuition reimbursement

  • Paid uniform and safety shoes allowance

  • In-house training on safety measures, production tasks and equipment

Cardinal Health is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities.

Cardinal Health is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our Human Resources team is responsible for working with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.

""

Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Assembler II
description:
Overview:

Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.

We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.

Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.

When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger â€“ a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each otherâ€™s successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.

Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provide you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.

 

Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Responsibilities:

Under general supervision, perform mechanical assembly of moderate complexity in accordance with established procedures.

 

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: (not listed in any particular order)

  • Know and understand Weatherford's Enterprise Excellence Process and the Quality Policy and comply with all requirements of the Quality Systems Manual, Operating and Technical Procedures and Workplace Instructions.  
  • Assemble and test completions equipment per engineered drawings or as instructed by others.  
  • Uses hand tools, power tools, and measuring devices such as tapes, gauges, calipers, micrometer  
  • Inspect completed components for accuracy and functionality.  
  • Perform hydrostatic test on components as necessary.
  • Material handling  
  • Properly maintain company supplied tooling and maintain an orderly work area  
  • Aid in developing of new procedures and improving existing procedures.
  • Must understand and comply with all safety rules and company policies of Weatherford.  
  • Work assignments carried out to the highest quality level.  
  • Perform various other duties and activities as assigned by supervisor within the physical constraints of the job.
Qualifications:
  • Factory or oil & gas experience an asset
  • Good verbal communication skills.  
  • Basic computer skills  
  • Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos in English.  
  • Ability to read assembly layouts and manufacturing prints.  
  • Ability to read a measuring tape, micrometer and calipers.  
  • Ability to safely operate material handling devices (overhead cranes, forklifts).  
  • Ability to perform all job duties of an Assembler  
  • General knowledge of assembly procedures.  
  • Ability to be an effective team member
  • Quick learner/self motiviated

title: Fiber-Electronics Assembler
description:
In this role, the successful candidate will assembly and test fiber optic sensor assemblies. Assembly and test fiber optic feed thru assemblies, assembly and test box build assemblies, Assembly and test air gap sensor assemblies, pack and ship finished product.









+ With the use of a Microscopic, Manufacture and alignment of electronic-optical assemblies according to Manufacturing Work Instructions



+ Builds Fiber-Optic assemblies using fine materials, such as; optical fibers, lenses, glass tubes, metal parts, epoxy adhesives, and other related materials.



+ Preparation of Fiber-Optic Cable and add Terminations when Required



+ Configure & Test Electronic/Fiber-Optic Modules.



+ Able to follow all work instructions and procedures



+ Maintains the working environment in clean and proper arrangement.



+ Adherence to departmental and company policies and procedures. Including the 5 “S” Principles, ISO, misc. quality system procedures



+ Carry out other miscellaneous duties as may be assigned by Management




The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience:





+ Minimum high school diploma



+ Must be fluent in English.



+ Working knowledge of Microsoft office (Word, excel outlook ETC)



+ Read and understand drawing and assembly procedures



+ General mechanical aptitude/assembly experience is an asset.



+ Able to lift 50 lbs.



+ 2 years of experience in a Fiber Optic assembly/test role would be preferred but is not required.




Fortive’s essential technology makes the world stronger, safer, and smarter. We accelerate transformation across a broad range of applications including environmental, health and safety compliance, industrial condition monitoring, next-generation product design, and healthcare safety solutions.



We are a global industrial technology innovator with a startup spirit. Our forward-looking companies lead the way in software-powered workflow solutions, data-driven intelligence, AI-powered automation, and other disruptive technologies. We’re a force for progress, working alongside our customers and partners to solve challenges on a global scale, from workplace safety in the most demanding conditions to groundbreaking sustainability solutions.



We are a diverse team 17,000 strong, united by a dynamic, inclusive culture and energized by limitless learning and growth. We use the proven Fortive Business System (FBS) to accelerate our positive impact.



At Fortive, we believe in you. We believe in your potential—your ability to learn, grow, and make a difference.



At Fortive, we believe in us. We believe in the power of people working together to solve problems no one could solve alone.



At Fortive, we believe in growth. We’re honest about what’s working and what isn’t, and we never stop improving and innovating.



Fortive: For you, for us, for growth.


QUALITROL (https://www.qualitrolcorp.com/) manufactures monitoring and protection devices for high value electrical assets and OEM manufacturing companies. Established in 1945, QUALITROL produces thousands of different types of products on demand and customized to meet our individual customers’ needs. We are the largest and most trusted global leader for partial discharge monitoring, asset protection equipment and information products across power generation, transmission, and distribution. At Qualitrol, we are redefining condition-based monitoring.







Excellent Pay and Benefits!



Qualitrol employees receive competitive Salaries, great Healthcare benefits, Pension Plan with company contributions, generous vacation/sickness plans, Life Insurance and more. We are a family friendly workplace with Flexible Working Hours, and some remote, work from home opportunities. We have annual reviews and career development planning to help get you to the next level in your career.



You will love working with colleagues who have a genuine desire to innovate and seek out complicated problems. We believe in absolute inclusion and diversity. Qualitrol associates enjoy the autonomy, breadth of responsibility, and creativity that are typical in a medium-sized company, while sharing resources, standard methodologies, and growth opportunities that are found in a Fortune 500 company like Fortive.

title: Assembleur isolation panneaux
description:
Description des taches: 

L’assembleur- isolation de panneaux a la responsabilité d’isoler et d’assembler les panneaux et les portes utilisés dans l’assemblage des unités.

Responsabilités :

  • Taille les morceaux d’isolation en fonction des pièces à isoler;
  • Procède à l’isolation des panneaux et des portes;
  • Assemble les pièces les unes avec les autres à l’aide des fixations mécaniques;
  • Applique un scellant;
  • Utilise divers petits outils à main ainsi que des outils mécaniques courants;
  • Travaille en collaboration avec les employés de son secteur et des autres secteurs;
  • Analyse et effectue des suivis de dossiers de production;
  • Garde ses outils et son environnement de travail propres et fonctionnels (respect du 5S);
  • Respecte les normes et les règlements de sécurité;
  • Respecte les normes de qualité;
  • Informe son supérieur immédiat de tout problème survenant dans le cadre de son travail.


Profil

Exigences :

  • Toutes combinaisons de formation et d’expérience pertinentes pourront être considérées
  • Avoir une connaissance du système de mesures impériales ;
  • Utiliser divers petits outils à main ainsi que des outils mécaniques courants;
  • Détenir de lexpérience en lecture de plans et de documents sera considéré un atout. 

Qualifications privilégiées :

  • Détenir un DES ou l’équivalent;
  • Avoir de bonnes aptitudes physiques puisque lemploi requiert un travail physique en diverses positions.

Informations contractuelles

Conditions de travail :
  • Poste permanent syndiqué ;
  • Travail de jour de lundi au vendredi, 40 heures par semaine (heures travaillées 39h et payées 40h);
  • Assurance collective, REER et autres avantages sociaux ;
  • Salaire commence à 17.60$/h;
  • Possibilité davancement.



Qualifications et exigences: Rapidité d'exécution; Dextérité manuelle; Sens de l'observation; Endurance physique (travail debout et penché); Années d'expérience reliées à l'emploi : un atout.

title: Production Technician (Evening Shift)
description:
About the Company:

Auxly Charlottetown  is a world-class developer of innovative cannabis products for the wellness-focused consumer, wholly owned by  Auxly Cannabis Group Inc.   Proudly processed at our  52,000 sq. ft., state-of-the-art facility  in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, Auxly Charlottetown's products are developed and manufactured on-site by a world-class team of scientists and experts, ensuring high-quality, precision and consistency. Auxlyâ€™s  wellness products, available at licensed cannabis retailers across Canada, consist of non-GMO  capsules and oils. Built on the pillars of quality,  safety and efficacy, Auxly  is cannabis â€“ down to a science.  

Overview:

Reporting to the Director of Operations, the Production Technician will work in and maintain the standards of a cGMP packing environment, which may include an ISO-8 clean room.   Ensure orders are done accurately and in a timely manner while maintaining high quality standards. Hours: 4:30pm-1am.  

 

The key candidate will be well organized, have an eye for detail, be a team player, and a good communicator.

What can you expect to do:
  • Preparing equipment and extracted oils for packaging.
  • Operating packaging and labelling equipment.
  • Cleaning and maintaining packaging equipment and room facilities.
  • Maintaining strict inventory records of all dry materials, chemicals and equipment used in the clean room facility.
  • Maintaining inventory records of supplies, materials, and equipment, and preparing requisitions as needed.
  • Storing supplies and equipment, disposal of waste according to guidelines, and keeping clean room, storerooms and working areas immaculate.
  • Washing and sterilizing formulation vessels used for packaging.
  • Performing clerical work related to packing activities such as word processing, record keeping, filing.
  • Maintaining material safety data sheets for all department chemicals and products.
  • Other duties as assigned.
What we are looking for :
  • Experience in production or manufacturing environments in compliance with Current Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP) is strongly preferred.
  • Reporting and information management: must have proficiency in Microsoft Office and experience with process management, team problem solving, and inventory control.
  • Must remain in compliance with local, state, federal, and internal policies and regulations for working in the cannabis industry.
  • Effective time-management skills and ability to multi-task.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, changing and challenging environment.
  • Good organizational skills, and strong attention to detail.

title: Assembly Technician
description:
Assembly Technician (Richmond)
 
At Dynamix Agitators, we specialize in engineering and manufacturing agitators and mixers for industrial process markets worldwide. Our customers include some of the world's leading energy and natural resource companies, as well as some of the largest chemical manufacturing companies. Due to continual growth, we are in need of a dynamic and outgoing individual to join our Production Team in the role of an Assembly Technician.

About the job:
  • Hands-on assembly of mixers, comprising electric motors, shafts, and other components while using basic tools and machinery.
  • Attention to detail in following Quality Control measures related to the assembly of components is essential.
  • Our facilities are organized and clean, and the staff is supportive.
  • The office hours are 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 pm Monday - Friday with 1 hour for a lunch break.
 
About you:
  • A good mechanical aptitude.
  • You have strong attention to detail relating to hands-on assembly processes.
  • A good understanding of basic quality control requirements.
  • Able to continually produce a quality assembly.
  • Experience in a fast-paced manufacturing or assembly-related environment.
  • Physically fit and able to handle some minor lifting while assembling components.
  • Committed to working safely at all times.
  • Good verbal and written English communication skills
  • Reliable team player with good customer service abilities.
 
Nice To Have:
  • Shipping/Receiving experience.
  • Forklift operator certificate.
  • Basic proficiency in Microsoft Office.

We recognize that our employees are the cornerstone of our accomplishments and we pride ourselves on being people of passion and integrity. We've created a collaborative work environment with growth opportunities. While high-quality standards are our priority, we do recognize the importance of a healthy work/life balance. Dynamix Agitators offers attractive compensation and benefits, on-the-job training, and a welcoming work environment. If this sounds like you and you match most of our requirements, we would love to hear from you! Please send your resume and cover letter explaining why you want to join our team.

Note: Office is not easily accessible by Transit.

To read more about us please visit www.dynamixinc.com.

title: Electrical Assembly & Test Technician
description:
Location: Downtown Toronto

Type: Permanent, Full-Time

Start date: Immediately

Experience: Electronics assemblers, fabricators, inspectors, and testers


Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis.


About Able Innovations

We build dynamic robotic platforms that push the technical envelope to deliver products and services capable of transforming how healthcare is delivered. We are developing smart, robust, and well-integrated systems that are easy to use, practical, and can be delivered at a massive scale.


The needs of our healthcare system and its staff are rising at an unprecedented rate due to the aging demographic and the fallout of COVID-19. The act of transferring individuals and patients (i.e. between beds, stretchers, etc.) places a disproportionate strain on staff and resources causing injuries and inefficiencies. At Able Innovations, we are focused on automating this process of patient transfers and have a vision of one day being able to use the same technology to provide independence to anyone who today depends on assistance to be transferred.


About the position

At Able Innovations Inc. our goal is to innovate and create revolutionary technology with the purpose of providing greater independence and mobility for people with disabilities. As a new start-up, we are quickly growing and looking for new team members who are driven, passionate, and hard-working. The selected candidate will play a crucial role in product development including assembling and testing working physical prototypes. The candidate will be working collaboratively in a multidisciplinary team of engineers at various levels of experience. You'll be exposed to the integration of mechatronic systems through hardware, firmware, and software. To succeed, the candidate must be passionate about their work with a "do whatever-it-takes attitude".

Job Duties:

  • Build prototype PCB boards
  • Conduct troubleshooting and testing on products
  • Track product validation plan and progress
  • Assemble prototype units and provide feedback
  • Operate devices for demonstrations
  • Occasionally fabricate jigs, fixtures, or parts for reworking

Required Skills:

  • Knowledge of safe workplace practices when working with equipment
  • Soldering skills and electrical and electronic wiring skills.
  • Able to read the schematics and have basic PCB knowledge.
  • Knowledge of electrical and electronic components, such as transistors, diodes, relays, circuit breakers, etc.
  • Problem Solving and Troubleshooting skills
  • Experience in assembling electromechanical systems
  • Must enjoy being hands-on
  • Motivated with a strong work ethic
  • Experience with the fabrication of metal components including lathes, drills, etc.
  • Good knowledge of MS office suite as well as Google Docs and Google sheets

Bonus Skills:

  • Individuals with extracurricular experience (not just through coursework) demonstrating interest in engineering design or the med-tech field.
  • Knowledge of C/C++, Python software programming languages.

Please submit your resume and cover letter as a single PDF document with the naming format "JET202204_Firstname_Lastname". Feel free to include any relevant projects/portfolios.

title: Electronic Assembler (FT)
description:
ELECTRONIC ASSEMBLER.

Job Details:
  • Set up and operate automatic testing equipment to locate circuit and wiring faults, shorts, and component defects.
  • Read and interpret blueprints, maps, drawings, and specifications.
  • Operate and monitor process equipment to fabricate electronic components.
  • Install, mount, fasten, align and adjust parts, components, wiring, and harnesses to subassemblies and assemblies.
  • Inspect electronic components and assemblies to ensure adherence to specified requirements.
  • Identify and mark acceptable and defective assemblies.
  • Conduct life tests (burn-ins) on components, subassemblies, and assemblies.
  • Check final assembly for the finish, labeling, and packaging methods.
  • Assemble microcircuits requiring fine hand assembly, the use of microscopes, and adherence to cleanroom procedures.
  • Solder and manually assemble various electronic components on PCB (printed circuit boards).
  • Operate automatic and semi-automatic machines to position, solder, and clean prescribed components on PCB (printed circuit boards).
  • Check mechanical dimensions and perform go-no-go electrical tests.
  • Perform simple electrical and continuity testing of electronic components, parts, and systems.
  • Set up process equipment and adhere to cleanroom procedures.

title: Production Assembler
description:
Production Assembler
About Us:

Smartrend Manufacturing Group (SMG), Inc. established in 2004, is a leading manufacturer of customer-specific components and assemblies for transportation and general industrial applications. In 2017, First Light Safety Products was created as a division of SMG. On a mission to prevent stop arm violations, school bus related accidents and fatalities, First Light Safety Products design and manufactures innovative patent-pending illumination technology for the school bus industry. Both organizations share a 30,000 sq ft, state of the art manufacturing facility.

Summary:
Reporting to the Production Manager, the Production Assembler will be responsible for producing and assembling products on the production line that aid in the safety of children. The successful candidate will have strong attention to detail, has a “can-do” attitude and works well in a team environment.

Detailed Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Mechanical assembly of sub-assemblies and final products
  • Read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and specifications

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:
  • Ability to work unsupervised in a fast-paced environment
  • Good manual dexterity
  • Electronics assembly background is an asset
  • Work well under pressure and under tight timelines
  • Experience with fabrication using basic hand tools, power tools, and machinery
  • Knowledge of production documentation and mechanical and electrical assemblies
  • An energetic, diligent work ethic and able to work with little supervision

Share with us your talent, drive, and entrepreneurial spirit and we will provide a creative and supportive environment, where valuable contributions are rewarded and celebrated with professional growth, job satisfaction, and an attractive total compensation program. We offer a benefits package to our employees including:
  • Group Insurance Plan
  • Paid Vacations

WE WOULD LIKE TO THANK ALL APPLICANTS WHO APPLY, HOWEVER, ONLY THOSE SELECTED FOR AN INTERVIEW WILL BE CONTACTED.

title: Assembleur électrique - jour
description:
Tu as soif d’aventure, de nouveaux défis et tu veux avoir du fun au travail? Tu recherches une entreprise qui t’en donne plus?

Ne cherche plus! Nous avons LA place pour toi!

Ce que nous t’offrons :

  • Un salaire compétitif et progressif selon la convention
  • Des assurances collectives payées à 50% et un REER avec contribution de l’employeur dès ta première journée!
  • Prime de rétention de 2000$ après 1 an avec nous
  • Prime de référencement de 1000$ pour chaque personne que tu nous envoies
  • Une ambiance agréable, une équipe expérimentée et disponible pour te soutenir dans ton développement
  • Une usine propre, climatisée et où nous travaillons sur de beaux projets!

Tu as choisi le quart de jour? Voici ce que c’est :

  • C’est de jour (quand même un bon début!), du lundi au jeudi de 7h à 17h
  • Si tu comptes vite, c’est trois jours de congé chaque semaine!
  • Possibilité d’over plus tôt le matin

Ce que tu devras accomplir au quotidien…

  • Lire et interpréter les schémas électriques et mécaniques pour déterminer l’emplacement des composantes dans l’unité de ventilation
  • Identifier les fils à l’aide des couleurs prédéterminées sur les plans
  • Installer toutes les composantes nécessaires à la confection d’une unité
  • Percer les trous dans l’unité en fonction des plans
  • Installer le filage dans toutes les composantes de l’unité
  • Monter les différents contrôles: compresseur, brûleur du panneau, les pièces et les collants
  • Brancher le mécanisme de zones, les volets et les servomoteurs s’il y a lieu
  • Faire la vérification visuelle du contrôle électrique
  • Analyser et effectuer des suivis de dossiers de production

Exigences :

  • DEP en électricité, dans un domaine connexe ou une combinaison formation et expérience pertinente
  • Avoir de bonnes aptitudes physiques puisque l'emploi requiert un travail physique en diverses positions
  • Avoir une connaissance du système de mesures impériales
  • De l'expérience en lecture de plans et de documents (un atout)

Nortek Air Solution, c’est quoi ça? C’est une entreprise qui améliore la qualité de vie des gens. Elle fabrique des projets sur mesure pour la clientèle. Des IMMENSES projets. On peut même entrer dedans! Ici, on fait des systèmes d’échangeurs d’air, de chauffage, de ventilation et de climatisation de toutes sortes. On offre des produits et des solutions ÉCOÉNERGÉTIQUES et durables qui surpassent les attentes de nos clients grâce à l’engagement de notre MERVEILLEUSE équipe envers la qualité, l’expérience client et l’excellence opérationnelle. Nos principales valeurs sont l’entrepreneurship, la confiance et l’initiative vers l’action. Nous avons L’INCROYABLE mission de créé un AVENIR MEILLEUR à chaque jour.

Nous avons LA place pour toi!', 'Installer le filage dans toutes les composantes de l’unité']

title: Technicien de production
description:
Tu es passionné par le domaine médical? Tu aimerais travailler pour une entreprise en pleine expansion dans la ville de Québec? Tu aimerais contribuer à la croissance d’une entreprise qui fait une différence dans le domaine de la santé au Québec?

Nous sommes présentement à la recherche de technicien de production à Québec. Nous rechercherons la perle rare pour occuper ce contrat en serre d'un durée de 9 mois.

Nous avons hâte de te rencontrer!





Avantages
Pour ce poste de technicien de production dans la ville de Québec, voici quelques qualificatifs à considérer :

Horaire de jour (6h-15h)
Poste en semaine, du lundi au vendredi
Salaire entre 24$ et 26$ selon expérience
Poste contractuel, d’une durée de 9 mois
Travailler sur plusieurs sites différents
Faire partie d’une superbe équipe de travail
Collaborer avec une entreprise de grande envergure à Québec

Responsabilités
Tous les jours, vous serez appelé à faire les tâches suivantes pour occuper ce poste de technicien de production à Québec :

Préparation de diverses solutions et des infiltrations
Récolte et arrosage des cultures
Nettoyage et décontamination des équipements de production
Documentation des opérations selon les procédures établies
Contrôle qualité du travail de ses collègues
Travail d’équipe

Qualifications
Pour occuper ce poste de technicien de production dans la ville de Québec, nous sommes à la recherche d’une personne polyvalente, qui présente une très grande capacité de minutie. Nous cherchons une personne qui souhaite faire des tâches répétitives.
Tu as :
Un D.E.C. ou études professionnelles en bioécologie, agronomie, horticulture ou autres?
Entre 1 et 2 ans d’expérience?
Une bonne capacité pour le travail physique?
Tu es une personne autonome, capable de travailler toute seule?
Si tu corresponds à tous ces critères, nous voulons te parler rapidement!

Sommaire
N’attends plus,
Ce poste vous intéresse? Avez-vous déjà un dossier chez Randstad?
Appelez-nous sans plus tarder au 418.525.6766 et demandez Cindy
Envoyez votre CV par courriel : cindy.darackian@radnstad.ca
Aimez notre page Facebook : Randstad industriel Ville de Québec
Créez votre profil en ligne: www.randstad.ca

Randstad est la plus grande agence de placement au Canada et chaque consultant est spécialisé dans son domaine. En plus de vous éclairer dans votre recherche d’emploi, ils seront en mesure de vous conseiller afin de vous aider à trouver un emploi à la hauteur de vos compétences.

La santé et la sécurité au travail étant au cœur de nos priorités, vous aurez également l’opportunité d’avoir accès à notre formation en ligne complètement gratuite.

** Vous avez un dossier chez Randstad et connaissez des gens qui se cherchent de l'emploi? Dites-leur de nous appeler en mentionnant votre nom, si cette personne décroche un emploi pour une période de un mois, vous vous mériterez 250$ ***

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Hiring For An Assembler!! $19.10-$22.00/hr!!
description:
Working with an extensive client base, Aerotek is searching for a Assembler with a LARGE company supporting oil and gas in south Edmonton!


Are you looking to further your skills in assembly and machine operating with a great company offering _daily overtime?_ Apply now!


Description:


Will be operating assembly machines which involves lifting up 25lb downhole tool components and loading it in the these machines. Basic process is to pick products out of a crate, scan and load them onto a table where they will clean and grease the o-rings with a q-tip and load components into the machine. Need to be able to read assembly machine commands that appear on the computer screen dashboard. Will need to use basic hand tools such as wrenches from time to time and also need to be able to help out other departments when needed and take on shop cleaning tasks. Will be working with an experienced tech on this machine (or assembly cell as it is known).


Qualifications:


+ Knowledge of basic hand and power tools (Allen wrench, drills and wrenches)*

+ Basic computer skills (can open and enter values in Excel, type emails in Outlook)

+ Willing to submit to prescreening ( D&A testing)*

+ Vehicle Required to get to work due to overtime

+ Willing to work overtime daily*

+ Ability to work Saturdays


Experience that would be helpful:


+ Overhead crane experience

+ Production machine operation

+ Forklift experience

+ Further educational experience (technical training)

+ Oil and gas shop experience


_*$19.10 - $22.00/hr_


_*Overtime Daily*_


_* Day Shift*_


_*Mon-Fri 6:00AM-4:30PM*_


_*APPLY NOW with resume & reference*_


À propos d'Aerotek:


Notre monde nous tient à cœur. Reconnu Best of Staffing MD par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aerotek MD Inc. se distingue comme chef de file du recrutement et en de la dotation de personnel grâce à sa grande compréhension des liens entre le talent et les affaires. Étant donné qu'Aerotek est un partenaire stratégique de plus de 18 000 clients et 300 000 employés contractuels chaque année, son approche axée sur les gens lui permet d'offrir un avantage concurrentiel à ses clients et des emplois gratifiants à ses employés contractuels. Aerotek, dont le siège social est à Hanover, au Maryland, exploite un réseau de plus de 250 bureaux non franchisés, comptant plus de 8 000 employés internes dévoués à servir nos clients. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent. Pour en savoir davantage, consultez le site aerotek.com/fr-ca.


About Aerotek:


We know that a company's success starts with its employees. We also know that an individual's success starts with the right career opportunity. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aerotek's people-focused approach yields competitive advantage for our clients and rewarding careers for our contract employees. Since 1983, Aerotek has grown to become a leader in recruiting and staffing services. With more than 250 non-franchised offices, Aerotek's 8,000 internal employees serve more than 300,000 contract employees and 18,000 clients every year. Aerotek is an Allegis Group company, the global leader in talent solutions. Learn more at Aerotek.com.


The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Operations Technician
description:
We are a major energy infrastructure business that has experienced tremendous growth over the past decade. This growth has provided our employees with stability, positive challenges, new career paths and opportunities to work in a dynamic team environment. As one of Alberta’s Top 75 Employers we are proud to say no matter where your role at Inter Pipeline may lie, you are provided ample opportunities for valued contribution and innovation, with a strong emphasis on employee growth.

Based at the Heartland Petrochemical Complex site this position is for an Operations Technician in the PDH (Propane Dehydrogenation) plant. The Operations Technician will report directly to the PDH Shift Supervisor.  The Operations Technician is required to train and qualify in the Oleflex/Fractionation Field positions and progress to the Oleflex/Fractionation console position post startup. Inter Pipeline is seeking individuals who place value in creating a great working culture which is in alignment with our core values.

Qualifications:  

  • Power or Chemical Engineering Diploma preferred
  • Minimum 3rd Class Power Engineering Certificate with a preference/progression for 2nd Class Certificates.

Experience:    

  • 10+ years Operations experience with a preference Oleflex or Fractionation or Cogeneration  experience
  • Strong technical understanding of plant processes and equipment, maintenance practices, process safety, safety instrumented systems, chemical safety, and emergency response plans is desired.
  • Preference will be given to Operations Technicians with Console Experience

Skills:

  • Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills,
  • Strong communication and technical writing abilities.
  • Attention to detail and well-developed interpersonal skills are required.
  • Ability to work a rotating, 12-hour day/night shifts.

Key Activities and Responsibilities:  

Pre-Start-Up Key Activities and Responsibilities:

  • Development and validation of commissioning and operational procedures.
  • Develop and install Lock out tag outs.
  • Conduct mechanical completion walkdowns and participation in commissioning and start-up of the Oleflex or Fractionation area of PDH.
  • Participate and/or lead system commissioning activities 
  • Assist in all aspects of operational readiness planning and execution 
  • Develop operating skills, knowledge and expertise during commissioning and start-up phase of the project. 

Post Start-Up Key Activities and Responsibilities:

  • Improve plant performance and operating discipline.
  • Work closely with the shift team and acts in coordination with the Shift Supervisor to provide leadership to the shift team in the execution of operational targets, goals, and plans. 
  • All Operations Technician responsibilities including, but not limited to, monitoring, troubleshooting, continual improvements, daily rounds and assisting with all operational readiness planning and execution.
  • Communicate efficiently and effectively with cross shift, with shift team members, and across operating areas, through verbal and written methods, including shift log books
  • Operates the HPC facility from the control room console using DCS, SIS, PLC and advanced control systems available.
  • Successful candidate will be required to be a member of the Emergency Response Team

Hours:

  • Full time shift work (days/nights) on a CSU schedule transitioning into a run and maintain schedule once operational.
  • Longer term this position will regularly rotate between console and field.

As this position is identified as safety and/or security sensitive, employment of a final candidate will be conditional upon completion of pre-employment medical, drug/alcohol, drivers abstract, employment verification and criminal background check assessments with satisfactory results.

Please note applicants for postings will be considered for any future PDH Operations Tech vacancies in the next six months.

Proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required for this position as a condition of employment. Requests for an exemption under applicable human rights legislation due to medical reasons or sincerely held religious beliefs will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

While diversity is a fact, inclusion is the act of recognizing the value of our differences and leveraging them for the betterment of our organization. At Inter Pipeline, we are dedicated to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that values, represents, and supports the communities in which we work. We are committed to maintaining a respectful workplace and we are building a culture that supports the diverse needs of our employees. We welcome applications from all individuals including those who are Indigenous, racialized, of varied abilities and ethnicities, members of gender and sexually diverse communities, as well as with any other dimension of diversity.

title: Assembler / General Labour
description:
We are a mature, North American systems integrator serving the Fortune 1000 space providing engineering services and turnkey solutions. From day one, we have pursued leadership positioning in every market we serve including process automation, control system integration, information and MES, automation and robotics systems, automated guided vehicles, material handling, and networking and security applications.  At JMP Solutions, our team helps people, plants, facilities, and equipment run safer, with better efficiency, improved quality and at a lower cost. Our purpose is to help our customers realize their full potential by continually redefining what is possible.


What Would a Typical Day Look Like?

  • You will review drawings and gather all required raw material to assemble the product as per the specified drawing.
  • Ensuring we produce high quality products is of the utmost importance to us. In this role you will help us achieve this goal by performing quality checks on the raw material gathered before use.
  • Learning from our experienced assemblers, you will assemble product according to drawing specifications. Once assembled, you will learn how to tag the product as per the drawing specifications.
  • You will have the chance to participate in the testing of the assembled product to ensure it matches drawing specifications before it is delivered to the customer.
  • You will help us get the product safely to the customer by assisting with packaging and shipping the final product.
  • You will complete administrative duties related to quality information and the recording and tracking of the time spent for each job.


What Qualifies You for this Opportunity?

  • High School Diploma required.
  • Experience assembling mechanical products required. Millwright experience would be a definite asset.
  • Ability to read AutoCAD/blueprint drawings and understand fraction and decimal measurements is required.
  • Must be able to work well under pressure and be able to meet tight deadlines
  • Must supply own CSA approved safety boots and provide own basic tools - wrench/socket set, hammer, screwdrivers, square and hex keys
  • Given the client-focused nature of the work, employees may be required to work over weekends or outside of standard business hours as needed and travel throughout Canada.
  • Forklift and First Aid Certifications are considered an asset
  • Welding experience is considered an asset.

  

What does success look like at JMP?

At JMP, our employees bring more to the table than simply their technical skills. Essential to success at JMP, employees are constantly flexing the following soft skill behaviors to compliment the technical aspects of their roles.

  • Personal Effectiveness: strong communication, adaptability, self-awareness, negotiation, problem-solving
  • Tenacity: purpose, determination, drive, perseverance
  • Sense of urgency: responsiveness, energy, engagement, loyalty
  • Smarts: comprehension, learning aptitude, skillfulness, brain power
  • Accountable: takes ownership, responsible, go-to person, decisiveness

 

 Who is JMP?

A mature, North American company founded in 1987 with 16 business units across the US and Canada, JMP serves the Fortune 1000 space providing engineering services and turnkey solutions in seven core areas: process automation, control system integration, information and MES, automation and robotics systems, automated guided vehicles, material handling, and networking and security applications.  

 

One of the fastest growing Systems Integrators in the world, and the only company in the world who is a Rockwell Automation Solution Partner, CSIA and RIA Certified. We have been certified as a “Great Place to Work” 2013 through 2020 and a “Best Workplaces Canada” award recipient from 2013 through 2020, including Best Workplaces for Inclusion and for Women 2020.

 

What does JMP value?

Our values are our foundational concepts on which we build JMP; we adhere to these no matter what mountain we climb.

  • Integrity: We do what we say we will do, every time, all the time.
  • Relationships: We identify professional working relationships and create opportunities to develop those relationships
  • Collaboration: We team together to achieve far more than we could on our own
  • Leadership: We value people who lead by example, take pride in what they do and inspire others
  • Respect: We promotes a caring environment of mutual respect for employees, customers, partners, and communities
  • Excellence: We set high standards of performance for ourselves and our team

 

Why join the JMP team?

As a growing company in the industrial technology industry and rooted with strong corporate values, JMP Solutions can offer a unique value proposition to employees. Our employee promise is a rewarding employee experience delivered through a focus on three key areas:

  • Development and Career Growth
  • Impact and Recognition
  • Flexibility and Collaboration

 

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

 

JMP Solutions has an accommodation program in place that provides reasonable accommodations for employees with disabilities. If you require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please contact Human Resources.
skills: ['As a growing company in the industrial technology industry and rooted with strong corporate values, JMP Solutions can offer a unique value proposition to employees. title: Cylinder Assembler (FT)
description:
We have a permanent position available in Assembly. Practical knowledge of mechanical and hydraulic system is an asset. We will provide training on our hydraulics, mechanical and test systems. The position is full time 7:00am – 3:30pm.   
 
Main Responsibilities: 
  • Assembly and Testing of the Vertical and Elvoron Hydraulic Cylinders
  • Co-ordinate with Machine Shop and Paint Shop to ensures timely production of required cylinders
  • Build and test cylinders according to drawing and order specifications
  • Ensures high levels of quality – cylinders must be free defects that may affect the ride quality of the lifts
  • Record assembly and test data in Pivot88 as required.
Skills and Qualifications: 
  • Mechanical and Hydraulic knowledge and experience
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken) 
  • High attention to detail
  • Able to lift 50+ lbs repeatedly throughout the day
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision. 
  • Crane operator certification (can train)
Benefits
  • Employer Paid Benefits Program
  • Extended Health
  • Extended Dental
  • RRSP Program




    About Garaventa Lift Canada:

    At Garaventa Lift, we believe and work to guarantee accessibility and mobility to everyone. Since our start, we have been obsessively passionate about it and our mission is to help people achieve it.The roots of the company go back to 1928 in the beautiful Swiss Alps where Karl Garaventa built his very first of many cable cars.Since then, Garaventa Lift has grown into a global leader with a strong presence worldwide.The Garaventa Lift Group is now a prominent reality in America, Asia, Europe and Oceania standing for reliability, security and innovation of accessibility products to create an accessible world.We work to deliver custom lift solutions for commercial and residential applications and bring our engineering expertise and high-quality standards to remove architectural barriers for millions of people worldwide.

title: Electronics Mechanical Assembler (Temporary)
description:
One team. Global challenges. Infinite opportunities. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team.

Job Responsibilities

As an Electronics Mechanical Assembler you are responsible for technical functions in support of production and repair activities such as electro-mechanical assembly. You will utilize schematics, engineering drawings, verbal instructions, change notices, and parts lists to inspect for updates and verify assembly revisions. Another facet of your work will be completing Electro-Mechanical assembly and refurbishment of complex communication equipment, stand-alone chassis, and cable harness assemblies.

Requirements
•1 to 2 years electronic assembly/rework experience in a manufacturing/repair environment or equivalent education 
•Experience working with top-level chassis assemblies and circuit card modules  
•Experience with coaxial, ribbon, and discrete wire and cables. 
•Ability to read and process work orders, assembly instructions, assembly drawings and bill of materials. 
•Good mechanical skills, knowledge of hand tools, crimp tools and torque tools and ability to use power screw drivers, torque driver and other assembly tools 
•Excellent written and verbal communication skills
•Proficient computer skills 
•Knowledge of ESD procedures 
•High School or GED
•US government position. US citizenship required.


To learn more about this site and other office locations, please click here!

title: Assembler - Truck Equipment
description:
Vehicle Accessories Assembler

If you love mechanical assembly and enjoy fresh challenges each day this job is for you! Due to continued business growth, we are looking for a full-time accessories assembler, to join our champion production team. We are an innovative, fast paced vehicle equipment installer with a clean, positive culture & safe work environment.

Sterling Fleet Outfitters exists to improve the lives of mobile technicians! Providing them with outfitting solutions that minimize their downtime and maximize their effectiveness, giving them the best opportunity to be great on the job.

WHO ARE YOU?

  • Have a good attitude & morals
  • Honest
  • Upbeat & Positive
  • A team player
  • Action-oriented
  • Self-Motivated

Experience

  • Previous vehicle accessories assembly is preferred, but willing to train the right candidate
  • Have proven mechanical aptitude and problem solving skills
  • Operating Shear, brake, saws and basic hand tools
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Physically fit and be able to lift, bend and stand for a complete shift
  • Class 5 driver's license
  • Able to drive a fork lift
  • Be capable of lifting 50lb

Not required but a definite asset:

Experience with installing 12v electrical lighting/ inverters/ backup alarms and 12v electrical problem solving

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

  • As a Van & Truck Equipment Accessories Assembler you will assemble partitions, shelving, ladder racks, custom cabinets/ draw systems, mount components for commercial vehicles
  • Potential for career progression in to vehicle installations
  • Interpret and follow detailed assembly instructions
  • Customize various panels to fit design specifications
  • Operate: Shear, brake, saws and basic hand tools
  • Be capable of lifting 50lb

YOUR WAGE & HOURS

  • Hours of work: 7:00 am — 3:30 pm Monday – Friday
  • Wage: Dependent upon experience with a 3-month review. $20 - $27

Check out our website and gallery to learn more about what we do. https://sterlingfleetoutfitter...

Work remotely

  • No

title: Assembler - Trainee
description:
Looking to start a career as an Agricultural Equipment Assembler or Heavy Equipment Assembler but don’t have the certifications? Brandt is offering an exclusive in-house assembly training program!

Equipment Assembly Experience Not Required!

Brandt will provide the necessary training and invest in you to help you start or continue your career. It’s a great time to join the team!

We are offering this program to current and external applicants. This assembly training program will allow you to advance your career by challenging yourself, adding new skills to your arsenal, and opening new opportunities for promotion.

Why continue your education with this Brandt University Training Program?

  • Learn how to use tools and equipment.
  • Learn how to assemble and manufacture quality products in an efficient manner
  • The simple, streamlined course delivers the exact training you need to get started as an equipment assembler, without spending money and time on training you won’t use at Brandt.
  • Earn regular pay while you are training!
  • Tuition and training material costs are covered for candidates who are hired into the training program.
  • This is an excellent opportunity to learn skills, start a career, and enhance your long-term advancement potential.

DETAILS

  • Courses are taking place on an ongoing basis.
  • 7:00am – 3:30pm Monday through Friday.
