title: Assembler
description:
If you’re looking for a special place to build or grow your career, you’ve found it. Whether you’re an experienced professional, a recent college graduate or somewhere in between, IDEX is a place where you can apply your existing skills and learn new ones in an environment where you can make an impact. With interesting opportunities in engineering, marketing, sales, supply chain, operations, HR, finance, and more across more than 40 diverse businesses (https://www.idexcorp.com/our-businesses/business-segments/) around the globe, chances are, we have something special for you.

Position Summary:

This role is responsible for assembly, testing and documenting operating conditions of the product line.

Hours of Work:

Mon to Thurs (7am to 4pm) and Friday (7am to 3pm)

Reports To:

Production Leader

Essential Functions:

+ Position and install parts, subassemblies and accessories. + Test electrical drive motors for proper performance using testing devices. + Inspect equipment/parts after assembly. + Mark, record and report defects. + Pick and expedite parts from work orders, as required. + Work in compliance with the company’s health and safety and policies and procedures as well as ISO standards and procedures. + Other duties, as assigned

Qualifications:

+ Grade 12 or equivalent + 3-5 years of experience in machine building, machining and/or assembly. + Good written and verbal communications required. + Competent using Microsoft applications + Used an Inventory or Planning Software. + Ability to reach schematics, blueprints and other technical diagrams. + Ability to multi-task within a fast-paced environment + Good interpersonal skills + Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills + A strong attention to detail with a commitment to quality and safety

Physical Demands:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to: + Stand, Walk and/or Sit 50% of the time + Use hands to handle, reach and feel : 90% of the time + Talk and hear 100% of the time + Regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds

About us:

IDEX Corporation ( www.idexcorp.com ) is a

leading manufacturer of highly engineered diversified products

in industries ranging across health, science, safety, fire and fluidics. Operating in 24 countries, IDEX is an innovative and rapidly growing company, focused on delivering excellence through diverse, winning teams. IDEX lives the values of Trust, Team and Excellence. The

Waterloo Material Processing Technologies (MPT) group

within IDEX Corporation is comprised of the following business units: + Quadro Engineering Corp. (www.quadro-mpt.com (https://urldefense.com/v3/\_\_http:/www.quadro-mpt.com\_\_;!!NlLrMPuo!8rF7FUeZX0u1cGOGsj1WWL8nOiPLFunO7VWgBPfxwQnWVYWVoQ6KnX\_Nz9UjzLI$) ) + The Fitzpatrick Company (www.fitzpatrick-mpt.com (https://urldefense.com/v3/\_\_http:/www.fitzpatrick-mpt.com\_\_;!!NlLrMPuo!8rF7FUeZX0u1cGOGsj1WWL8nOiPLFunO7VWgBPfxwQnWVYWVoQ6KnX\_NTuOmvYM$) ) + Microfluidics International Corporation (www.microfluidics-mpt.com (https://urldefense.com/v3/\_\_http:/www.microfluidics-mpt.com\_\_;!!NlLrMPuo!8rF7FUeZX0u1cGOGsj1WWL8nOiPLFunO7VWgBPfxwQnWVYWVoQ6KnX\_NgnF4Ht8$) ) + Steridose (www.steridose.com (https://urldefense.com/v3/\_\_http:/www.steridose.com\_\_;!!NlLrMPuo!8rF7FUeZX0u1cGOGsj1WWL8nOiPLFunO7VWgBPfxwQnWVYWVoQ6KnX\_NK0AjZ9A$) ) These companies are leading brands within

Pharmaceutical, Food, Cosmetic, Personal Care and Chemical markets

where they engineer and manufacture technologically superior equipment for material processing (solid, semi-solid and liquid). Significant investments in capital, new positions and development of existing people are being made at the Waterloo, Ontario site which houses the headquarters (all functions) for Quadro Engineering, Fitzpatrick and operations for Microfluidics and Steridose. _Quadro Engineering Corp. is committed to providing a barrier-free workplace. If accommodation is required during the selection or interview process, it will be available upon request. This job posting is available in an accessible format upon request._ Are you ready to join a different kind of company where our people, our culture, and our commitments are centered around providing trusted solutions that improve lives around the world? IDEX is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Affirmative Action Employer. IDEX gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, genetic information, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other consideration or protected category made unlawful by federal, state or local laws (Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled).

Business Unit:

Quadro

Job Segment:

HST Health & Science Technologies

title: Manufacturing Intern
description:
Alexandria Moulding is currently seeking Summer Students to join our team.
We have positions available in our manufacturing and distribution centers.

Qualifications:
  • Successful candidates will be assigned to one of these area’s based on available opportunities at the time of hire.
  • Candidates must be full-time students and enrolled in high-school (grade 11 or 12) or a Post-Secondary Institution for 2022.
Job Details:
  • All assignments require adherence to specific procedures and work practices related to manufacturing.
  • Work is scheduled on 8- or 12-hour shift (day, afternoon, night, weekend shifts) to provide relief to the regular employees during summer vacation period.
General Responsibilities Include:
  • Ensure safety standards are met by following Alexandria Moulding safe work and lockout procedures.
  • Maintain high standards of cleanliness in your work area and throughout the facility.
  • Train and develop skills in various areas of the facility.
  • Willing to work in an environment with varying temperatures and conditions.
  • Develop strong working relationships with your peers and manufacturing and distribution teams.
  • Work assigned requires problem solving skills and capability to perform the physical aspects of the role (lifting, bending, standing, pushing/pulling etc.)
  • Housekeeping.
The Candidate:
  • Ability to work in a safe and efficient manner.
  • Available to work various shifts.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Ability to analyze and troubleshoot.
  • Positive attitude and a self-starter.
  • Able to work in an environment that may include exposure to weather, dust, moving mechanical parts, and noise.

title: Production Associate
description:
Summary

We are looking for a part time Production Associate to assist our Operations team.

 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Assembling and testing satellite products
  • Other duties as assigned

 

Qualifications

  • High School diploma
  • Prior experience assembling and testing satellite products
  • Detail oriented
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines

 

About Us

 

Comtech is a leading provider of innovative and optimized satellite communications solutions. Our efficient and reliable ground equipment portfolio meets the unique demands of our mobile backhaul, government, mobility and enterprise customers on every continent, in 160+ countries and across every ocean. For more information, visit www.comtechefdata.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

Résumé

Nous sommes à la recherche d'un associé de production à temps partiel pour aider notre équipe des opérations.

 

Fonctions et responsabilités essentielles

  • Assemblage et essais de produits satellites
  • Autres tâches assignées

 

Qualifications

  • Diplôme d'études secondaires
  • Expérience préalable dans l'assemblage et l'essai de produits satellites
  • Orienté détail
  • Capacité à travailler dans un environnement rapide et à respecter les délais

 

À propos de nous

 

Comtech est l'un des principaux fournisseurs de solutions de communications par satellite innovantes et optimisées. Notre portefeuille d'équipements au sol efficaces et fiables répond aux exigences uniques de nos clients mobiles, gouvernementaux, mobiles et d'entreprise sur tous les continents, dans plus de 160 pays et à travers tous les océans. Pour plus d'informations, visitez www.comtechefdata.com. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront considérés pour un emploi sans égard à la race, la couleur, la religion, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'identité de genre, l'origine nationale, le handicap ou le statut d'ancien combattant protégé. Des mesures d'adaptation raisonnables peuvent être prises pour permettre aux personnes handicapées d'exercer les fonctions essentielles.

title: Structural Assembler
company: The Wohl Group - Recruitment Made Easy!
description:
Scope of Position

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the Structural Assembler is responsible for installing, and assembling components on an aircraft structure.

Position Summary
  • Proficient in Blueprint Reading and Hole Layout, Countersinking and Deburring.
  • Fitting and installation of conventional rivets and Hi-Lite fasteners
  • Assemble and fit pre-fabricated parts to form subassemblies, working at benches or directly on an aircraft structure.
  • Application of manual solvent, conductive chemical conversion treatment and paint touch-up
  • Working with a variety of power and hand tools, jigs, fixtures and other equipment
  • Meeting schedule and production requirements
Education:
  • Completion of recognized Sheet Metal Fabrication course preferred.
  • Completion of a college or other program in aviation or aeronautical technology, with emphasis in aircraft manufacturing.
Experience:
  • Use of Hand Tool for drilling, countersinking, torquing, installing (fasteners, hi-lites).
  • Ability to read blueprints and interpret technical drawings (2D and 3D).
  • Sub-assemblies, sheet metal assembly, mechanical assembly, etc.
  • 1-10 yrs. experience in structural assembly (salary will be subject to years of experience and competency testing).
  • Previous experience in the aerospace industry or manufacturing environment considered an asset.
  • Prior exposure to quality systems and safety fundamentals.
Must Haves
  • Must be a strong team player, who is flexible and willing to learn new tasks.
  • Must have flexibility to work rotating shifts to accommodate production schedule, including days, afternoons, nights and overtime as required.
  • Must be mechanically inclined and know how to use Pneumatic, or power hand tools.
  • You must wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) at all times on the plant floor (i.e. safety glasses, safety shoes and ear plugs) and follow all Health & Safety procedures at all times.
  • Must be able to pass a Pulmonary Fit Test (PFT) for proper fitting of respirators as needed to perform the job safely, especially in work areas that may have exposure to chemicals or odors from paints, solvents etc. To ensure proper fitting of respirators all employees using respirators must be clean shaven at all times as per the Canadian Standard Association (CSA) requirements.
  • Must be physically fit, energetic, agile, willing and able to:
  • work in restricted spaces (tanks)
  • work at heights (3rd floor of jigs)
  • work rotating shifts when and as required
  • bend, twist, walk on uneven surfaces and climb stairs repeatedly during shift
  • perform heavy lifting (< 40 lbs) as needed to perform the job
  • stand for 7 hours of an 8 hour shift
Salary Range: $20-$30/hr

***We thank all applications for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No agencies or phone calls.Thank you and Good Luck.

title: Production Technician - Electro-mechanical assembly
description:
The Job

You will be performing detailed electronic and electro-mechanical assembly in sub-assembly or assembly units, as well as bench testing of Integrated Navigation Bridge System components. In building and testing of electro-mechanical assemblies, the incumbent will hold tolerances to blueprint and/or oral and written specifications.
You will also be responsible for performing parts installation, wiring, cable harnessing and hand soldering using standard sequence and also perform repairs to legacy/customer equipment.

The main responsibilities are:
  • Organize and verify components for assembly or installation
  • Assemble sub-assembly and/or final assembly units in a timely fashion
  • Solder wires and assembly of cable connections as required
  • Build and/or test electro-mechanical assemblies to blueprint and/or oral and written specifications
  • Maintain accurate records of all quality, operations and assembly related documentation and procedures
  • Ensure high quality of executed duties on an ongoing basis to support exceptional standards of quality, delivery, compliance and excellence
  • Comply with OSI Maritime Systems established ISO-9001-compliant development guidelines and standards
  • Comply with workplace operational, environmental, health and safety procedure guidelines

You bring

  • 3-5 years’ electro-mechanical experience in detailed soldering
  • Knowledge of hand tools, power tools, fixtures and measuring devices including DVMs
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Word and Microsoft ExcelAttention to detail in ensuring that quality and efficiency standards are met or exceeded
  • Excellent oral and written English communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Adequate close vision and color & depth perception
  • This position may require lifting and moving products of up to 50 lbs
  • May be required to work overtime as needed
  • Some domestic travel may be required from time to time
  • Experience in electro-mechanical assembly, testing along with following schematics, experience working in an ISO 9001 compliant environment would be an asset.

About US

In 1977, OSI introduced the first generation electronic chart system for the maritime market and revolutionized navigation. Over the years we have had many firsts.Today, OSI Maritime Systems is a leading provider of integrated navigation and tactical solutions designed for naval and maritime security operations. Among those solutions, the company develops and delivers integrated bridge systems for warships, integrated dived navigation systems for submarines, and C2 systems for small craft. Presently, 23navies totaling more than 600 warships and submarines operate using OSI systems.

Due to the nature of our company, all employees must pass specific security criteria. Only candidates who are Canadian citizens, have PR status or have a citizenship from a NATO country, and who satisfy security clearance criteria, will be considered.

Why OSI?

We have a Professional Development program in place that supports our employees in their career development by providing funds, time, and opportunities to become better at what they do.

At OSI you can make a difference. We are a change willing organization that is always looking for new ideas. We strive to improve what it is we do and how we do it. If you have ideas we would love to hear about them.

OSI fosters an inclusive and diverse culture. We celebrate our diversity and strive to be more inclusive because it makes us a better company.

We also offer great benefits:
  • Extended healthcare
  • Dental care
  • Group Retirement Savings Plan
  • Emergency Travel Assistance
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program

title: Assembly Operator
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

To produce a quality product in a safe and efficient manner.

Responsibilities:
  • Manufactures steel automotive parts using automated and hand transfer presses, robotics welders, and other machinery as assigned.
  • Conducts regular quality checks and reports to Supervisor.
  • Ensure cleanliness of workstation.
Qualifications:
  • Previous factory or related work experience
  • Ability to stand for entire shift, lift moderate weight to shoulder height, carry out repetitive motions with wrists and forearms
  • Familiarity with automotive/manufacturing environment
Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?

â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€
Not just a jobâ€”a great place to work!

title: Production Assembler I
description:
WORK LOCATION: 7371 Vantage Way Delta BC, V4G 1C9

WORKING HOURS: 6:30AM to 3:00PM Monday thru Thursday and 6:30AM to 2:10PM
QUALIFICATIONS:
Academic: Grade 12 diploma preferred. Courses in mechanical/electrical technology an asset.

Work Experience: Minimum three years mechanical/electrical assembly and/or metal fabrication experience or equivalent required. Experience in use of pneumatic tools an asset. Forklift certification is required.

Skills/Other: Ability to read blueprints, competence in mathematics, ability to lift 25 lbs, strong time management skills and ability to change priorities as required. Must have own tools.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Grinding, cleaning, pressure washing parts.
  • Parts assembly (mechanical, hydraulic, electrical) under supervision.
  • Pallet/ crate building.
  • Crating and packaging for shipping.
  • Keep an accurate record of time charged to each job.
  • General shop maintenance and participation in weekly shop cleanup.
  • Full comprehension of safety requirements.
  • Participates in quality assurance.
  • Other duties as assigned.

EMAIL: careers@hillmar.com

title: Opérateur de production
description:
Poste : opérateur de production
Lieu de travail : Saint-Jérôme

À la recherche d’un emploi stable au sein d’une entreprise qui a à cœur le bien-être de ses employés? Alors, lisez attentivement ce qui suit. Vous pourriez rapidement décrocher un nouvel emploi.

Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche de plusieurs opérateurs de production pour une entreprise située à Saint-Jérôme dans le domaine de la transformation du bois.

Nous recherchons des employés assez flexibles au niveau de l’horaire, capables de travailler de jour, de soir et de nuit afin de pouvoir respecter la convention collective en vigueur.

Ce que nous offrons :

- Emploi permanent à long terme
- Assurances complètes (dentaire, médicale, vie, invalidité, etc.)
- Montant forfaitaire pour activités sportives
- Cotisation dans un fonds de pension à prestation déterminée
- Équipements de protection et vêtements fournis
- Ambiance de travail dynamique et de type familiale
- Emploi syndiqué
- Remplacement de départ à la retraite

Ce qu'il faut pour postuler :

- DES ou équivalent complété
- Au moins 1 an d'expérience dans une usine manufacturière ou entrepôt
- Disponibilité pour travailler de jour, de soir ou de nuit

Vos tâches :

- Assurer le contrôle de qualité des produits finis
- Faire fonctionner la machinerie industrielle
- Respecter les mesures et les normes demandées par les clients
- Respecter les directives et procédures de travail
- Suivre les consignes de santé-sécurité et relever tout risque
- Accomplir toutes autres tâches connexes

Cet emploi d’opérateur de production à Saint-Jérôme vous intéresse? Veuillez envoyer rapidement votre CV en format Word à Philip Agbi à />
RECOMMANDEZ UNE PERSONNE EMBAUCHÉE POUR UN POSTE PERMANENT ET GAGNEZ JUSQU’À 1 000 $ ! Pour plus d’informations, cliquez ici.


NOS PORTES VIRTUELLES SONT OUVERTES! En plus, vous passerez les entrevues à domicile grâce à différentes applications Web! Alors, contactez-nous dès aujourd’hui pour relever votre prochain défi professionnel.

title: Manufacturing Jobs- Guelph
description:
You already LOVE us and the SNACKS WE MAKE

Chips, Cookies, Crackers, Wafers, Cheese Curls, Popcorn, Tortilla Chips... yeah, we make them ALL! Shearer's is the company behind all your favorite snack brands.

We have over 5,000 associates in 11 state-of-the-art manufacturing and warehouse sites in North America that produce over 800 million pounds of snacks per year. And we know what you're thinking…how can I get my hands on some free goodies? Our team members can take home free snacks!

Now offering NEW PAY RATES AND contract seasonal opportunities from April through early September for Packer and Machine Operators!

We are hiring for the following Job Opportunities at our  Bakery Manufacturing Plant in Guelph:

  • Machine Operator (oven room)  Starting Pay 20.48  & $21.48 after 1040 hours

    • shift premium $0.30 for afternoon shift 3:00 pm -11:00 pm Monday to Friday

    • shift premium $0.45 for night shift Sunday 9:00 pm - 7:00 am and Monday to Thursday 11:00 pm -7:00 am

       

  • Packer Team Member - Starting Pay $19.19  & 20.19 after 1040 hours
    • shift premium $0.30 for the afternoon shift - 3:00 pm -11:00 pm Monday to Friday
    • shift premium $0.45 for the night shift - 11:00 pm to 7:00 am Sunday - Thursday

 

Please note: we have the following allergens in our facility: Peanuts, Wheat, Whey, Dairy and Soya

We Offer a Feast of Benefits
Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Retirement Savings Plan with Match, Short Term Disability, Employee Assistance Plan and a great group of people to work with every day!

You will be considered for employment in our inclusive workplace:
Shearer's Foods Canada, Inc. is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities; please advise us if you require accommodation during the recruitment process.

This is your invitation to apply now!

title: Production Assembly Technician
description:
An exciting opportunity for Production Assembly Technician. This is a permanent opportunity with Qvella Corporation located in Richmond Hill, Ontario. 

Nature and Scope of Work:

Responsible for meeting daily assembly production objectives by performing required tasks including parts preparation and inspection, devices assembly and testing in accordance with established procedures. Assist in the prototyping, validation, documentation and scale-up of production processes. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily:

  • Meet daily production assembly requirements by following engineering drawings, specifications, bill of materials and other written instructions to accurately assemble/test microfluidic devices.
  • Self-inspect oneâ€™s own work and identify defects to ensure compliance with established quality standard.
  • Maintain the integrity of production facility including organizing/cleaning work stations, maintaining inventory of product in work stations and assisting production cycle count.
  • Coordinate with production planner to ensure the accuracy and delivery of planned production orders.
  • Assist with writing, implementing, and maintaining production processes and quality related documentation as directed by the supervisor/manager.
  • Analyze testing data, interpret results and report findings and conclusions through written and oral presentations.
  • Assist in production process improvement and product validation projects
  • Work with quality team to monitor product quality, improve process yield and reduce waste.
  • Work closely with team members for accuracy and completion of production order in a timely manner.
  • Other duties may also be assigned.

Qualifications and Requirements:

  • 5 years hands-on experience in small-scale device assembly industry with particular interest in experience gained in pharmaceutical, biomedical, IVD or other related industry.
  • High level of proficiency in understanding engineering drawings, handling general lab tools and equipment.
  • Attention to details, highly organized, flexible, persistent and proactive way of working.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with a proven track record of fast learning and multitasking ability. Work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Good understanding of work safety requirements/regulations and quality GMP/ISO methodology.
  • Work well in a small team and be able to handle the pressure of meeting tight deadlines
  • Good verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Good MS-Office skills

Note: from time to time, the incumbent in this role will be working in a cleanroom, requiring the use of a hairnet and facemask. To protect the integrity of our cleanroom, employees are not permitted to smoke before entering on any given day. If any person is exposed to cigarette smoke (including second hand), it is required to shower, wash hair and wear fresh clothing as a prerequisite to using any workspace in the cleanroom.

 

Education:

  • University or college degree in applied science, mechanical engineering or other related fields. 

In support of our commitment to a healthy and safe workplace, Qvella Corporation has a vaccination requirement as a condition to the offer of employment. Fully vaccinated is defined as having received a completed series of an accepted COVID-19 vaccine, as recommended or approved by Health Canada and having received the final dose at least 14 days before your employment start date.  Ongoing boosters may be required in the future as a continuing condition of employment, as they are announced by Health Canada.  We will provide a full copy of our policy at the time of offer. 

The candidate will be asked to provide Qvella with proof of full vaccination, prior to their employment start date. Acceptable proof is a Ministry of Health Dose Administration Receipt.  This can be obtained through the Provincial portal at https://covid19.ontariohealth.ca/.   We will also accept out of province vaccination records, provided they have the same information included in the Ministry of Health Dose Administration Receipt.  This includes the type of vaccine, date of each dose and sufficient identification information to connect the receipt to the candidate. 

The requirement to be fully vaccinated is subject to the Ontario Human Rights Code. If the candidate is unable to vaccinate for a reason protected by the Code, a request for accommodation can be made upon written proof, satisfactory to the company.

 

What are you waiting for? Apply Now!

Qvella is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all.  If you are selected to participate in the recruitment process, please inform us of any accommodations you may require. Qvella will work with you in an effort to ensure that you are able to fully participate in the process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Must be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work permit or study permit that allows the candidate to fulfill the requirements of the role.

We thank all interested applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Production Technician -19/hour
description:
A LITTLE BIT ABOUT US... 

At Rocky Mountain Soap Co., we are PASSIONATE about everything NATURAL! For over 20 years, we have been crafting natural recipes right here in the Rocky mountains with one goal in mind..to remove toxins from the world.  Itâ€™s our way of feeling great about the products we put out there, supporting our community with career opportunities, sustainable initiatives, and creating natural enthusiasts across Canada! The Rocky team is at the HEART of what we do, and our team is growing.  Not only do we make products that are good for you, we want people that want to make a difference too.  If you love a healthy planet, care about natural ingredients, and want to work in a fun, inclusive, right in the Rockies workshop environment, then the Rocky family might be the right fit for you!

WHAT TO EXPECT AS A PRODUCTION TECHNICHIAN:

  • This position is located in our Canmore Alberta Workshop 
  • Upon start of employment you be trained on our key processes and procedures.
  • Key processes include, but not limited to: The production and assembly/ bottling of various products (sanitizers, lip & body butters, creams, liquid soap products, bar soaps, bath bombs & salts, cleansers, scrubs, etc.)
  • Operate automated, semi-automated or manual work stations for mixing, pouring, filling, labeling, packaging products.
  • Process returned bottles and other packaging through a cleaning and sanitizing procedure as part of Rocky Mountain Soap's Sustainability program.
  • Adhere to all safety guidelines set out by company including COVID-19 Healthy Team Agreement.
  • Ensure that all products are produced according to RMSC guidelines and quality requirements.
  • Ensure cleanliness and tidiness of line, work space, equipment and workshop. 

DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?

  • You like to be on the move and are capable of handling physical work
  • Must be comfortable lifting/handling weight up to 50lbs 
  • Goal/task-oriented with attention to detail
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, team-oriented, self-motivated, self-starter
  • Experience in a production environment is an asset (food prep and kitchen work are similar)
  • Good written and spoken English skills
  • Ability to organize and prioritize tasks in a rapidly changing environment
  • Ability to learn and adapt easily to new methods
  • Competent in basic math skills (add/subtract/multiply/divide)
  • Comfortable in the use of measuring equipment (weights and volumes)
  • Ability to work highly scented environment.
  • Can commit to full-time schedule Monday to Friday 8:00am - 4:00, half-hour unpaid lunch break.
  • Looking for candidates with availability as soon as possible. This position status can be discussed upon hire as we are seeking Full Time Permanent employees and/ or Seasonal with the possibility of contract extension as well.

PERKS & BENEFITS

  • Starting wage: $19/hour
  • Free product allowance and product discounts
  • Team events
  • Full Time Team members are enrolled into our group health Benefits plan!
  • Belong to a collaborative team in a happy, healthy work environment

title: Mold Assembler - Repairs
description:
If you’re looking to build a career with a successful, growing organization where you’ll be invested in; a leader in the injection mold industry that creates products you touch on a daily basis; a team of passionate people, some with 20, 30 and 40 years of service, who want to see you succeed…then look at StackTeck Systems Ltd. 

The position of Mold Assembler is responsible for the assembly/disassembly of injection molds and components within the molds, to repair and test based on customer requirements.  This position will report into the Supervisor, Repair Department at the Teck Center.

 

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Disassemble and clean molds to evaluate repairs necessary
  • Troubleshoot components and document needed repairs
  • Utilize a variety of measuring instruments such as micrometers, calipers, etc.
  • Works to close tolerances on all assigned work projects
  • Use various hand/power tools to complete assembly/disassembly functions
  • Read, interpret and follow basic diagrams, or engineering drawings, and other written instructions or procedures to accurately assemble component
  • Performs general housekeeping duties of work area and shop floor.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

TECHNICAL SKILLS / EXPERIENCE

  • Post-Secondary education in a Mechanical discipline, but not necessary
  • 2-3 years of mechanical assembly experience is required
  • Ability to use measuring instruments
  • Knowledge of Plastic Injection Molds preferred

CORE COMPETENCIES

  • Decision Making: Utilizing effective process to make decisions on own.
  • Teamwork: Working effectively with others
  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem solving aptitude
  • Attention to detail: Making sure things are done right the first time
  • Interpersonal Skills: Effectively communicating, building rapport and relating well to people.
  • Self Motivated: Ability to work alone with minimal supervision and/or direction

 

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, (AODA), StackTeck will provide accommodation, accessible formats, and communication supports for the recruitment process upon request.

We thank all who apply and will respond to those who most closely match the requirements.

title: Assembly Technician
description:
ASSEMBLY TECHNICIAN  - Reporting directly to the Assistant Manager

  • The Assembly Technician is responsible for working directly with sales, production staff, and applicable processes utilized in the means and facilitation of production, shipping, and procurement of goods and services.
  • Along with its expectation of quality product, understand service is paramount to our customers. Understand that our group of companies operates in a safe, compliant manner. You as a key employee have an obligation not only to lead, but also to actively participate in inspection, reporting, maintenance, hazard assessment, and safe â€“ work practices that guarantee the success of not only our business, but you as a long â€“ term employee.

 

  • JOB REQUIREMENTS: â€¢ Use mechanical and power vehicles (forklifts/pallet jacks) to load and unload goods from storage racks and points within our facility to compliment your duties.
  • You will be trained specifically for our company prior to any use of this equipment.
  • Safely use hand-tools and various manual methods of material handling required in your daily tasks as required, requiring you to safely lift 50 lbs repeatedly.
  • Ensure lifting devices, cranes, and forklifts are inspected and documented daily as per company requirements.
  • Follows inspections to documented procedures and best practice to ensure the condition, quantity, and specifications, and configurations of the goods are as ordered.
  • Advise and work with the applicable team member to advise/document proof of completed assembly and accessories as per documented procedures.
  • Prepare orders and equipment in a sound, secure manner ensuring each order is safe to transport to ultimate destination.
  • Complete all applicable documents specific to your task and record all serial numbers and manufacturersâ€™ equipment type to identify outgoing orders consistently and optimally. â€¢ Ensure all stock not used is put away in a timely, neat, and tidy manner which allows for ease of identification and access and minimizing damage/degradation.
  • Provides warehouse support services for maintenance and operations as/when required. â€¢ Maintain a clean, orderly assembly area by keeping surfaces regularly swept, garbageâ€™s emptied, tools put away and recycled materials dealt with accordingly.
  • Proactively problem-solve and maintain a cooperative â€œteam-basedâ€ environment. â€¢ Assist in other departments with other tasks, as required. â€¢ Ensure that incoming remanufactured/repaired stock is put away in proper place daily.
  • Ensure that incoming goods are received and verified against the applicable purchase order or sales order. This task will be shared between yourself and shipper. Minimum Qualification Requirements
  • Fluent in English, communicate effectively, both written and verbal. â€¢ Minimum 2 years oilfield experience is desirad

title: Assembler
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a Assembler at our 352 Arvin Ave. location.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the Assembler is responsible for performing a variety of production tasks, including but not limited to: assembly, training, inspecting, problem solving, machine operator as well as communicating manpower and scheduling issues with supervision. Employees will be responsible for adhering to the policies and procedures outlined in the IATF Quality System and practice continuous improvement wherever possible.

Responsibilities:

  • Assemble customer supplied automotive parts to meet specified quality standards.
  • Record daily production ensuring accuracy and submit to Supervisor.
  • Handle product properly at all times, and assemble according to specifications.
  • Ensure that materials or equipment required be kept in a clean manner before and after shifts and report any maintenance issues to Supervisor.
  • Conduct a final inspection before customer product is packed and/or labeled.
  • Handle product properly at all times and package according to specifications.
  • Ensure that work area is clean and orderly throughout and after the shift.
  • Comply with company work and safety rules at all times and report all accidents, incidents and potential hazards immediately.
  • Participate in corrective/preventative action when required.
  • Practice continuous improvement; identify processes or procedures that will result in production of non-conforming product, or identifying any processes or procedures that can be improved and result in better company performance.
  • Adhere to all procedures and policies as outlined.
  • Perform duties assigned from time to time by supervisor.

Qualifications:

  • Grade 12 or equivalent preferred.
  • Experience in manufacturing environment is preferred.
  • Effective communication skills, verbal, and written
  • Interpret technical drawings and specifications
  • Ability to work rotating shifts, 1 week day shift (6:00am-3:00pm) and 1 week afternoon shift (3:30pm-12:15PM)

Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources athr@tiercon.com.

title: Assembleur en électronique
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Travaillons ensemble pour un futur plus intelligent !

Dimonoff se démarque dans son domaine par la qualité de ses produits, son innovation constante et de son service à la clientèle grâce à une équipe compétente et motivée.    

Dimonoff est un joueur majeur dans le domaine des villes intelligentes et des objets connectés par notre expertise innovante et notre avancement technologique par rapport à nos compétiteurs. Nous offrons également des services d’ingénierie pour des projets dans des secteurs de pointe (aviation, médical, énergie, etc.) pour divers clients.    

Lien vers notre site internet : https://www.dimonoff.com/fr/   

Pourquoi Dimonoff?

  • Pour ses valeurs humaines et l’équipe chevronnée.
  • Pour des possibilités de se développer dans le travail et se découvrir de nouveaux talents
  • Pour avoir des responsabilités réelles et la confiance de ses collègues
  • Pour avoir l’opportunité de dire ses idées et d’innover dans le travail
  • Pour avoir accès à des outils à la fine pointe des technologies
Description du poste

Tu apporteras ton expérience pour effectuer et maintenir tout le processus d’assemblage électronique. Tu auras également la charge d’implanter et d’assurer de mettre à jour les documents d’assemblage. Voici à quoi ressemble le quotidien: 

  • Effectuer de la soudure de composants  
  • Faire de l’assemblage mécanique 
  • Emballer, identifier et tester les produits 
  • Valider la qualité de réception des produits reçus  
  • Effectuer le dépannage de première ligne des produits défectueux 
  • Utiliser de la machinerie 
  • Encapsuler en époxy  
     

Ce que nous offrons :   

  • Horaire flexible  
  • Salaire compétitif sur le marché  
  • Semaines de vacances  
  • Congé payé durant la période des Fêtes 
  • Possibilités de se développer et de grandir dans une entreprise en croissance
     

Avantages: 

  • Assurances collectives 
  • Télémédecine (Dialogue) 
  • Activités sociales  
  • Conciliation travail et vie personnelle   
  • Congés flexibles   
  • Régime enregistré d'épargne-retraite   
  • Transports en commun à proximité et possibilité de venir à vélo.  
  • Stationnement 
Qualifications

Nous recherchons une personne ayant :  

  • Un DES ou un DEP en réparation d’appareils électroniques audiovidéo 
  • 1 à 3 ans d’expérience 
  • Connaissance de la suite office  
  • Un désir d’apprendre et de cheminer dans l’entreprise

Nous offrons également des services d’ingénierie pour des projets dans des secteurs de pointe (aviation, médical, énergie, etc.) pour divers clients.', 'Télémédecine (Dialogue)']

title: Mitarbeiter (m/w/d) Montage
description:
Jobnummer:29491 
Gruppe: Cosma International 
Division: Magna BDW Technologies Soest GmbH 
Art der Beschäftigung: Festanstellung 
Standort: SOEST

 

Gruppenbeschreibung

 

Cosma bietet eine umfangreiche Auswahl an Karosserie-, Fahrwerk- und Engineering-Lösungen für Kunden in aller Welt. Durch unser verlässliches Produkt-Engineering, unsere herausragenden Werkzeugkompetenzen und unser vielfältiges Prozess-Know-how bringen wir stetig leichte und innovative Produkte auf den Markt.

Am Standort Soest fertigen wir mit rund 600 Mitarbeitern Aluminiumteile für die Automobilbranche an. Zur Unterstützung unseres Teams suchen wir für unseren Standort in Soest zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen Mitarbeiter (m/w/d) Montage.

Diese Aufgaben erwarten Sie

  • Selbstständige Bedienung der vollautomatisierten Nietanlagen  
  • Selbständiges Arbeiten an Prüflehren je nach Arbeitsauslastung an den Nietanlagen
  • Durchführung von Qualitätsprüfungen nach Vorgabe
  • Maschinen rüsten, Umbauarbeiten durchführen
  • Lesen und Auswerten von Messberichten
  • Störungssuche & Ausführen von kleineren Reparaturen an den Anlagen
  • Reinigung und Wartung von Anlagen & Arbeitsplätzen nach Vorgabe

Das sollten Sie mitbringen

  • Ausbildung im Metallbereich oder einem technischen Beruf
  • Erfahrung im Bedienen von Produktionsanlagen mit ABB Robotern wünschenswert
  • Erfahrung an Handmontageplätzen sowie handwerkliches Geschicke wünschenswert
  • Teamfähigkeit & hohes Qualitätsverständnis
  • Bereitschaft zur Drei-Schicht und Wochenendarbeit

Das bieten wir Ihnen

  • Kantine und kostenloses Wasser aus Spendern
  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit persönlicher Beratung
  • Urlaubs- und Weihnachtsgeld
  • Umfangreiche Schulungs- und Trainingsmaßnahmen
  • Kollegiales Arbeitsklima
  • Bike-Leasing

Kontakt

Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns über Ihre Onlinebewerbung unter Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellungen über:www.magna.com/company/careers.Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung.
Bitte haben Sie Verständnis dafür, dass wir ausschließlich Bewerbungen berücksichtigen können, die über das Bewerberportal gesendet wurden. Nach einer kurzen Bearbeitungszeit werden Sie unaufgefordert über den Status der Bewerbung informiert.

 

07--Operations F--Permanent/Regular

Durch unser verlässliches Produkt-Engineering, unsere herausragenden Werkzeugkompetenzen und unser vielfältiges Prozess-Know-how bringen wir stetig leichte und innovative Produkte auf den Markt.', 'Ausbildung im Metallbereich oder einem technischen Beruf']

title: Wheel Assembly Technician (NTD) - Full time
description:
.

National Tire Distributors is Canada's leading Tire Distribution Company. A key element of our success has always been our people. As part of our team philosophy, we coach, support and help develop all of our employees to become the best they can be! If you're looking for a career that will challenge you, a job that will offer growth, and a progressive employer, then National Tire Distributors Inc. (NTD) is the right place for you!

The Wheel Assembly Technician is responsible for wheel and tire installation for the Assembly Program using tire machine, balancer, and all other shipping and warehouse related equipment. This includes preparation, storage and staging.

   

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Partnering with Wheel Assembly Program Specialist and site leadership
  • Provide quality installation and balancing of wheel and tire assemblies
  • Responsible for wheel assembly area housekeeping
  • Report damaged product to site leadership and the Wheel Assembly Program Specialist
  • Designate and organize the wheel assembly area
  • Follow all safety training and SOP’s relative to wheel assembly program
  • Complete all required Tire Industry Association (TIA) training and all other organization specified training
  • Meet scheduled delivery timelines
  • Prioritize and pick material to fill orders and stage product for loading
  • Provide quality packaging of wheel assembly product to prevent damage in transit of product to our customers
  • Assist site leadership with ordering/maintaining wheel assembly supplies
  • Assist site leadership with equipment maintenance and preventative maintenance
  • Assist site leadership with program reporting requirements
  • Operate powered industrial vehicles (forklifts, pallet jacks, order pickers, etc.) in safe manner and maintain operator certification
  • Operate all wheel assembly equipment in safe manner
  • Other duties as assigned

Experience that Best Prepares You:

  • Wheel or tire assembly experience considered an asset

Key Competencies:

  • Possess excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Ability to start, control and maintain a complete process or procedure, while keeping safety and compliance at the forefront
  • Ability to carry out oral and written instructions
  • Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing
  • Ability to establish and maintain cooperative relationships with those contacted during the course of work.
  • Maintain order schedule timelines
  • Ability to provide consistent quality product to our customers

We offer:

  • $19/hour
  • Excellent group health benefits, including health, dental, paramedical, vision, etc. with only 30 day waiting period
  • Production bonus
  • RRSP Company Matching
  • Tire Purchase Program for family and friends
  • Workperks - Discounts on over 3000 Vendors
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Paid Vacation
  • Vacation Purchase Program
  • Personal Time Off Days
  • Winning Culture
  • Micro-learning platform
  • and more!


Apply online or in person. Same day, on-site interviews and offers.

We are located at:

14404 – 128 Avenue N.W.
Edmonton, AB T5L 3H6
Canada

   

Build a challenging and rewarding career with us!

title: Technicien de production
description:
Technicien de productionFaites progresser votre carrière chez ABB avec une équipe mondiale qui alimente la transformation de la société et de l'industrie afin de bâtir un avenir plus productif et durable.Chez ABB, nous avons l'objectif précis de favoriser la diversité et l'inclusion dans tous ses aspects : genres, LGBTQ+, facultés, ethnicités, générations, etc. Ensemble, nous entreprenons un parcours où chacun d'entre nous, respecte et célèbre les différences individuelles

Le segment d'affaires Mesure et analyse développe, fabrique, vend, livre et assure la maintenance de produits et de solutions afin de permettre aux clients des secteurs industriels et de l'énergie de renforcer l'efficacité et la rentabilité de leurs opérations. Nous sommes déterminés à servir nos clients en leur offrant les meilleures solutions numériques pour répondre à leurs besoins rapidement et de façon fiable, tout en mettant à leur disposition un réseau de services mondial.Basé à la ville de Québec et relevant du superviseur de production, le technicien de production soutien l'unité d'affaire dans la réalisation des objectifs de production fixés en adhérant aux systèmes et processus. L'unité d'affaire produit des analyseurs de produits chimiques qui visent différents marchés.
Vos responsabilités

  • Effectuer l'assemblage optique, mécanique et électroniques de nos analyseurs.
  • Effectuer le contrôle qualité de ces mêmes analyseurs.
  • Réaliser les tests finaux en s'assurant de rencontrer le standard de qualité.
  • Respecter les processus en place.
  • Résoudre les problématiques rencontrer lors de l'assemblage et des tests.
  • Être en accord avec les valeurs fondamentales de sécurité et d'intégrité d'ABB, c'est-à-dire assumer la responsabilité de vos propres actes, tout en prenant soin de vos collègues et de l'entreprise.

Votre parcours professionnel
  • Diplôme d'étude collégial en physique, électronique ou dans un domaine approprié.
  • Un diplôme d'études secondaire jumelé à de l'expérience pertinente sera aussi considéré.
  • Avoir une grande capacité d'apprentissage et un sens de l'analyse aiguisé.
  • Faire preuve d'un haut niveau d'autonomie, de responsabilité et de polyvalence.
  • Allier haut niveau de qualité et efficacité.

Benefits
  • Plan retraite
  • Mutuelle d'entreprise
  • Programme bien-être
En savoir plus sur nous
Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre candidature. Si vous souhaitez en savoir plus sur ABB, consultez notre site web www.abb.com.Pour la quatrième année consécutive, ABB Canada a été reconnue comme l'un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada par le magazine Forbes et s'est classée au premier rang dans la catégorie de l'industrie. Également nommée parmi les 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada, les meilleurs employeurs de Montréal, les meilleurs employeurs pour les jeunes au Canada et le prix de la meilleure expérience du candidat (CandE Award), la culture et l'engagement d'ABB consistent à offrir un milieu de travail bienveillant où chacun collabore, se sent valorisé, respecté, inclus et soutenu. Nous nous engageons également à veiller à ce que toutes les politiques et pratiques respectent le Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, nous visons à ce que notre main-d'œuvre soit réellement représentative des quatre groupes désignés : les femmes, les autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB fournira des accommodements adéquats aux candidats handicapés et les encouragera à s'identifier dans le processus de candidature.

title: General Labour/Assembler
description:
General Labour/Assembler

Brampton, ON, Canada Req #4253

Wednesday, February 23, 2022

$2,500 sign-on bonus!

$100 bonus for all fully vaccinated new hires!

Morgan Truck Body, the largest truck body manufacturer in North America, has opportunities for General Labourers/Assemblers!

We promote almost 100% of our production leaders from within. Most start their leadership career in this general labourer/assembler role. Your first promotion can occur between your 6th and 12th month of employment.

Our generous benefits include paid vacation and holidays, Medical, Dental, Vision, group pension, and 80% tuition reimbursement as well as many others!

Job Description

The General Labourer/Assembler is responsible for building and assembly of a multitude of pieces as well as completed truck bodies.

You will receive on the job training for:

  • Basic math, tape measurement, and computer skills
  • Working with hand and power tools
  • Reading and interpreting blueprints
Job Duties
  • Read and interpret: orders and specifications, blueprints, instructions and labels which may contain hazardous warnings and cautions
  • Cut wood or metals to specific sizes using a variety of saws, sheers and cutters
  • Fasten parts together with bolts, screws, speed clips, rivets or fasteners
  • Operate pneumatic tools and hand tools
  • Perform set up of machine and preventative maintenance as required
  • Examine finished project for quality and defects
  • Perform safety and quality checks
  • Work and adhere to all safety policies
Minimum Qualifications
  • Must be 18 years old
Preferred Qualifications (not required)
  • Previous experience in manufacturing
  • Previous experience working on truck bodies
  • Construction experience is a plus
  • High School Diploma or equivalent GED
Physical Requirements:

This job operates in a manufacturing plant environment. While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to talk or hear. The team member frequently is required to stand (sometimes for extended periods); walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms, and lift up to 35 pounds. The team member may, at times, sit, bend, stoop, squat, reach overhead, or crawl (may be in confined spaces). The team member is expected to perform repetitive tasks using their hands, and have the ability to climb ladders and/or work in high places.

J.B. Poindexter & Co., Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or municipal laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

#LI-TK1
Other details

  • Job Family Morgan Truck Body
  • Job Function Manufacturing
  • Pay Type Hourly
  • Employment Indicator Hourly

title: SMT (Surface Mount Technician) Day Shift
description:
As a member of the SMT Department, you will be part of the manufacturing group that assembles our products.
 

Responsibilities:

  • Assist in running the SMT line
  • Loading reeled components on feeders 
  • Be trained to run SMT line for vacation relief
  • Maintain clean work environment

Qualifications:

  • Experience with electronic components in an electronic manufacturing environment
  • Strong attention to detail is required
  • Be results oriented, self-motivated, and a team player

What we offer:

  • Employer funded benefits program
  • Competitive total compensation package
  • Work-life balance
  • Employee Assistance plan
  • Employee Discount Platform
  • Career progression
  • Casual work environment
  • Social events and sports teams

About Evertz:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery.

Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertz’ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers.

With over 1700 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz!

title: Operations Technician - Associate
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 

The On-Site Technology Support group in Edmonton, AB is looking for an experienced individual to fulfil a 12 month temporary position. The On-site Technology Support (OSTS) Technician provides high-level technical support in accordance with EY Firm policy. The candidate should have a background performing in-person support in a professional environment and possess very strong customer interfacing skills. 
 

Responsibilities (include but not limited to):

 

  • Technology support for +/- 150 customers.
  • Laptop troubleshooting, maintenance, and administration.
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of Win10, Office 365
  • Instant Messaging tools, TEAMs
  • Excellent customer service skills, meeting with users in person to resolve complex technology issues.
  • Ability to perform root cause analysis to quickly recover from service interruptions and to prevent recurring problems.
  • Anticipate and respond to complex technology support issues.
  • Perform software and Firmware upgrades and testing as needed or part of an initiative or project.
  • Provide technical guidance and consult with EY customer stakeholders.
  • Knowledge and understanding of HP print devices.
  • Document and track the status of inquiries, coordinate appropriate responses, and follow-up to ensure customer satisfaction using Service Now.
  • Analyze the impact of decisions, and guide others through the solution process in order to satisfy customer, OSTS and Firm needs and objectives.
  • Provide meaningful contributions to team efforts to enhance overall departmental effectiveness.
  • Leverage multiple resources or coordinating with other teams to meet customer needs.
  • Facilitate the implementation and support of defined EY Technology solutions.
  • Communicate system updates to customers as required.
  • Participate in postmortem analysis of significant projects or events, sharing best practice techniques and solutions.
  • Share solutions throughout Global IT using appropriate channels. Familiar with Yammer, SharePoint and other collaboration tools.

 

To qualify, candidates must have:

 

  • Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline; or equivalent work experience in IT Support
  • Approximately 1-3 plus years of experience in support of IT products 
  • Technical expertise in various facets of PC support, which may include PC applications, hardware, tools, utilities, networking, telecommunications 
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication and organizational skills 
  • Ability to simultaneously work on multiple projects or assignments in a fast-paced and highly challenging environment 
  • Able to work effectively with high level customers and other management personnel
  • Excellent Customer Service skills.

 

What we offer

 

As part of this role, you'll work in a highly integrated, global team with the opportunity and tools to grow, develop and drive your career forward. Here, you can combine global opportunity with flexible working. The EY benefits package goes above and beyond too, focusing on your physical, emotional, financial and social well-being. Your recruiter can talk to you about the benefits available in your country. Here’s a snapshot of what we offer: 

 

  • Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
  • Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
  • Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
  • Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

 

Please apply to this role only through the ‘Apply’ link (not through the local office). Your application will then be routed to the appropriate recruiting team.    

 

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build. 

 

 

EY | Building a better working world 

 

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

 

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Temporary Production Technician I
description:
Location : Fort Saskatchewan AB 

City : Fort Saskatchewan 

State : Alberta (CA-AB) 

Country : Canada (CA) 

Requisition Number : 19924 

Position Summary 

Reporting to the Production Supervisors, this position is responsible for safely operating and maintaining process and equipment to ensure quality is met in the most efficient manner possible. The Production Technician must consistently perform all operator job functions in accordance with Bunge PQSE policies and procedures including quality, safety, and environmental standards.

 

 

Core Functions:

The following duties and responsibilities are not to be considered inclusive of all requirements of the position.  Other duties and responsibilities may be required or will be assigned as deemed appropriated by management.

 

  • Maintain knowledge of all departmental safety standards, policies and procedures.  Additionally, the position requires that operators promote, encourage and enforce the safety compliance by all Bunge personnel and contractor personnel working in the department
  • Maintain knowledge of Bunge PQSE policies and procedures and comply with them on a consistent basis ensuring that all safety and housekeeping programs are being carried out in an acceptable manner
  • Continuously monitor all department processes through frequent visual inspections and the HMI (computer) screens.  All equipment and processes are to be operated safely and efficiently.
  • Make appropriate process adjustments to ensure target product quality goals and standards are achieved in conjunction with co-workers and supervisors
  • Make operational decisions that minimize operating the plant at reduced rate and that reduce the potential for unscheduled operational down time in conjunction with co-workers and supervisors
  • Communicate to the Production Supervisors any problems that could have a detrimental effect on safety, production, product quality, and equipment life
  • Ensure that all required samples are collected and properly labeled
  • Support or initiate tasks/activities in stopping and starting the plant process and equipment whether the shutdown is planned or unplanned.  Minimize the time requirements, the loss of product and potential equipment damage that could occur during start-ups or shutdowns.  During plant shutdowns the production technician will insure that all processes and equipment are in a safe and secure mode at all times
  • Support the activities of personnel during shutdowns to ensure that:
    • Equipment is properly isolated, locked & tagged, and safe to work on
    • Personnel are following proper safety procedures, wearing proper PPE and using the proper tools for the job assigned
    • Personnel are utilized in an effective manner that will minimize plant down-time, including; but not limited to:
    • Various routine equipment pm’s that can be managed by operating personnel
    • Preparing work sites for maintenance
    • Assisting maintenance with repairs
    • Housekeeping as needed
  • Possess a thorough knowledge of all equipment and processes used for the production of canola oil and meal.  This includes all prep, extraction, and steam plant equipment and systems
  • Display the ability to control the above mentioned equipment and processes in a manner that is safe and efficient
  • Cooperate with the activities of shift crew members, maintenance personnel and contractors to ensure that all work in the department are being performed in a safe, effective and efficient manner.
  • Maintain accurate logs and notes – ensure the accuracy of all department logs, notes and production reports.
  • Demonstrate self-motivation and initiative for monitoring and controlling all the activities within the department while making operational decisions with minimal supervision.

 

Restrictions: all employees must be trained and observed to ensure they are capable of performing duties of this role in a safe and efficient manner. The Production Technician is qualified to operate in all areas of the plant with the exception of the Control Room / Boiler Room. This includes:

  • Operate in the prep plant
  • Operate in the extraction plant
  • Complete the required QC testing on daily basis for each area of responsibility
  • Production Technician positions will rotate through the Prep Plant and Extraction Plant to become familiar with the operating processes and equipment

 

Skill/Experience Requirements:

  • This position requires the incumbent to possess a current and valid driver’s license in the province of Alberta (Class 5 or equivalent)
  • Grade 12 Education required
  • 4th Class Power Engineering Certification or higher is required
  • Ability to work days and nights.Shift schedules may change on a frequent basis as required by the business

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

 

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status.  Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

title: Opérateur de production (CNP 9614) (15643)
description:
Produits forestiers Résolu est une entreprise axée sur la gérance environnementale et le succès financier qui offre des emplois valorisants et prometteurs, donnant ainsi aux gens motivés toutes les chances de faire progresser leur carrière. Si vous êtes une personne enthousiaste et prête à agir utilement, Résolu est le gage de votre réussite professionnelle.

Notre établissement de Maniwaki (Québec, Canada) est actuellement à la recherche de candidats compétents en vue de pourvoir le poste de Opérateur de production (CNP 9614). Il s’agit d’un poste permanent à temps plein.

 

Principales fonctions:

Relevant du superviseur de production, vos principales responsabilités seront :

  • Opérer et suveiller divers équipements de production dans nos départements;
  • Nettoyer certains secteurs de l'usine et maintenir votre environnement propre et sécuritaire;
  • Assurer la qualité des produits selon nos standards et les exigences des clients;
  • Appliquer les procédures requises en santé et sécurité, en environnement et selon la norme ISO.

 

Exigences et conditions de travail :

  • Être reconnu comme une personne sécuritaire ne faisant aucun compromis pour la sécurité;
  • Posséder une bonne débrouillardise, être respectueux des règlements et procédures; 
  • Posséder un diplôme d’études secondaires ou l’équivalent. Une personne possédant un TDG ou un secondaire 3 terminé ET 3 ans d'expérience sur le marché du travail sera considérée;
  • Salaire compétitif (À partir de 22.38 $/heure); 
  • Gamme complète d’avantages sociaux.
  • Langue: Français et/ou anglais

 

Nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les candidats retenus. Produits forestiers Résolu souscrit aux principes d'équité en matière d'emploi.

L’usage du masculin dans ce document a pour unique but d’alléger le texte.

 

Les produits forestiers sont essentiels, tout comme chacun de nos employés et de nos entrepreneurs. Nous prenons les mesures nécessaires pour protéger la santé et le bien-être de nos employés et préserver l’intégrité de toutes les installations de Résolu.

 

Nous sommes tous solidaires dans cette crise. Nous formons une grande communauté. Nous sommes #FIÈREMENTRÉSOLU

 


Des emplois pour grandir
Chef de file mondial de l’industrie des produits forestiers, Résolu vous propose un milieu de travail dynamique et sécuritaire, riche en occasions et en défis qui vous permettront de développer vos compétences. Notre main-d’œuvre diversifiée compte plus de 8000 employés.

Nous commercialisons un large éventail de produits de pâte, de papier, de papier tissu et de produits du bois dans plus de 70 pays, et possédons ou exploitons quelque 40 installations ainsi que des actifs de production d'électricité au Canada et aux États-Unis.

Notre entreprise est en train d’écrire une nouvelle page de son histoire dans un secteur en évolution rapide. Nous avons réalisé d’importants progrès pour assurer notre rentabilité à long terme et pour devenir un fournisseur de choix, respectueux de l’environnement. Pour demeurer chef de file de notre secteur, nous sommes à la recherche de personnes motivées et désireuses d’apprendre. Venez participer à notre histoire et faire partie du changement!

Pour savoir comment nous bâtissons le Résolu de demain, consultez notre rapport annuel sur pfresolu.com/publications.

Joignez-vous à la conversation!
Lisez Le blogue Résolu à blogue.pfresolu.com et suivez-nous sur LinkedIn, Twitter et YouTube.

15643​ 
 
Général

title: Manufacturing Positions
description:
Recognized as one of Canada's 50 Best Managed Companies, Brandt provides top quality products to its customers worldwide. As a result of continued growth and expansion we are currently seeking Assemblers, Welders, Fitters, Machinists, Machine Operators, Powder Painters, Production Planners, Material Handlers, Kitting Technicians, Labourers, Lead Hands and many more for our manufacturing facilities located in Regina and Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

Take your place in a strong stable company that offers long term employment and a comprehensive benefit program. At Brandt, you'll get the challenges that you've been looking for and your hard work will be rewarded. Join our team of experts and see for yourself on how far you can go. Please visit the career page on brandtjobs.com for a full list of job opportunities.

title: Production Assembler
description:
Job Description:

The Production Assembler is responsible for performing operations in the final meter assembly work cells. This includes assembling, testing, and boxing various products while following work instructions. New Hires will undergo training followed by certification while learning Lean Manufacturing concepts.   Assemblers must be able to work in an energetic environment and have passion in achieving daily productivity targets while respecting our Safety, Quality, Environmental and Covid-19 policies.

 

What will you do?

  • Prepare, process, clean, install, assemble, rework, verify, test, solder, and/or inspect electrical and mechanical components, hardware, sub assemblies, and assemblies on single or multiple product lines
  • Operate shop equipment and tools where applicable
  • Adhere to environmental and safety procedures associated with production processes and procedures
  • Use work instructions, drawings, methods, diagrams, workmanship standards or other specifications in accordance with established assembly procedures
  • Monitor and record related documentation to meet quality requirements
  • Follow production build rates, schedules and meet time standards

 

What qualifications will make you successful?  

  • A high school diploma
  • Good written, verbal, reading and math skills
  • Strong manual dexterity and hand/eye coordination
  • Basic computer skills
  • Ability to use manual tools and light power tools
  • Ability to work and contribute in a team environment
  • Familiarity with 5S and Lean Manufacturing concepts
  • Ability to Stand for extended periods of time
  • Flexibility to perform other duties based upon business needs
  • Previous Manufacturing or Electronics knowledge is an asset
  • Must be flexible working either morning shift or afternoon shift (Afternoon shift is eligible for shift premium)

 

Benefits Highlights    

  • Competitive wages
  • Annual bonus based on company performance
  • Annual discounted stock purchase offer
  • Company matched retirement savings program
  • Extended health and dental benefits. Basic and optional life insurance. Disability insurance
  • Paid Time Off: 19-29 days based on length of service. 12 paid stat holidays annually
  • Paid Time Off purchase program
  • Paid Family leave (12 weeks for primary parent, 2 weeks for secondary parent)
  • Employee and Family assistance program
  • Well-being program (training and coaching for healthy habits, and rewards for achievements)
  • Internal mobility
(External) English Qualifications:

 

Let us learn about you! Apply today.

 

(External) English Company Boiler Plate:

Why us?

Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

 

â‚¬25.7bn global revenue

137 000+ employees in 100+ countries

45% of revenue from IoT

5% of revenue devoted for R&D

 

 

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

 

It is the policy of Schneider Electric  to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.
