title: Assembleur-soudeur, cartes de circuits électroniques SMT/TH
description:
Assembleur-soudeur, cartes de circuits électroniques SMT/THFaites progresser votre carrière chez ABB avec une équipe mondiale qui alimente la transformation de la société et de l'industrie afin de bâtir un avenir plus productif et durable.Chez ABB, nous avons l'objectif précis de favoriser la diversité et l'inclusion dans tous ses aspects : genres, LGBTQ+, facultés, ethnicités, générations, etc. Ensemble, nous entreprenons un parcours où chacun d'entre nous, respecte et célèbre les différences individuelles

Le segment d'affaires Bâtiments intelligents transforme les bâtiments commerciaux, industriels et résidentiels de manière numérique afin d'en optimiser le confort, l'efficacité, la sûreté et la sécurité, et ainsi améliorer la qualité de vie dans les bâtiments de l'avenir grâce à des solutions, des services et des produits d'électrification sûrs, intelligents et durables.En travaillant chez ABB, vous aurez accès à un programme complet d'avantages sociaux, à un régime d'épargne-retraite collectif, ainsi qu'à des possibilités d'avancement au sein de l'entreprise.
Vos responsabilités

  • Effectuer des retouches et application de soudure selon les normes en vigueur.
  • Détecter toutes non-conformités aux niveaux de la soudure et des placements des pièces ainsi que l'orientation et la polarité des composants.
  • Interpréter un dessin d'assemblage
  • Utiliser des outils, des équipements et des accessoires et voir à leur entretien.
  • Travailler des procédures et des techniques d'inspection.

Votre parcours professionnel
  • 2 à 4 ans d'expérience en soudure de cartes électroniques.
  • Diplôme d'études secondaire.
  • Études professionnelles en électronique, un atout.
  • Connaissance des critères d'acceptabilité des normes IPC-A-610 et capacité de rechercher les informations pertinentes dans le livre.
  • Connaissance de base en décharge électrostatique (ESD).
  • Capacité à lire et interpréter un dessin technique et la capacité à lire la sérigraphie sur un circuits-imprimés.
  • Capacité à sélectionner les outils et matériaux nécessaires et adéquats en fonction du type de travaux.
  • Maîtriser le français et/ou l'anglais, parlé et écrit.

Benefits
  • Plan retraite
  • Mutuelle d'entreprise
  • Programme bien-être
En savoir plus sur nous
Figurant sur la liste des 15 meilleurs employeurs au Canada de Forbes 2020, ABB valorise à sa juste valeur le dévouement, l'engagement et l'expertise de ses employés. À titre d'employeur soucieux de l'équité en matière d'emploi, ABB croit en un effectif inclusif et diversifié. Notre engagement est de veiller à ce que l'ensemble des politiques et des pratiques respectent l'esprit du Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, et nous visons à ce que notre effectif soit véritablement représentatif des quatre groupes désignés, notamment les femmes, les Autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB offrira des aménagements raisonnables aux candidats présentant un handicap, et les encourage à s'identifier comme tels lors du processus de candidature.Au sens de la présente offre, le masculin est utilisé comme genre neutre dans le seul but d'alléger le texte.
skills: ["Détecter toutes non-conformités aux niveaux de la soudure et des placements des pièces ainsi que l'orientation et la polarité des composants."]

title: Assembly Operator - Evening Shift
description:
Based in Alexandria, Ontario, KP Building Products - Windows Division is a high-quality window and patio door manufacturer that has been a member of the Kaycan family since 2014. We foster a strong and lasting employment relationship, enhanced by the strength of the group to which we belong.

We are currently seeking Assembly Operators to complete our day shift and evening shift teams.

Shift : Evening - Monday to Friday - 3pm to 11pm

We offer :

  • Salary : 15$/hr
  • Evening shift premium : 0.45$/hr
  • Flexible group insurance program
  • Pension plan
  • Work boot allowance
  • Opportunity for growth and development

Duties:

  • Handle power tools and small hand tool
  • Operate machines and equipment
  • Assemble material and parts
  • Inspect manufactured products for defects and conformance to specifications
  • Reroute defective products

Requirements :

  • High school diploma
  • No experience required - Full training will be provided
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to work standing for extended periods
  • Languages: French or English

While we appreciate all expressed interest in joining our team, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

We foster a strong and lasting employment relationship, enhanced by the strength of the group to which we belong.']

title: Electronics Assembler (afternoon shift)
description:
Electronics Assembler
(Afternoon shift)

Founded in 1991, the Mircom Group of Companies is North America’s largest independent designer, manufacturer and distributor of intelligent building and life safety solutions. Reaching customers in over 100 countries worldwide, our portfolio includes: fire detection & alarm, communications & security, mass notification, nurse call, and building automation & smart technologies.

Mircom’s mission is to save lives and protect property by providing a line-up of innovative and advanced solutions which are scalable to satisfy diverse user demands, from small buildings to the largest complexes. Our unwavering commitment to North American manufacturing enables us to offer the highest quality and best competitive value across our vast range of products and solutions.

Summary:

Under the supervision of the Manager, the successful candidate is responsible for performing any combination of following tasks to assemble electronic components, subassemblies, products, or systems: Reads work orders, follows production drawings and sample assemblies, or receives verbal instructions regarding duties to be performed.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Perform loading of PCB’s in trolley, packing of panels and enclosures, stocking on skids/trolleys and delivering to Raw Material or Finish Goods stock
  • Assemble PCB boards with components as per set-up sheets
  • Inspect PCB’s after assembly
  • Positions and aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jig, fixture, or other holding device
  • Crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits, or perform similar operations to join or secure parts in place, using hand tools, power tools, machines, and equipment
  • Mounts assembled components, such as transformers, resistors, transistors, capacitors, integrated circuits, and sockets, on printed circuit boards or chassis panel
  • Connects component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points, using soldering, welding, marettes, or related bonding procedures and equipment
  • Installs finished assemblies or subassemblies in cases and cabinets
  • Assembles and attaches hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, locks, screws, wires and switches, to assemblies
  • Performs intermediate assembly tasks, such as conformal coating, silk screening, masking, cutting traces, labeling assemblies
  • Tends machines that press, shape, or engrave component parts
  • Adjusts or trims materials from components to achieve specified electrical or dimensional characteristics
  • Performs on-line go-not-go testing and inspection, using magnifying devices and Automatic Optical Inspection(AOI), measuring instruments, and electronic test equipment, to ensure parts and assemblies meet production specifications and standards
  • May perform assembly, soldering or inspections under microscope or other magnifying device
  • Keep immediate work area in clean and orderly condition
  • Advise Supervisor or Lead Hand of any abnormal conditions
  • Offer suggestions for continual improvement

Requirements and Skills

  • Completion of a High School Diploma or Vocational Equivalent
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in a Manufacturing environment is preferred
  • Knowledge of electronic components and assembly of systems is an asset
  • Must be able to read, understand and follow instructions/drawing.
  • Electronic devices assemblers that solder might require accreditation or certification
  • Familiar with ISO and IPC standards an asset
  • Ability to work cohesively with employees and managers as part of a team
  • Good interpersonal and communication (verbal & written English) skills
  • Ability to focus attention on details and a high level of accuracy skills
  • Ability to lift 25-50 Ibs
  • Ability to work efficiently and effectively under pressure with simultaneous deadlines
  • Ability to maintain confidential information in a professional manner
  • Ability/willingness to learn on the job new skills trough training

    What Mircom Offers:

    • A great working environment with opportunity for career advancement
    • Competitive salary

title: Assembler
description:
Assembler

Founded in 1991, the Mircom Group of Companies is North America’s largest independent designer, manufacturer and distributor of intelligent building and life safety solutions. Reaching customers in over 100 countries worldwide, our portfolio includes: fire detection & alarm, communications & security, mass notification, nurse call, and building automation & smart technologies.

Mircom’s mission is to save lives and protect property by providing a line-up of innovative and advanced solutions which are scalable to satisfy diverse user demands, from small buildings to the largest complexes. Our unwavering commitment to North American manufacturing enables us to offer the highest quality and best competitive value across our vast range of products and solutions.

Summary:

This position is responsible for performing any combination of following tasks to assemble electronic components, subassemblies, products, or systems: Reads work orders, follows production drawings and sample assemblies, or receives verbal instructions regarding duties to be performed.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Reads work orders, follows production drawings and sample assemblies, or receives verbal instructions regarding duties to be performed
  • Positions and aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jig, fixture, or other holding device
  • Crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits, or perform similar operations to join or secure parts in place, using hand tools, power tools, machines, and equipment
  • Mounts assembled components, such as transformers, resistors, transistors, capacitors, integrated circuits, and sockets, on printed circuit boards or chassis panel.
  • Connects component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points, using soldering, welding, marettes, or related bonding procedures and equipment.
  • Installs finished assemblies or subassemblies in cases and cabinets.
  • Assembles and attaches hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, locks, screws, wires and switches, to assemblies.
  • Performs intermediate assembly tasks, such as conformal coating, silk screening, masking, cutting traces, labeling assemblies.
  • Tends machines that press, shape, or engrave component parts
  • Adjusts or trims materials from components to achieve specified electrical or dimensional characteristics.
  • Performs on-line go-not-go testing and  inspection, using magnifying devices and Automatic Optical Inspection(AOI), measuring instruments, and electronic test equipment, to ensure parts and assemblies meet production specifications and standards.
  • May perform assembly, soldering or inspections under microscope or other magnifying device.
  • Perform loading of PCB’s in trolley, packing of panels and enclosures, stocking on skids/troleys and delivering to Raw Material or Finish Goods stock.

Requirements and Skills: 

  • Must be detail oriented, precise and fast learner
  • Must be able to read, understand and follow instructions/drawing.

Education:

  1. Completion of a High School Diploma or Vocational Equivalent
  2. Electronic devices assemblers that solder might require accreditation or certification

Knowledge:

  1. Three years’ experience of electronic assembly an asset
  2. Knowledge of electronic components and electronic assembly an asset
  3. Familiar with touch screen data entering and scanning.
  4. Familiar with ISO and IPC standards an asset

Skills & Abilities:

  1. Ability to work cohesively with employees and managers as part of a team
  2. Good interpersonal and communication (verbal & written English) skills
  3. Ability to focus attention on details and a high level of accuracy skills
  4. Reliable
  5. Ability to work efficiently and effectively under pressure with simultaneous deadlines
  6. Ability to maintain confidential information in a professional manner
  7. Ability/willingness to learn on the job new skills through training

Physical Effort:

Lifting

  • 50lbs plus – occasional (up to 30%), where over 50lbs lifting must be done by two people.
  • 20 to 50lbs – frequently (10% to 100%)
  • 1 to 20lbs – most frequently (50% to 100%)

Walking

  • 100% of the job requires walking.

Standing

  • Up to 100%

Bending/Crouching

  • Up to 50%

Reaching

  • Above shoulder height – up to 50%
  • At shoulder height – up to 100%
  • Below shoulder height – up to 100%

Climbing

  • 20% - there is a second floor mezzanine that requires stair climbing to reach.  Ladders/rolling stairs are also located around the plant and are used to reach overstock locations.

Sitting

  • Up to 80%

Working Conditions:

  • Exposed to heat and cold in the warehouse
  • Exposed to fumes and other odors from operations

What Mircom Offers:

  • A great working environment with opportunity for career advancement
  • Competitive salary
  • Group Insurance benefits
  • Company RRSP program

Interested applicants please forward a copy of your cover letter and resume to Human Resources.


We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved in advance by Mircom to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. We will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

title: Production Specialist Electronics Assembly Line
description: The client is seeking an Electronics skilled Technician to augment our production capabilities.  This individual will be required to use network and spectrum analyzers,  perform electronic component assembly, have soldering skills and complete some hands-on mechanical assembly.  This ideal person will be PC literate and willing to work in a start-up environment that is trying to mature rapidly.  While this is an entry level position, it has the potential for the right individual to progress in the company.  We are willing to discuss both full time and contract arrangements.

title: Operator/Sub-Assembler
description:
Are you able to work in a fast-paced environment? Would you like to learn how to operate a variety of machines and be cross-trained in different tasks? Do you want to have a career in Manufacturing? Do you have attention to detail, multitasking and the ability to be cross-trained and work with a variety of jobs?

If your response is yes, please keep reading!

About Metalumen

Metalumen is a family-owned company located in Guelph that has been designing, engineering, and manufacturing lighting solutions since 1977. Our products are customized and up to 97% system recyclable. We are committed to a culture based on communication, collaboration, product excellence, on-time delivery, and customer and agent satisfaction.

By applying for this position, you may have the chance to work as part of our family. We are constantly improving our processes to provide the best for our employees. We understand that our customers’ satisfaction is the reflection of our employees’ happiness.

About the Position

The Operator/Assembler will report to the Team Lead and is responsible for operating machines- and assembling parts, according to production needs.

Main Duties

  • Setup and operate Weld stud /spot welder machine
  • Read, understand and interpret drawings and blueprints and work according to the prints
  • Follow all routing on job travellers
  • Set up and operate robots, machines, jig
  • Participate in first offs, supporting the Lead Hand and Team Lead to properly establish processes and ensuring time studying is done.
  • Measure and suggest new processes to Sub-Assembly and Painting Department
  • Fasten parts according to the Bill of Material and drawings. Follow the Team Lead’s orientations
  • Load and Unload and operate paint line
  • Maintain the workplace clean and organized
  • Ensure the projects are being delivered on time and with the expected quality
  • Other duties as per Team Lead and Production Manager requirements

Requirements

  • 1 year of experience in a manufacturing environment
  • Secondary school
  • Setup and operate Weld stud /spot welder machine
  • Understand Diagrams and the use of different hand and measure tools
  • Ability to lift up to 30 pounds
  • Willing to train other employees
  • Willing to work in a team
  • Sense of urgency and ability to work with limited supervision
  • Attention to detail, excellent attendance, multitask, organization, ability to deal with conflict, and math skills

Benefits

  • Health and Dental after probationary period – 3 months
  • Pension Plan after one year of employment

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code, Metalumen is committed to providing inclusive and barrier-free recruitment and selection process. Please notify Human Resources of any accommodations you may require.

title: Production Technician
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

La version française de cette offre d'emploi est disponible:  Version française - cliquez ici

 

 

Overview

 

To be a key player within the Cement Production Team. Ensure that the equipment is functioning properly, that it is supplied with raw materials and that the quality of the final product meets standards.

Responsibilities

 

  • Conduct inspection rounds to ensure that the equipment is working properly
  • Conduct the chemical analysis of various products
  • Operate equipment, machinery and accessories through process control systems
  • Learn the clinker burning process in rotary kilns

 

Safety:

  • Serve as a role model in the areas of safety, environmental stewardship, leadership, teamwork, and continuous improvement to ensure alignment with the company’s vision and critical success factors. 
  • Ensure safe and efficient operations in the production department

Qualifications

 

Education (mandatory):

  • College Degree - Analytical Chemistry, Chemistry, Mechanical Technology, etc. 

Experience and Skills:

  • Experience in the control room of a production facility
  • Good troubleshooting skills when mechanical issues arise
  • Good communication skills
  • Skills in building team spirit
  • Experience in the heavy industry
  • Efficient follow-ups
  • Operational experience in the cement industry (an asset)

Dimensions:Plant Annual Capacity: 1M tons of cement

LafargeHolcim

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs. 

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

process.

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Production Technician
description:
Job Description

Our client in EAR FALLS, Ontario is seeking Production Technicians to work in their sawmill. You'll be aroundwood,woodand morewood. Your eagle eyes will help keep theyardandsawmilllooking their best. To keep things running smoothly, you’ll make sure that there’s a place for everything and that everything is in its place. You'll make a living working atsawmillswith deep roots in thenorthernregions ofOntarioandQuebec. You'll discover that they do more than just transformwood; they also transform our communities!

Are you hard-working, resourceful and a go-getter? Our team is waiting for you!

What you’ll be doing specifically:

  • Tie up bundles of rough lumber for drying outside.
  • Redo and stack bundles of rough and planed wood in the yard.
  • Perform clean-ups of the yard and sawmill.
  • Perform clean-ups after interior and exterior sawing operations.
  • During work downtime, clean areas that are inaccessible during operations.
  • Do any other related tasks (don’t worry; you'll learn tons of things that will help you in your career!).

What do you need to succeed with us?

  • Be able to work well on a team.
  • Be independent and full of initiative.
  • Show vigilance and a concern for health and safety.

Qualifications

Experience that will help you in this position:

  • DCS, DEC, or equivalent.
  • Prior experience at a sawmill is an asset.
  • Be available to work day and/or night shifts.

title: Production Specialist
description:
Bimbo Canada is Canada’s largest bakery, operating for more than 100 years. It is a leading producer and distributor of fresh packaged breads and snacks with more than 1,000 products across 18 brands Canadians know and love, like Dempster’s®, Stonemill®, Villaggio®, Vachon® cakes and Takis®. Bimbo Canada is proud to feed Canadian families with safe, high-quality products they can trust made by Canadians, for Canadians at 16 bakeries, 14 distribution centres and 191 depots across the country. Bimbo Canada is a wholly owned subsidiary of Grupo Bimbo, the world’s largest baking company. Together, they are nourishing a better world with delicious baked goods and snacks by building a sustainable, highly-productive and deeply-humane company. We are dedicated to building a diverse workplace that promotes equity and belonging, where all associates can develop and contribute to the transformation of our company, the baking industry and our communities. For more, visitwww.bimbocanada.com.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Lead weekly inventory counts of raw and packaging material for two facilities.
  • Procurement of indirect supplies for two facilities.
  • Provide vacation support for material supply coordinator.
  • Provide support and coverage for the production analyst.
  • Assisting with weekly payroll admin – Ex: approving OT in Kronos system for two facilities.
  • Support onboarding and associate training on production floor. Be a liaison for new associates within their first few weeks of hire.
  • Support labour and production scheduling – may include calling associates in for OT, responding to associates regarding schedule changes.
  • Assisting Production Supervisors with support administrative tasks and other tasks.
  • Other duties as assigned.


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE
  • The successful candidate will possess a relevant post-secondary education
  • Ability to communicate and work with all stakeholders and resources in a frequently changing and challenging production environment.
  • Strong analytical skills with a particular focus on attention to detail
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
  • Ability to work effectively with limited supervision in a fast-paced team environment.
  • Previous experience in a manufacturing environment is a definite asset
  • Takes initiative, exercises good judgment in day-to-day business decisions.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft applications
  • Some supervisory experience, in an industrial/manufacturing environment
  • Post -secondary education ( college or university) required
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize workloads to meet all deadlines

Bimbo Canada is Canada’s largest bakery, operating for more than 100 years. It is a leading producer and distributor of fresh packaged breads and snacks with more than 1,000 products across 18 brands Canadians know and love, like Dempster’s®, Stonemill®, Villaggio®, Vachon® cakes and Takis®. Bimbo Canada is proud to feed Canadian families with safe, high-quality products they can trust made by Canadians, for Canadians at 16 bakeries, 14 distribution centres and 191 depots across the country. Bimbo Canada is a wholly owned subsidiary of Grupo Bimbo, the world’s largest baking company. Together, they are nourishing a better world with delicious baked goods and snacks by building a sustainable, highly-productive and deeply-humane company. We are dedicated to building a diverse workplace that promotes equity and belonging, where all associates can develop and contribute to the transformation of our company, the baking industry and our communities. For more, visitwww.bimbocanada.com.

Please note that all applicants that will be considered for this role must be double vaccinated for COVID-19. Successful candidates will also be required to provide proof of their vaccination status during the recruitment process.

title: Assembly line worker
description:
Les Laboratoires Vaporus sont présentement à la recherche d’employé(e)s pour leur établissement situé à Ville Saint-Laurent.

Dans un environnement de travail sécuritaire, l’employé(e) effectuera de l’assemblage manuel et de l’emballage léger avec l’équipe de production déjà en place dans notre laboratoire ISO 7. Nous offrons des heures de travail stables, un horaire régulier et de l’autonomie à tous nos employé(e)s.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Vaporus Laboratories are currently looking to hire employees for their Ville Saint-Laurent location.

In a safe work environment, the employee will do light assembly and packaging work with an already existing production team in our ISO 7 laboratory. We offer stable work hours, a steady schedule and autonomy to all our employees.

title: Manufacturing Assembler
description:
Spirit Edmonton is looking for multiple Temporary Assembly Technicians. This position will assist in the manufacturing of Cathodic Protection Rectifiers and related products.

Responsibilities

  • Assembly of electrical wiring of all rectifier units used for cathodic protection systems and related products

  • Assembly of components on the electrical panels

  • Assembly of all Junction Box Panels

  • Operate fork lift
  • Organization and cleanliness of the shop floor to ensure that a safe working environment is maintained

  • Manufacturing and assembly of various Corrosion Protection products

  • Efficiently packaging and palletizing magnesium and zinc anodes. Mixing backfill for anodes in proper proportions. 

  • Efficiently packaging and palletizing calcined coke breeze to the desired level

  • Timely assembly of shrink sleeves and related products

  • General warehouse duties including maintaining the condition of the warehouse

  • Picking, shipping & receiving duties as required

  • Proactively follow all Health and Safety rules and legislation while performing job functions

  • Perform general maintenance, repairs and inspections of specific tools and equipment to ensure efficient and safe operation

  • Load & unload trucks

Qualifications

  • High school Diploma or equivalent education

  • 1 yearsâ€™ experience in a manufacturing or warehouse environment

  • Experience operating hand and power tools such as drills, saws and specialized equipment

  • Fork Lift Operator certificate and experience an asset

  • Able to wear a respirator as required

  • Able to lift over 50 lb.

  • Mechanically inclined

Additional Requirements:

  • Able to listen, learn and complete duties efficiently and effectively
  • Able to read, write and communicate effectively in English
  • Able to interact and work effectively as a team
  • Possess a high level of attention to detail
  • Able to regularly stand, bend, lift and move intermittently during shifts

title: Production Technician/Assembler - Medical Simulators
description:
As a division of Smile Train, Simulare is dedicated to enhancing surgical skills of surgeons through the development of simulators and training programs which will result in significantly superior patient safety and outcomes. 
 

We develop creative, cutting-edge simulation solutions which enable surgeons around the globe to practice complex surgical procedures on cleft patients. Our goal is to build a team of highly motivated, self-starters who are interested in making a difference in the lives of others.

 

Our Production Technicians are responsible for creating Simulare’s advanced physical simulators. For a candidate with the motivation and artistic skills, the role will allow us to refine our production techniques and develop new products to drive our growth.

 

We are looking for a Production Technician/Assembler to join our team.

 

This is a permanent position conveniently located at 174 Spadina Ave, Toronto, Ontario and will be primariy on site work.  Please note that suitable candidates will be invited to participate in an hour long in-person interview / production scenario-based testing.

 

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Assembly and production of products to meet quality and delivery objectives
  • Participate in the development of complex physical simulators
  • Contribute to other duties as requested and participate in creating a rewarding work environment
 

Requirements

  • Ability to follow instructions in a manual while assembling detailed components
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to accept feedback is a must
  • Past experience in jewelry making or watch repair is an asset
  • Past experience in small model building, sculpture, miniatures or fly tying is an asset
  • Past experience in hand soldering would be an asset
  • Good dexterity and eyesight to work with small tools and components
  • Reasonable Microsoft Office skills

 

Core Competencies

  • Quality Orientation
  • Effective time management capabilities
  • Organized with excellent self-managing skills
  • Artistically inclined
  • Able to work independently while working well within a team.
  • Accountable and dependable
  • Minimum high school diploma

 

We will only be able to respond to suitable candidates. Thanks for applying!

title: Electrical Assembler
description:
Essential Functions

  • Efficiently utilize all wiring equipment/tools
  • Trouble shoot electrical problems on machines
  • Electrical/electronic wiring pertaining to the Belcor product line
  • Know the wiring procedures pertaining to the Belcor product line
  • Working knowledge of programmable logic controllers
  • Initiate engineering changes

Additional Responsibilities

  • Other temporary duties which fall within the employee’s capabilities

Principal Accountabilities

  • Plant Safety
  • Quality and Quantity of work
  • Communication both written or verbal
  • Attendance
  • Attitude in working well with co-workers

Required Qualifications

  • Secondary High School diploma
  • 5 years experience as an Electrical Assembler
  • Electrical/electronics course pertaining to PLC’s or panel building.
  • Advanced knowledge/ability to read and interpret wiring schematics
  • Advanced knowledge/ability to read and interpret blueprints/CAD drawings

Physical Demands/Requirements

  • Requires regular lifting and moving if items weighing up to 50 lbs.
  • May occasionally require lifting in excess of 50 lbs.
  • Routinely performs repetitive motions
  • Requires sitting for extended periods of time

Experience

Required
  • 5 year(s): Wiring and Diagrams
  • 5 year(s): PLC Assembly
  • 5 year(s): Electrical Assembly

Education

Preferred
  • Technical/other training or better

Skills

Required
  • Blueprint Reading
  • Panel Wiring
Preferred
  • Technically Inclined

Behaviors

Required
  • Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well
Preferred
  • Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity

Motivations

Preferred
  • Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization

title: Production Assembly Operator
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

We are currently looking to fill Production Assembly Operator positions for our DAY and Afternoon shfit.  

Day Shift 6:00 am - 2:30 pm

Afternoon Shift 3:30 pm - 2:00 am (3:30 pm - Midnight, Fridays)

 

 

Responsibilities:

â€¢ All work must be performed in a safe, efficient manner in compliance with Company Policy, local, provincial and/or federal rules and regulations;
â€¢ Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed;
â€¢ Produces components by following work instructions to assemble parts;
â€¢ Inspects parts visually for obvious defects and component verification;
â€¢ Install lights, harnesses, and/or other components to molded/painted parts as required;
â€¢ Packs finished products in racks, bags, cardboard boxes, dunnage and totes;
â€¢ Label parts ensuring label accuracy;
â€¢ Maintains work area, cleans and replenishes parts as required;
â€¢ Ensures all parts are labeled properly following plant wide colour coding system.

â€¢ Personnel performing work affecting product quality shall be competent on the basis of on-going training, appropriate education, skills and experience;
â€¢ Performs other duties as required by managers to keep pace with changes in scope of work.

Qualifications:

â€¢ Grade 12 education or equivalent experience in a manufacturing environment

â€¢ Good communication (Read and comprehend instructions)
â€¢ Organizational and dexterity skills
â€¢ Attention to detail
â€¢ Knowledge of components and materials used in the production process
â€¢ Ability to read colour
â€¢ Basic Computer skills
â€¢ Working positions change from standing to bending and lifting up to 30lbs.  
â€¢ Exposure to health hazards: dust, forklift noise with racks
â€¢ Exposure to heat in the summer months

Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?
â€œIt engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.â€
â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€
Not just a jobâ€”a great place to work!
 

Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer.     Ontario Human Rights Code and AODA.

title: Assembler
description:
AssemblerTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

****Referral bonus premium $500.00****ABB's Electrification Global Markets organization is responsible for the go-to-market strategy in 100+ countries where the Electrification Business Area operates. Our 10,000 sales & marketing employees connect our customers and partners to our innovative portfolio of products, services and solutions. Our domain expertise and global footprint enable us to support our customers with solutions that address their current needs, while anticipating how emerging trends such as urbanization, digitalization and the shift to sustainable energy will impact their future needs.Based in Ville St-Laurent, Québec, the assembler supports the business unit in the achievement of the production objectives set while adhering to the systems and processes. He carries out all types of mechanical assembly work in order to produce finished or semi-finished systems and/or panels using the machines and tools at his disposal.
Your responsibilities

  • Reads and interprets the mechanical diagrams.
  • Verifies the compliance of the components in accordance with the equipment list.
  • Performs drilling, tapping, cutting operations in conformity with the assembly drawings.
  • Performs the mechanical assembly of components in conformity with the mechanical diagrams.
  • Performs workshop operations in conformity with the health and safety guidelines and reports any non-compliances.
  • Uses and respects the standard production procedures and work instructions.
  • Maintains a clean workspace.

Your background
  • DVS in mechanics, electromechanics, or equivalent experience.
  • Three years of experience in a similar position.
  • Manual skills, good dexterity.
  • Autonomy.
  • Good knowledge of the French and English language.
  • Attention to detail and dedication to a job well done.

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Figurant sur la liste des 15 meilleurs employeurs au Canada de Forbes 2020, ABB valorise à sa juste valeur le dévouement, l'engagement et l'expertise de ses employés. À titre d'employeur soucieux de l'équité en matière d'emploi, ABB croit en un effectif inclusif et diversifié. Notre engagement est de veiller à ce que l'ensemble des politiques et des pratiques respectent l'esprit du Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, et nous visons à ce que notre effectif soit véritablement représentatif des quatre groupes désignés, notamment les femmes, les Autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB offrira des aménagements raisonnables aux candidats présentant un handicap, et les encourage à s'identifier comme tels lors du processus de candidature.Au sens de la présente offre, le masculin est utilisé comme genre neutre dans le seul but d'alléger le texte.

title: Opérateur de production
description:
Salaire :18,73 $

18,73$ de l’heure + prime de 0,80$ pour les heures effectuées entre 17h00 et 7h00.

Vous aurez également accès à des avantages sociaux concurrentiels !

Horaire :
Les candidats sélectionnés devront être disponible pour travailler à temps plein de JOUR OU de SOIR du lundi au jeudi pour travailler à l’usine de Québec.
Être disponible de jour pour la formation.

Profil recherché :
- Avoir de l’Intérêt pour l’industrie alimentaire;
- Aimer le travail manuel et avoir une bonne forme physique;
- Capacité à travailler en équipe;
- Être minutieux ;
- Désir de vouloir prendre des responsabilités (un atout).

À la production :
· Effectuer plusieurs tâches liées à la confection de produits de boulangerie sur une chaîne de production en continuer.
· Participer au maintien et à l'amélioration constante de la qualité d'un produit.
· Participer à l’entretien des équipements de production ainsi que des bâtiments de l’usine.

Fière d’être membre de Grupo Bimbo depuis mai 2014, Bimbo Canada est un chef de file de la fabrication et de la distribution de collations et de produits de boulangerie délicieux et nutritifs, offrant des marques comme Villaggio ®, POM ®, Bon Matin ®, Vachon ®, Sara Lee ®, Sanissimo ® et Takis ®. Nous sommes présentement à la recherche de manœuvres à la boulangerie pour se joindre à notre équipe de l’usine de Québec.



Pour envoyer votre candidature:
  • Par courriel : cbemploi.quebec@grupobimbo.com
  • En personne : directement à l’usine
Lieu du travail:
Usine de Québec
1185 rue Vincent-Massey
Québec, Québec, G1N 1N2

title: Electrical Assembler
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

  • Complete electrical assembly as per engineering’s specifications and standards;
  • Proceed with the installation of the manufactured equipment’s control and distribution panels electrical components;
  • Proceed with interconnections between motor sensors and control panels;
  • Detect and communicate corrections to the engineering team;
  • Weld electrical components when required;
  • Actively participate to the equipment star-up and calibration using measuring tools;
  • Participate to weekly production meetings.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  •  College or professional diploma in automated systems electro-mechanic or college certification in troubleshooting and maintenance of industrial systems;
  • 2-3 years’ experience in assembly of industrial machinery electrical components and wiring;
  • Mastering measuring tools such as a multimeter;
  • Able to read and interpret electrical plans;
  • Knowledge of industrial programmable controllers such as Bradley and Siemens;
  • Experience in welding electrical components, an asset
  • French as a working language, English an asset.
  • High quality standards;

    NJM offers a signing bonus for this position

    BENEFITS:

    As a Pro Mach employee, you receive more than just a paycheck. Total compensation includes your pay (hourly rate), very comprehensive medical/dental programs as well as life insurance, a pension plan and a generous paid time off program. 

    Due to the high volume of incoming resumes, only candidates chosen for interview will be contacted. Pro Mach is committed to providing an accessible workspace. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment process please notify the Company.

    ABOUT PMIC

    Pro Mach Innovation Center, located near Montreal, Quebec, Canada offers a full range of automation services, including industrial robotics, custom line optimization integration equipment, installation, and project management. PMIC is a division of Pro Mach, a leader in providing integrated packaging and processing products and solutions to more than 20,000 customers worldwide. Through a variety of brands, Pro Mach provides packaging equipment and product processing, certified training, installation, parts and service for primary and secondary packaging, flexible packaging, l end-of-line packaging as well as identification and follow-up. For more information on Pro Mach brands, visit http://www.promachbuilt.com/

    Experience

    Preferred
    • 2 - 3 years: experience in assembly of industrial machinery electrical components and wiring

    Skills

    Preferred
    • Blueprint Reading
    See job description

title: Assembly Test Operator
description:
Assembly Test Operator
2102103

Description

 

Job description

Entry-Level Semiconductor Test / Assembly Operator

About us

ON Semiconductor (Nasdaq: ON) is driving energy efficient innovations, empowering customers to reduce global energy use. The company is a leading supplier of semiconductor-based solutions, offering a comprehensive portfolio of energy efficient power management, analog, sensors, logic, timing, connectivity, discrete, SoC and custom devices. The company's products help engineers solve their unique design challenges in automotive, communications, computing, consumer, industrial, medical, aerospace and defense applications. ON Semiconductor operates a responsive, reliable, world-class supply chain and quality program, a robust compliance and ethics program, and a network of manufacturing facilities, sales offices and design centers in key markets throughout North America, Europe and the Asia Pacific regions.

What We Do

  • Provide a comprehensive portfolio of energy efficient solutions
  • Help customers solve their unique design challenges
  • Empower design engineers to reduce global energy use
  • Operate a responsive, reliable world-class supply chain and quality program
  • Maintain global environmental sustainability and social responsibility programs

Check out our Youtube Channel to learn more!

https://youtu.be/JvPR57mU7Io

About the Job

ON Semiconductor's Assembly Test Operations site in Burlington, ON, Canada is growing, and we are currently hiring full-time day- and afternoon-shift Operators to join our talented Test Assembly Team. No experience is necessary, we will provide the training on the job.

As an Assembly Test Operator, you will be a necessary member of a team that works on the exciting process that converts batches of blank silicon wafers (called wafer lots) into carriers for completed integrated circuits. At our Burlington site, our Operators work with the completed carriers to test and assemble them in order to get them out and into the world as soon as possible!

We offer flexible shifts, and excellent training. No experience required to be a part of the global effort at ON Semiconductor to create high-tech products that enhance people's lives!

Your day to day as an Operator will consist of the following:

  • Performing specific back-end semiconductor manufacturing functions that are integral to the production of semiconductor devices.
  • Operating various equipment in order to perform the following functions:  material preparation, process set-up, solder printing, component attach, wirebond, encapsulation, dicing, electrical test operation, documentation completion, data entry, process monitoring, and inspections.
  • Performing and supporting device assembly and test operations as assigned
  • Working a shift schedule (8 hour shifts, either during the day or the afternoon), and having the flexibility to change shift assignments from time to time as needed 
  • Executing tasks and assignments in a timely and effective matter
  • Performing in-process inspections, SPC data entry and MES transactions
 

Qualifications

 

You are a great fit if you…

  • Are interested in learning what it's like to work in a highly-controlled, laboratory-like environment, called a clean room.
  • Have no problems wearing a hairnet, safety glasses, facemask (covering nose and mouth), lab coat, and ESD shoes throughout your 8-hour shift.These dressing requirements help protect the highly-sensitive tech products you will be working with!
  • Enjoy doing detailed work in a clean and structured environment, and following established safety and quality procedures.
  • Have a desire to learn and grow in the manufacturing or semiconductor industries!
  • Have the drive and capability to be cross trained (learn more than one job or operation).

The Must Haves:

  • Minimum age of 18
  • Basic math skills
  • Basic computer proficiency, to include data-entry and communication systems that work very similarly to Excel.
  • Ability to demonstrate computer proficiency and receive a passing score on a job-specific computer assessment
  • Dexterity, and the ability to handle and manipulate small parts that are as small as ¼ of a centimeter
  • Ability to follow instructions and complete things correctly the first time
  • Ability to work 8 hour shifts on a rotating schedule (as needed, with notice—see below)
  • Ability to effectively communicate verbally and in writing
  • Ability to stand for at least 85% of the time during any particular shift.
  • Ability to lift and carry up to 15 lbs.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, and ability to work effectively in both a team and independent environment.
  • Organizational skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritize effectively to push tasks through to completion.
  • Reliable transportation in order to get to work everyday

 

What Will Put You Ahead:

  • Stable work history
  • Past experience in a similar manufacturing environment
  • Past experience using a microscope in a laboratory-like environment

 

Work Schedule:

  • Our Burlington facility is open Monday-Friday, and requires operators to to be flexible and available to work one of two shifts throughout the week:
    • Day Shift: 7:00am-3:30pm
    • Afternoon Shift: 3:15pm-11:45pm
    • Flexibility to be able to work these hours and change your schedule around per the needs of the site (with notice) is required.

ON Semiconductor offers accommodations during the recruitment process for applicants with disabilities. Should you require accommodation through this process please advise Human Resources. Information received relating to the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

 

Primary Location

: CA-Ontario-Burlington

Work Locations

: 
CAON02 SDT LTD 
970 Fraser Dr 
 Burlington L7L 5P5

Job Posting

: Mar 28, 2022, 11:01:19 PM

title: Journalier assembleur
description:
JOURNALIER - ASSEMBLEUR - EMBALLAGE 16,36$/H À 18,93$/H

Notre client, un GÉANT du domaine du plein-air / nautique est présentement en recrutement massif pour leur usine de Laval ! Cette superbe entreprise en excellente santé financière et misant sur le bien-être de leurs employés, ont présentement plus d'une vingtaine d'opportunités à combler pour ces différents postes ;

- Assembleur
- Aide-assembleur
- Emballage
- Étiquetage
- Finition
- Manutention


Avantages
Voici les avantages à postuler sur ces différents postes de journalier assembleur à Laval ;
- Programme d'avantages sociaux avec Sunlife (le lien et un document peut être fournis pour plus de détails)
- Horaire de travail disponible sur trois quarts :
- jour : lundi au vendredi 7h00 à 15h00
- soir : lundi au vendredi 15h00 à 23h00
- nuit : dimanche au jeudi 23h00 à 7h00
- Salaire de départ de :
- jour : 16,73$/h
- soir : 17,53$/h
- nuit : 18,93$/h
(augmentation de salaire après la période de probation)
- Environnement chaleureux et axé sur le travail d'équipe
- Rémunération compétitive
- Opportunité de cheminement interne par affichage de poste
- Programme de reconnaissances (Taux d'absentéisme, bon dossier = 40$/mois, avec prix de reconnaissances divers pouvant aller jusqu’à 1000$ après 1 an)
- Service alimentaire sur place (jour et soir) -- Menu qui change à chaque semaine
- Accessible en transport en commun
- Beaucoup d'activités organisés par l'entreprise (Journée Pizza, Journée Fêtes , Fêtes de employés et d'ancienneté, Food truck, etc.)
- Assurances collectives et cotisation aux REER après la période de probation
- Remboursement de souliers de sécurité (115$ par année)
- Remboursement de lunettes de sécurité avec prescription
- T-shirt offert gratuitement
- Révision salariale annuel
- Possibilité d’avoir un horaire d’été (avoir congé tous les lundis et vendredis) avec de l’ancienneté


Responsabilités
Tâches reliées à ces postes de journalier à l'assemblage à Laval :
- Aide à l'assemblage
- Utilisation d'outils pneumatique et électriques
- Emballage et étiquetage des produits



Qualifications
Compétences recherchées pour ce poste de journalier à Laval :
- Être confortable à utiliser des outils de perçage
- Être disponible pour travailler à Laval
- Être disponible à temps plein


Sommaire
Ce poste de journalier assembleur dans le secteur de Laval t'intéresse et tu aimerais pouvoir postuler ?

Voici comment nous joindre ;
Téléphone : 450-682-4505 (vous pouvez demander pour Raul, Virginie ou Geena)
Texto : 514-206-9118
Courriel :francesco.abate@randstad.ca, raul.napruiu@randstad.ca ou geena.bouassi@randstad.ca ou virginie.bellemare@randstad.ca

Contactez-nous immédiatement et il nous fera plaisir de vous aider dans vos recherches d'emploi !

l'humain en tête

Zeina, Geena, Raul et Virginie

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Electrical Assembler
description:
Do a minimum of 1 year of electrical assembly? Do you have experience in cable assembly and mechanical parts? Do you have amazing attention to detail? Do you have good dexterity skills? Are you enthusiasm to learn?
The Electrical Assembler will be responsible for routing, wiring, and installing electrical components as well as full functional and electrical testing on products.

We are currently staffing for a well-known company in the East that are expanding within their business!
Does this sound like you or someone you know? We want to hear from you!


Advantages

Salary: $20.35
Day shifts: Monday- Thursday: 7:30 AM-6:00 PM
Long weekends!
Working for a well-known company
Health Benefits after probation
Bus accessible


Responsibilities
Identifying electrical component
Reading and interpreting plans
Doing the cabling
Assembling the electrical components on the panel
Installation of the panels in the unit


Qualifications

A year or more within electrical assembly
Experience within routing wiring and installations of electrical components


Summary
If you, or anyone you know are interested, please apply by:

Visit www.randstad.ca and apply through the posting
Apply by e-mail at: indus.gl@randstad.ca
Call 613.726.0220 ext 2 and ask for Eldjie and Josee
We appreciate all applications; however only those who meet the requirements for the position of Assembler located in Ottawa will be contacted.


Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Production Technician - Summer Student
description:
Production Technician - Summer Student

Maple Leaf Foods McLeod Plant in Saskatoon is Hiring!

General Information
  • Must be 16 years of age or older to work in a production environment
  • Starting wage of $13.60/hour
  • $1.00/hour shift premium for time worked between 6 pm – 6 am
  • A variety of shifts are available
  • Opportunities to learn and grow
  • Fast paced learning environment
A Sustainable, Forward Thinking Protein Company
Maple Leaf Foods is a leading meat and plant-based protein company, employing over 11,500 people and publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. We are proud of our roots, which trace back well over 100 years, but our vision and purpose are decidedly forward looking. As we pursue our vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, we are committed to creating shared value – creative business value through addressing some of the world’s most critical social and environmental challenges. Our goal is to build a more sustainable food system, which provides nutritious affordable food, operates within planetary limits, cares for animals responsibly, and meaningfully engages with our communities to advance a more just society. We are advancing bold changes within Maple Leaf and more broadly within society to pursue our vision. We deeply believe this is the sustainable path to growth.

Our job is to make great food
Maple Leaf Foods embraces a strong values-based culture, where our people are deeply engaged in work that is purposeful, fast-paced and challenging. We cultivate an open, non-bureaucratic and inclusive workplace that fosters safety and transparency, along with individual leadership and accountability. Each Maple Leaf team member has a voice and plays an active role in helping all of us achieve our goals with passion and discipline. We support one another to grow professionally, to learn new skills and to take on challenging experiences in the spirit of continuous improvement.


Raise the Good in Food
We have united behind a shared purpose – to Raise the Good in Food. This spans a dramatic transformation of our flagship Maple Leaf brand, replacing anything artificial with simple, natural ingredients; investments and process changes to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025; building a diverse and inclusive culture where all talent thrives; becoming a leader in animal care; and advancing food security through our charitable foundation, the Maple Leaf Centre for Action on Food Security.

Our Leadership Values
Eight core values guide us in everything that we do.
  • Do What’s Right
  • Shared Value
  • High Performance
  • Diverse and Inclusive Teams
  • Disciplined Decision Making
  • Our Accountability
  • Intense Curiosity
  • Transparency and Humility
The Opportunity
The Production Technician full-time position is responsible for performing packaging, clean-up and other elemental activities related to food processing.

A snapshot of some of the exciting things you will lead and do:
  • Transport raw materials, finished products and equipment throughout plant manually or using powered equipment
  • Check and weigh materials and products
  • Sort, pack, crate and package materials and products
  • Assist machine operators, assemblers and other workers
  • Clean work areas and equipment
  • Perform other general labour tasks
What we have to offer you:
  • Be part of a company with an inspiring and unique vision, with a deep commitment to sustainability and expanding its leadership in sustainable protein across North America
COVID-19 Safety Measures:
Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination prior to the commencement of employment. We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

title: Assembly & General Laborer
description:
Plainsman Mfg. Inc. is looking to hire an Assembly/General Labour ASAP!
 
Job Description:
  • Assemble parts, general clean up, inventory counts, deliveries and pickups as needed. Immediate start! 
  • Hours: 8-4:30 pm Mon-Fri.
  • High-pressure team environment.

Company Description:
  • Plainsman Mfg. Inc. is a locally owned manufacturing and distribution company operating out of Edmonton, Alberta since 1966.
  • We manufacture and distribute products for oilfield production, pipeline maintenance, construction and gas, and water distribution.
  • We have an in-house engineering department and a full-service manufacturing facility that enables us to respond efficiently to customer and industry needs.

Habits:
  • Adherence to Plainsman Mfg quality standards.
  • Thoroughness and pride at ANY task assigned by supervisor.
  • Adhere to the safety program.
  • Keep work area tidy and organized.
  • Initiate and complete small projects/improvements.

Skills or Experience Requirements:
  • *Must have mechanical aptitude.
  • High School Diploma or student.
  • Ability to read and write English.
  • Physically able.
  • Must have a valid driver's license.
  • Must be able to quickly learn and be willing to ask.
  • Follow written and verbal procedures as well as be able to clearly document their own work.
  • Able to prioritize and make decisions using lean, risk, customer needs, and Plainsman core values.
  • Work with a team (conflict resolution, collaboration).
  • Able to assemble multiple Plainsman product categories without supervision.
  • Troubleshoot small issues and make corrections.

title: Agent(e) de réservation
description:
Dans le cadre de son plan développement en Amérique du Nord, le groupe Huttopia recherche un/une Agent(e) de réservation qui sera basé à Montréal.

Le groupe Huttopia, chef de file dans l’industrie du glamping et de l’écotourisme, conçoit, construit et exploite des sites dans des espaces naturels uniques. Fondé il y a 20 ans en France, Huttopia s’est implanté en Amérique du Nord en 2007. L’entreprise exploite aujourd’hui 80 sites dans 6 pays sur 3 continents. Inscrit dans un marché en pleine croissance, Huttopia a basé son développement sur un fort esprit entrepreneurial, l’innovation et la préservation de la nature.

Tâches et responsabilité:
  •  Répondre au téléphone et aux courriels.
  • Assurer la prise des réservations des séjours dans le logiciel de réservation.
  • Conseiller la clientèle sur les différents produits et destinations.
  • Optimiser les ventes.
  • Toutes tâches connexes.

Profil:
  • Fortes compétences interpersonnelles et d'écoute.
  • La connaissance du français et de l'anglais est requise (écrit et oral).

Conditions de travail:
  • Emploi temporaire (jusqu'à octobre 2022).
  • Temps plein, disponibilité la fin de semaine.
  • Date de début: Aussitôt que possible.

Comment nous soumettre votre candidature? 
Si cette offre d’emploi vous intéresse, veuillez nous envoyer votre CV via cet offre d’emploi ou directement à recrutementhna@huttopia.com en précisant le poste et le lieu souhaité. 
 
Nous vous remercions pour votre intérêt envers notre entreprise. Cependant, prenez note que seuls les candidats retenus pour une entrevue seront contactés. 

L’usage du masculin inclut le féminin et est uniquement utilisé dans le but d'alléger le texte.

title: PRODUCTION TECHNICIAN
description:
Job Description

While you might see a lot of job offers for production technicians, being one at EACOM Ear Falls, a subsidiary of INTERFOR, means getting to work right in the heart of nature. You'll be around wood, wood and more wood. Your eagle eyes will help keep the yard and sawmill looking their best. To keep things running smoothly, you’ll make sure that there’s a place for everything and that everything is in its place. You'll make a living working at our sawmills with deep roots in the northern regions of Ontario and Quebec. You'll discover that they do more than just transform wood; they also transform our communities!

Are you hard-working, resourceful and a go-getter? Come work at EACOM, where we pull out all the stops for your success. Our team is waiting for you!

What you’ll be doing specifically:

  • Tie up bundles of rough lumber for drying outside.
  • Redo and stack bundles of rough and planed wood in the yard.
  • Perform clean-ups of the yard and sawmill.
  • Perform clean-ups after interior and exterior sawing operations.
  • During work downtime, clean areas that are inaccessible during operations.
  • Do any other related tasks (don’t worry; you'll learn tons of things that will help you in your career!).

What do you need to succeed with us?

  • Be able to work well on a team.
  • Be independent and full of initiative.
  • Show vigilance and a concern for health and safety.
Qualifications

Experience that will help you in this position:

  • DCS, DEC, or equivalent.
  • Prior experience at a sawmill is an asset.
  • Be available to work day and/or night shifts.


Additional Information

At EACOM, we're here for you.

EACOM supports employment equity. Diversity is not only welcome, it’s encouraged! We’ll contact you if you are selected for an interview. If you need special accommodations, let us know. Any information you send us will be treated with respect and confidentiality. Gender diversity is also important. Know that women are definitely welcome!

title: Part Assembler
description:
Job Responsibilities/Requirements:
  • Part assembly, using hand, air, and power tools, and assembly fixtures. 
  • Attention to details, measuring, fast-paced environment, and striving for quality. 
  • Must have own transportation, no transit service available. 
  • The ability to work on components for OEM's around the world with Agricultural, motorcycles, snowmobiles, rail trains transit buses and medical equipment.
  • Working with a team with opportunity to advance within the company.

Benefits:
  • Disability insurance.
  • Extended health care.
  • Dental care.
  • RRSP Plan

Job Type: Full-time.
Work Remotely: No. 




    About Eastside Industrial Coatings and Composites :

    Established in 1997, Eastside Industrial started out as a coatings business, preparing and painting fibreglass and metal components for local OEMs.As the coatings business continued to grow with a focus on “A” Finish coatings, Eastside Industrial moved to a larger location (our current space), committed to diversifying into composites manufacturing and expanding our customer base throughout the continent.Today, Eastside Industrial serves dozens of OEMs across North America with tooling prototyping, assembly, coatings and composites manufacturing solutions. Eastside Industrial continues to see growth as we expand our operations to accommodate higher scale and more innovative production methods to continue meeting our current and targeted customer needs.We remain a family owned business focused on growing our team and developing our team to have a successful future with Eastside or a member of the Eastside Group.

title: Assembly Technician / Assembler
description:
Description:
Full-time role with one of the biggest manufacturing company in the world. Apply now with Agilus Work Solutions!
Agilus is recruiting for multiple Assembly Technician/Assemblers in the Manufacturing Sector in Mississauga, Ontario.
This is a Full-time permanent role in a ever growing manufacturing company. The assemblers/technicians will be working on the production line to craft, finish and inspect the product.
A day in the life:
  • Prepare, block, edge and assemble product according to job specifications
  • Assist in the basic operation, cleaning and ongoing maintenance of laboratory tools and equipment by in accordance with to established maintenance procedures and calendars

You bring:
  • Minimum 1-year experience of mechanical, electrical or computer/cellphone assembly experience in the industrial or manufacturing sector
  • Ability to read and understand machine schematics is a bonus
  • Experience working in a production/assembly line is highly preferred

What's in it for you:
  • Competitive salary with $18/hour rate
  • Bus accessible location and free parking provided

Let's connect!
Please apply directly online by email jvirtucio@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: MONTEUR / ASSEMBLEUR
description:
Fondée en 1986 et située à Sainte-Agathe-des-Monts, l'entreprise Les Bâtiments BUT Ltée est spécialisée dans la conception et la fabrication de Bâtiments Usinés Transportables et matériaux composites. Elle se démarque en étant la seule entreprise au Québec à produire des bâtiments en fibre de verre. Ses clients sont principalement des entreprises privées de renom et gouvernemental en communication, surveillance aérienne et météo. 

MONTEUR / ASSEMBLEUR 

Le monteur/assembleur effectue les travaux de montage et d’assemblage des différentes composantes dont est composé un abri préfabriqué.  

Tâches et responsabilités :

  • S’assure de procédé à la fabrication en fonction les plans et devis 
  • Tient compte des spécifications et des pratiques établies
  • Effectue le montage des structures et des revêtements
  • Prépare les bâtiments à recevoir l’isolation (Uréthane giclé) 
  • Procède à l’assemblage des différent composent de l’abri 
  • Effectue les travaux de finition intérieur (murs, plafond, plancher) 
  • Travaille avec un minimum de supervision 

Qualifications requises : 

  • Bonne condition physique (capacité à travailler debout pendant plusieurs heures, monter dans des échelles, soulever des charges, etc.)
  • Habileté à travailler dans un environnement manufacturier
  • Communiquer efficacement en français

Atouts 

  • DEP en installation de structure de bâtiments 
  • Expérience en construction et rénovation général (hors décret) 
  • Expérience avec la fabrication de bâtiments préfabriqué 

Profil recherché

  • Minutie
  • Assiduité/ponctualité
  • Capacité à travailler seul et/ou en équipe

Conditions de travail offertes

  • 40 heures/semaine, du lundi au vendredi de 7h à 15h30
  • Salaire à partir de 19$/h, à discuter selon expérience. Révision après période de probation (3 mois). 
  • Vacances : 2 semaines durant la saison estivale (selon le décret de la construction) 

Et 2 jours de maladie par année

  • Assurances (maladie, longue durée, vie)
  • REER : l’employeur égalise la contribution de l’employé à 20,00$/semaine

Jusqu’à concurrence de 1, 040,00$ par année  

  • Matériel fourni (outils, gants, lunette de protection, etc.) 

Montant annuel alloué pour des chaussures de sécurité

  • Formation payée par l’employeur si requis 
  • À proximité de l’artère commerciale de Sainte-Agathe-des Monts, 

Des pistes de ski, et du sentier Le P’tit Train du Nord

Entrée en fonction : immédiate ou selon disponibilité,

                                L’offre d’emploi t’intéresse et tu souhaites faire partie de l’équipe?

Envoie-nous ton cv à
