title: Assembler IC
description:
Cardinal Health Canada, with over 1300 employees nationwide, is an essential link in the Canadian healthcare supply chain, providing over 70,000 products to healthcare facilities and medical professionals across the country.

Cardinal Health-Gananoque manufactures many life impacting medical devices that help our customers thrive in a changing world. We are your humble partners, striving each day to make healthcare more efficient and effective and our patients as healthy as possible. We are more than 350 employees with 112 years of Canadian history, a deep understanding of the medical devices we manufacture every day and a passion for innovation.

We are looking for positive and team-oriented individuals to join our Gananoque manufacturing center to support the production department.

For more information on what it is like to work for us, please watch this video: Cardinal Health - Wings (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zA4HVn5g5DI) .

_What Our Assembly Team contributes to Cardinal Health_

The team performs a variety of tasks ranging from repetitive to non-repetitive production to put together component parts to make assemblies, sub-assemblies or completed units, using standard operating procedures. They may conduct quality inspections on processing line in accordance with quality specifications.

Pay: $17.00 - $18.50 an hour + $1000 Sign-On Bonus

Job Requirements:

+ Accountability for Product Quality and Safety Compliance
+ Ability to work in a team/cellular environment assembling various Infant Care Products
+ Ability to analyze and document various functions in the process
+ Set up and operation of packaging equipment required.
+ Ability to follow good documentation practices.
+ Understanding of Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and 5S methodology.
+ Perform line clearance procedures and set-up to support efficient and timely change-overs
+ Participate in Non-Conformance investigation and resolution where applicable
+ Knowledge of the Infant Care Department would be a definite asset.

Minimum Requirements:

+ High school diploma preferred
+ Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
+ Ability to interpret and follow instructions
+ Excellent hand/eye coordination and dexterity
+ Ability to sustain repetitive duties

Our Employees all benefit from:

+ Full dental and health benefits including life insurance from day 1
+ Pension plan with employer matching level contribution
+ Incentive plan participation
+ Paid vacation days
+ Tuition reimbursement
+ Paid uniform and safety shoes allowance
+ In-house training on safety measures, production tasks and equipment

_Cardinal Health is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities._

_Cardinal Health is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our Human Resources team is responsible for working with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process._

_Cardinal Health supports an inclusive workplace that values diversity of thought, experience and background. We celebrate the power of our differences to create better solutions for our customers by ensuring employees can be their authentic selves each day. Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law._

_To read and review this privacy notice click_ here (https://www.cardinalhealth.com/content/dam/corp/email/documents/corp/cardinal-health-online-application-privacy-policy.pdf)

Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Assembler II
description:
Overview:

Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.

We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.

Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.

When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger â€“ a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each otherâ€™s successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.

Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provide you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.

 

Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Job Requirements:

Under general supervision, perform mechanical assembly of moderate complexity in accordance with established procedures.

 

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: (not listed in any particular order)

  • Know and understand Weatherford's Enterprise Excellence Process and the Quality Policy and comply with all requirements of the Quality Systems Manual, Operating and Technical Procedures and Workplace Instructions.  
  • Assemble and test completions equipment per engineered drawings or as instructed by others.  
  • Uses hand tools, power tools, and measuring devices such as tapes, gauges, calipers, micrometer  
  • Inspect completed components for accuracy and functionality.  
  • Perform hydrostatic test on components as necessary.
  • Material handling  
  • Properly maintain company supplied tooling and maintain an orderly work area  
  • Aid in developing of new procedures and improving existing procedures.
  • Must understand and comply with all safety rules and company policies of Weatherford.  
  • Work assignments carried out to the highest quality level.  
  • Perform various other duties and activities as assigned by supervisor within the physical constraints of the job.
Experience:
  • Factory or oil & gas experience an asset
  • Good verbal communication skills.  
  • Basic computer skills  
  • Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos in English.  
  • Ability to read assembly layouts and manufacturing prints.  
  • Ability to read a measuring tape, micrometer and calipers.  
  • Ability to safely operate material handling devices (overhead cranes, forklifts).  
  • Ability to perform all job duties of an Assembler  
  • General knowledge of assembly procedures.  
  • Ability to be an effective team member
  • Quick learner/self motiviated

title: Assembleur isolation de panneaux
description:
Une grande entreprise de fabrication d’appareils de chauffage, de ventilation et de climatisation (CVC) est actuellement à la recherche dun assembleur isolation de panneaux. Le titulaire du poste a la responsabilité d’isoler et d’assembler les panneaux et les portes utilisés dans l’assemblage des unités.

 

Description des taches :

 

  • Tailler les morceaux d’isolation en fonction des pièces à isoler;
  • Procèder à l’isolation des panneaux et des portes;
  • Assembler les pièces les unes avec les autres à l’aide des fixations mécaniques;
  • Appliquer un scellant;
  • Utiliser divers petits outils à main ainsi que des outils mécaniques courants;
  • Travailler en collaboration avec les employés de son secteur et des autres secteurs;
  • Analyser et effectuer des suivis de dossiers de production;
  • Garder ses outils et son environnement de travail propres et fonctionnels (respect du 5S);
  • Respecter les normes et les règlements de sécurité;
  • Respecter les normes de qualité;
  • Informer son supérieur immédiat de tout problème survenant dans le cadre de son travail.

Profil

Exigences et Qualifications :


  • Détenir un DES ou l’équivalent, toutes combinaisons de formation et d’expérience pertinentes pourront être considérées;
  • Avoir une connaissance du système de mesures impériales;
  • Détenir de lexpérience en lecture de plans et de documents sera considéré un atout. 
  • Avoir de bonnes aptitudes physiques puisque lemploi requiert un travail physique en diverses positions.


Informations contractuelles

Conditions de travail:

  • Poste permanent syndiqué;
  • Travail de jour de lundi au vendredi, 40 heures par semaine;
  • Assurance collective, REER et autres avantages sociaux;
  • Salaire commence à 17.60 $/h;
  • Possibilité davancement.



Qualifications et exigences: Rapidité d'exécution; Dextérité manuelle; Sens de l'observation; Endurance physique (travail debout et penché); Années d'expérience reliées à l'emploi : un atout.

title: Production Technician
description:
About the Company:

Auxly Ottawa aims to connect with those actively in the cannabis category that have an appreciation for the positive impact that art, culture, and design have on humanity. Kolab Project cannabis products, available at licensed cannabis retailers across Canada, include premium pre-rolls, vapes, soft chews and chocolate. Learn more at kolabproject.com and stay up-to-date at Twitter: @kolabproject; Instagram: @kolabproject; Facebook: @kolabproject.

Overview:

Reporting to the Production Team Lead, the Production Technician will be responsible for assisting in all post-production activities, including milling, sifting, pre-roll production, packaging, labelling, sampling, order fulfillment and facility sanitation.

What can you expect to do:
  • Strictly adhere to the companyâ€™s Standard Operating Procedures (SOPâ€™s).
  • Perform all pre-roll manufacturing processes.
  • Perform packaging runs.
  • Participate in order fulfillment activities.
  • Perform batch sampling for external testing.
  • Assist the cultivation team in ensuring the Companyâ€™s facility remains organized and kept in a sanitary condition.
  • Complete all documentation related to production and sanitation activities.
  • Other related duties as assigned.
What we are looking for :
  • Post-Secondary education an asset.
  • Capable of multi-tasking with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to be flexible and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • 1 year experience in a manufacturing enviornment or similar, an asset
What will set you apart:
  • Familiarity with the Cannabis Act and Cannabis Regulations.
  • Horticulture experience is an asset.
  • Experience in a regulated and highly compliant environment is desired (ie. food industry, pharmaceutical).

What's in it for you

  • Amazing and valuable experience in a brand new industry and company!
  • Comprehensive benefits package
  • Guaranteed full time hours, permanent position, stability
  • Excellent opportunities for growth and career development

title: Production Assembler
description:
Production Assembler
About Us:

Smartrend Manufacturing Group (SMG), Inc. established in 2004, is a leading manufacturer of customer-specific components and assemblies for transportation and general industrial applications. In 2017, First Light Safety Products was created as a division of SMG. On a mission to prevent stop arm violations, school bus related accidents and fatalities, First Light Safety Products design and manufactures innovative patent-pending illumination technology for the school bus industry. Both organizations share a 30,000 sq ft, state of the art manufacturing facility.

Summary:
Reporting to the Production Manager, the Production Assembler will be responsible for producing and assembling products on the production line that aid in the safety of children. The successful candidate will have strong attention to detail, has a “can-do” attitude and works well in a team environment.

Detailed Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Mechanical assembly of sub-assemblies and final products
  • Read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and specifications

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:
  • Ability to work unsupervised in a fast-paced environment
  • Good manual dexterity
  • Electronics assembly background is an asset
  • Work well under pressure and under tight timelines
  • Experience with fabrication using basic hand tools, power tools, and machinery
  • Knowledge of production documentation and mechanical and electrical assemblies
  • An energetic, diligent work ethic and able to work with little supervision

Share with us your talent, drive, and entrepreneurial spirit and we will provide a creative and supportive environment, where valuable contributions are rewarded and celebrated with professional growth, job satisfaction, and an attractive total compensation program. We offer a benefits package to our employees including:
  • Group Insurance Plan
  • Paid Vacations

WE WOULD LIKE TO THANK ALL APPLICANTS WHO APPLY, HOWEVER, ONLY THOSE SELECTED FOR AN INTERVIEW WILL BE CONTACTED.




    About Smartrend Manufacturing Group:

    Established in 2004, Smartrend Manufacturing Group (SMG) is a supply chain company specializing in customer- specific engineered components and assemblies for OEMs and industrial producers. We bring value to our customers with efficiently designed and manufactured parts, made to their specifications, and delivered on their schedule. We focus on collaborative efforts with our customers to provide the lowest total cost of acquisition. We operate in three countries with 30 direct team members.

title: Assembleur électrique - fin de semaine
description:
Tu as soif d’aventure, de nouveaux défis et tu veux avoir du fun au travail? Tu recherches une entreprise qui t’en donne plus?

Ne cherche plus! Nous avons LA place pour toi!

 Ce que nous t’offrons :

  • Un salaire compétitif et progressif selon la convention
  • Des assurances collectives payées à 50% et un REER avec contribution de l’employeur dès ta première journée!
  • Prime de rétention de 2000$ après 1 an avec nous
  • Prime de référencement de 1000$ pour chaque personne que tu nous envoies
  • Une ambiance agréable, une équipe expérimentée et disponible pour te soutenir dans ton développement
  • Une usine propre, climatisée et où nous travaillons sur de beaux projets!

Tu as choisi le quart de fin de semaine? Voici ce que c’est :

  • C’est seulement trois jours : vendredi-samedi-dimanche, de 6h30 à 18h30
  • 4 jours de congé par semaine
  • Tu travailles 36 heures, mais on te paye 40 heures!
  • Prime de fin de semaine : 1,25$ de l’heure

 Ce que tu devras accomplir au quotidien…

  • Lire et interpréter les schémas électriques et mécaniques pour déterminer l’emplacement des composantes dans l’unité de ventilation
  • Identifier les fils à l’aide des couleurs prédéterminées sur les plans
  • Installer toutes les composantes nécessaires à la confection d’une unité
  • Percer les trous dans l’unité en fonction des plans
  • Installer le filage dans toutes les composantes de l’unité
  • Monter les différents contrôles: compresseur, brûleur du panneau, les pièces et les collants
  • Brancher le mécanisme de zones, les volets et les servomoteurs s’il y a lieu
  • Faire la vérification visuelle du contrôle électrique
  • Analyser et effectuer des suivis de dossiers de production

Exigences :

  • DEP en électricité, dans un domaine connexe ou une combinaison formation et expérience pertinente
  • Avoir de bonnes aptitudes physiques puisque l'emploi requiert un travail physique en diverses positions
  • Avoir une connaissance du système de mesures impériales
  • De l'expérience en lecture de plans et de documents (un atout)

Nortek Air Solution, c’est quoi ça? C’est une entreprise qui améliore la qualité de vie des gens. Elle fabrique des projets sur mesure pour la clientèle. Des IMMENSES projets. On peut même entrer dedans! Ici, on fait des systèmes d’échangeurs d’air, de chauffage, de ventilation et de climatisation de toutes sortes. On offre des produits et des solutions ÉCOÉNERGÉTIQUES et durables qui surpassent les attentes de nos clients grâce à l’engagement de notre MERVEILLEUSE équipe envers la qualité, l’expérience client et l’excellence opérationnelle. Nos principales valeurs sont l’entrepreneurship, la confiance et l’initiative vers l’action. Nous avons L’INCROYABLE mission de créé un AVENIR MEILLEUR à chaque jour.

title: Production Technician
description:
Interested in joining a cause-driven, customer focused company dedicated to positively impacting the health of animals, people and the planet? Search our job listings below.


 

Job Purpose:

Supports manufacturing by providing assistance and support to other Production Technicians while maintaining environmental and sanitation standards according to cGMP guidelines to ensure that the facilities are kept clean to prevent contamination and cross-contamination of the department

Responsibilities:

  • Support Antigen production and freeze dried vaccines production according to Standard Operating Procedures and Protocols.
  • Environmental monitoring – viable and non-viable monitoring
  • Prepare materials for production needs
  • Organizing, labeling, wrapping and sterilization of materials
  • Ensure equipment and materials are in state of readiness for production technicians
  • Cleaning/disinfection of production areas and materials as outlined in specific Standard Operating Procedures.
  • Assist in Buffer preparation and other supporting activities related to down streaming process.
  • Perform routine activities such as recording temperatures and room pressures, performing purified water sampling and clean steam sampling.
  • Preparation and modification of Standard Operating Procedures as required
  • Complete other duties as necessary

Education and Experience:

  • Certificate, Post-Secondary Diploma or Degree
  • Some experience with cGMP manufacturing environment procedures and protocols is preferred.
  • Biotechnology or Biology considered an asset

Requirements:

  • Able to wear clean room garments.
  • Must be physically able to lift, move and maneuver medium sized equipment/ material for production.
  • Work to be performed outside of normal working hours including evenings and weekends (12 hour day shift rotation)
  • Must be able to read, write, understand, and comply with appropriate standard operating procedures.
  • Handling of disinfectants (will require the wearing of a respirator).

Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

title: Manufacturing Intern
description:
Alexandria Moulding is currently seeking Summer Students to join our team.
We have positions available in our manufacturing and distribution centers.

Qualifications:
  • Successful candidates will be assigned to one of these area’s based on available opportunities at the time of hire.
  • Candidates must be full-time students and enrolled in high-school (grade 11 or 12) or a Post-Secondary Institution for 2022.
Job Details:
  • All assignments require adherence to specific procedures and work practices related to manufacturing.
  • Work is scheduled on 8- or 12-hour shift (day, afternoon, night, weekend shifts) to provide relief to the regular employees during summer vacation period.
 General Responsibilities Include:
  • Ensure safety standards are met by following Alexandria Moulding safe work and lockout procedures.
  • Maintain high standards of cleanliness in your work area and throughout the facility.
  • Train and develop skills in various areas of the facility.
  • Willing to work in an environment with varying temperatures and conditions.
  • Develop strong working relationships with your peers and manufacturing and distribution teams.
  • Work assigned requires problem solving skills and capability to perform the physical aspects of the role (lifting, bending, standing, pushing/pulling etc.)
  • Housekeeping.
The Candidate:
  • Ability to work in a safe and efficient manner.
  • Available to work various shifts.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Ability to analyze and troubleshoot.
  • Positive attitude and a self-starter.
  • Able to work in an environment that may include exposure to weather, dust, moving mechanical parts, and noise.

title: Production Technician - Electro-mechanical assembly
description:
The Job

You will be performing detailed electronic and electro-mechanical assembly in sub-assembly or assembly units, as well as bench testing of Integrated Navigation Bridge System components. In building and testing of electro-mechanical assemblies, the incumbent will hold tolerances to blueprint and/or oral and written specifications.
You will also be responsible for performing parts installation, wiring, cable harnessing and hand soldering using standard sequence and also perform repairs to legacy/customer equipment.

The main responsibilities are:
  • Organize and verify components for assembly or installation
  • Assemble sub-assembly and/or final assembly units in a timely fashion
  • Solder wires and assembly of cable connections as required
  • Build and/or test electro-mechanical assemblies to blueprint and/or oral and written specifications
  • Maintain accurate records of all quality, operations and assembly related documentation and procedures
  • Ensure high quality of executed duties on an ongoing basis to support exceptional standards of quality, delivery, compliance and excellence
  • Comply with OSI Maritime Systems established ISO-9001-compliant development guidelines and standards
  • Comply with workplace operational, environmental, health and safety procedure guidelines
 

You bring

  • 3-5 years’ electro-mechanical experience in detailed soldering
  • Knowledge of hand tools, power tools, fixtures and measuring devices including DVMs
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Word and Microsoft ExcelAttention to detail in ensuring that quality and efficiency standards are met or exceeded
  • Excellent oral and written English communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Adequate close vision and color & depth perception
  • This position may require lifting and moving products of up to 50 lbs
  • May be required to work overtime as needed
  • Some domestic travel may be required from time to time
  • Experience in electro-mechanical assembly, testing along with following schematics, experience working in an ISO 9001 compliant environment would be an asset.
 

About US

In 1977, OSI introduced the first generation electronic chart system for the maritime market and revolutionized navigation. Over the years we have had many firsts.  Today, OSI Maritime Systems is a leading provider of integrated navigation and tactical solutions designed for naval and maritime security operations. Among those solutions, the company develops and delivers integrated bridge systems for warships, integrated dived navigation systems for submarines, and C2 systems for small craft. Presently, 23 navies totaling more than 600 warships and submarines operate using OSI systems.

Due to the nature of our company, all employees must pass specific security criteria. Only candidates who are Canadian citizens, have PR status or have a citizenship from a NATO country, and who satisfy security clearance criteria, will be considered.

Why OSI?

We have a Professional Development program in place that supports our employees in their career development by providing funds, time, and opportunities to become better at what they do.

At OSI you can make a difference. We are a change willing organization that is always looking for new ideas. We strive to improve what it is we do and how we do it. If you have ideas we would love to hear about them.

OSI fosters an inclusive and diverse culture. We celebrate our diversity and strive to be more inclusive because it makes us a better company.

We also offer great benefits: 
  • Extended healthcare 
  • Dental care
  • Group Retirement Savings Plan
  • Emergency Travel Assistance
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program

title: Mold Assembler - Repairs
description:
If youâ€™re looking to build a career with a successful, growing organization where youâ€™ll be invested in; a leader in the injection mold industry that creates products you touch on a daily basis; a team of passionate people, some with 20, 30 and 40 years of service, who want to see you succeedâ€¦then look at StackTeck Systems Ltd. 

The position of Mold Assembler is responsible for the assembly/disassembly of injection molds and components within the molds, to repair and test based on customer requirements.  This position will report into the Supervisor, Repair Department at the Teck Center.

 

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Disassemble and clean molds to evaluate repairs necessary
  • Troubleshoot components and document needed repairs
  • Utilize a variety of measuring instruments such as micrometers, calipers, etc.
  • Works to close tolerances on all assigned work projects
  • Use various hand/power tools to complete assembly/disassembly functions
  • Read, interpret and follow basic diagrams, or engineering drawings, and other written instructions or procedures to accurately assemble component
  • Performs general housekeeping duties of work area and shop floor.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

TECHNICAL SKILLS / EXPERIENCE

  • Post-Secondary education in a Mechanical discipline, but not necessary
  • 2-3 years of mechanical assembly experience is required
  • Ability to use measuring instruments
  • Knowledge of Plastic Injection Molds preferred

CORE COMPETENCIES

  • Decision Making: Utilizing effective process to make decisions on own.
  • Teamwork: Working effectively with others
  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem solving aptitude
  • Attention to detail: Making sure things are done right the first time
  • Interpersonal Skills: Effectively communicating, building rapport and relating well to people.
  • Self Motivated: Ability to work alone with minimal supervision and/or direction

 

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, (AODA), StackTeck will provide accommodation, accessible formats, and communication supports for the recruitment process upon request.

We thank all who apply and will respond to those who most closely match the requirements.

title: Assembly Technician
description:
Assembly Technician (Richmond)
At Dynamix Agitators, we specialize in engineering and manufacturing agitators and mixers for industrial process markets worldwide. Our customers include some of the world's leading energy and natural resource companies, as well as some of the largest chemical manufacturing companies. Due to continual growth, we are in need of a dynamic and outgoing individual to join our Production Team in the role of an Assembly Technician.

About the job:
  • Hands-on assembly of mixers, comprising electric motors, shafts, and other components while using basic tools and machinery.
  • Attention to detail in following Quality Control measures related to the assembly of components is essential.
  • Our facilities are organized and clean, and the staff is supportive.
  • The office hours are 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 pm Monday - Friday with 1 hour for a lunch break.
About you:
  • A good mechanical aptitude.
  • You have strong attention to detail relating to hands-on assembly processes.
  • A good understanding of basic quality control requirements.
  • Able to continually produce a quality assembly.
  • Experience in a fast-paced manufacturing or assembly-related environment.
  • Physically fit and able to handle some minor lifting while assembling components.
  • Committed to working safely at all times.
  • Good verbal and written English communication skills
  • Reliable team player with good customer service abilities.
Nice To Have:
  • Shipping/Receiving experience.
  • Forklift operator certificate.
  • Basic proficiency in Microsoft Office.

We recognize that our employees are the cornerstone of our accomplishments and we pride ourselves on being people of passion and integrity. We've created a collaborative work environment with growth opportunities. While high-quality standards are our priority, we do recognize the importance of a healthy work/life balance. Dynamix Agitators offers attractive compensation and benefits, on-the-job training, and a welcoming work environment. If this sounds like you and you match most of our requirements, we would love to hear from you! Please send your resume and cover letter explaining why you want to join our team.

Note: Office is not easily accessible by Transit.

To read more about us please visitwww.dynamixinc.com.

title: Production Assembler/Technician (Full time)
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

 

Lonza in Kingston, Ontario is actively seeking a Production Assembler/Technician to help with the assembly and testing of cutting edge technology such as the Cocoon® Platform. The responsibilities include: removing parts from inventory, inspecting parts for quality, prepare required tools, fixtures and test equipment, assemble product, test for performance, and package. Measurements, assembly, record keeping among other activities, will require your continued precision, focus and care.

We are looking for individuals who enjoy the manufacturing/production environment and being hands-on.

**Competitive Hourly Pay** Full time and contingent positions available

 

Key responsibilities:

  • Working hygienically in a controlled environment

  • Maintaining accurate documentation and record keeping

  • Work within a self-directed team environment

  • Precision in: Measurements, Assembly, Testing (as per protocols), Record Keeping, Hygiene, Health & Safety  

Key requirements:

  • Must have High School Diploma or equivalent

  • Ability to read technical documentation

  • Ability to use tools, fixtures, and test equipment

  • Working experience in a manufacturing/operations/production role

  • Must enjoy the manufacturing environment and being hands-on

  • Computer skills, MS Office

  • Company Quality System Training

  • Company specified health and safety training

 

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

 

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

 

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: General Labour/Assembler
description:
General Labour/Assembler

Bolton, ON, Canada Req #4252

Wednesday, February 23, 2022

$2,500 sign-on bonus!

$100 bonus for all fully vaccinated new hires!

Morgan Truck Body, the largest truck body manufacturer in North America, has opportunities for General Labourers/Assemblers!

We promote almost 100% of our production leaders from within. Most start their leadership career in this general labourer/assembler role. Your first promotion can occur between your 6th and 12th month of employment.

Our generous benefits include paid vacation and holidays, Medical, Dental, Vision, group pension, and 80% tuition reimbursement as well as many others!

Job Description

The General Labourer/Assembler is responsible for building and assembly of a multitude of pieces as well as completed truck bodies.

You will receive on the job training for:

  • Basic math, tape measurement, and computer skills
  • Working with hand and power tools
  • Reading and interpreting blueprints
Job Duties
  • Read and interpret: orders and specifications, blueprints, instructions and labels which may contain hazardous warnings and cautions
  • Cut wood or metals to specific sizes using a variety of saws, sheers and cutters
  • Fasten parts together with bolts, screws, speed clips, rivets or fasteners
  • Operate pneumatic tools and hand tools
  • Perform set up of machine and preventative maintenance as required
  • Examine finished project for quality and defects
  • Perform safety and quality checks
  • Work and adhere to all safety policies
Minimum Qualifications
  • Must be 18 years old
Preferred Qualifications (not required)
  • Previous experience in manufacturing
  • Previous experience working on truck bodies
  • Construction experience is a plus
  • High School Diploma or equivalent GED
Physical Requirements:

This job operates in a manufacturing plant environment. While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to talk or hear. The team member frequently is required to stand (sometimes for extended periods); walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms, and lift up to 35 pounds. The team member may, at times, sit, bend, stoop, squat, reach overhead, or crawl (may be in confined spaces). The team member is expected to perform repetitive tasks using their hands, and have the ability to climb ladders and/or work in high places.

J.B. Poindexter & Co., Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or municipal laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

#LI-TK1
Other details

  • Job Family Morgan Truck Body
  • Job Function Manufacturing
  • Pay Type Hourly
  • Employment Indicator Hourly

title: Technicien de production
description:
Technicien de productionFaites progresser votre carrière chez ABB avec une équipe mondiale qui alimente la transformation de la société et de l'industrie afin de bâtir un avenir plus productif et durable.Chez ABB, nous avons l'objectif précis de favoriser la diversité et l'inclusion dans tous ses aspects : genres, LGBTQ+, facultés, ethnicités, générations, etc. Ensemble, nous entreprenons un parcours où chacun d'entre nous, respecte et célèbre les différences individuelles

Le segment d'affaires Mesure et analyse développe, fabrique, vend, livre et assure la maintenance de produits et de solutions afin de permettre aux clients des secteurs industriels et de l'énergie de renforcer l'efficacité et la rentabilité de leurs opérations. Nous sommes déterminés à servir nos clients en leur offrant les meilleures solutions numériques pour répondre à leurs besoins rapidement et de façon fiable, tout en mettant à leur disposition un réseau de services mondial.Basé à la ville de Québec et relevant du superviseur de production, le journalier de production soutient l'unité d'affaire dans la réalisation des objectifs de production fixés en adhérant aux systèmes et processus. L'unité d'affaire produit des analyseurs de produits chimiques qui visent différents marchés.
Vos responsabilités

  • Effectuer l'assemblage optique, mécanique et électroniques de nos analyseurs.
  • Effectuer le contrôle qualité de ces mêmes analyseurs.
  • Réaliser les tests finaux en s'assurant de rencontrer le standard de qualité.
  • Respecter les processus en place.
  • Résoudre les probématiques rencontrer lors de l'assemblage et des tests.
  • Être en accord avec les valeurs fondamentales de sécurité et d'intégrité d'ABB, c'est-à-dire assumer la responsabilité de vos propres actes, tout en prenant soin de vos collègues et de l'entreprise.

Votre parcours professionnel
  • Un diplôme de formation professionnel dans les domaines suivants ; Électromécanique de systèmes automatisés, Mécanique de machines fixes, Soudage-montage et Fabrication de structures métalliques et de métaux ouvrés, Soudage-montage.
  • Dîplome d'étude collégial en physique, électronique ou dans un domaine approprié est considéré comme un atout.
  • Un diplôme d'études secondaire jumelé à de l'expérience pertinente sera aussi considéré.
  • Avoir une grande capacité d'apprentissage et un sens de l'analyse aiguisé.
  • Faire preuve d'un haut niveau d'autonomie, de responsabilité et de polyvalence.
  • Allier haut niveau de qualité et efficacité.
  • Être minutieux et habile manuellement.

Benefits
  • Plan retraite
  • Mutuelle d'entreprise
  • Programme bien-être
En savoir plus sur nous
Figurant sur la liste des 15 meilleurs employeurs au Canada de Forbes 2020, ABB valorise à sa juste valeur le dévouement, l'engagement et l'expertise de ses employés. À titre d'employeur soucieux de l'équité en matière d'emploi, ABB croit en un effectif inclusif et diversifié. Notre engagement est de veiller à ce que l'ensemble des politiques et des pratiques respectent l'esprit du Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, et nous visons à ce que notre effectif soit véritablement représentatif des quatre groupes désignés, notamment les femmes, les Autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB offrira des aménagements raisonnables aux candidats présentant un handicap, et les encourage à s'identifier comme tels lors du processus de candidature.Au sens de la présente offre, le masculin est utilisé comme genre neutre dans le seul but d'alléger le texte.

title: Assembly Leadhand
description:
Recognized as one of Canada's 50 Best Managed Companies, Brandt provides top quality products to its customers worldwide. As a result of continued growth, we are currently seeking an Assembly Leadhand for our Regina location.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Help with the set up and improvements of the work cells to help with work flow
  • Organize and prepare work to meet the demands of the schedule
  • Assembling when needed
  • Ensure that all work cells are clean and free from debris and clutter so that the shop is tour ready at all times
  • Train and assist assemblers to improve quality and efficiencies
  • Ensure that all safety procedures are followed and adhered to
  • Inspect parts for quality and help employees to achieve top quality product
  • Spot check on parts to ensure a clean finish to products
  • Read and understand processes sheets, all drawings and set up instructions
  • Maintain the tool boards and their inventory
  • Support foreman as required
  • Responsible for accurately filling out process sheets and accurately counting number of pieces completed
  • Reports all damaged goods and or scrap to supervisor
  • Knows material sizes and specifications of product being worked on
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • Must be able to perform all assembly functions at an acceptable standard level
  • Must be able to read and understand shop drawings
  • Must be knowledgeable in the use and operation of all hand power tools
  • Must be able to understand and carry out written and verbal instructions
  • Has some knowledge of settings and operation of oxygen acetylene cutting torch, arc welder and mig welder
  • Must be able to understand and carry out written and verbal instructions
  • Has some knowledge of proper maintenance of equipment under this classification
  • Must be capable of working under minimum amount of supervision
  • Able to effectively communicate in both technical and user-friendly language when appropriate, with all types of staff, including technical, professional, and upper management
  • Able to build and maintain lasting relationships with business units, corporate departments, key managers, and other stakeholders
  • Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines
  • Must have excellent attention to detail.

title: Production Assembler
description:
Working in production, you will be part of the manufacturing group that assembles our products. 

Responsibilities:

  • Printed circuit board, chassis and cable assembly
  • Read assembly drawings
  • Other duties as required

Qualifications:

  • Experience with electronic components in an electronic manufacturing environment would be an asset
  • Hand soldering experience would be an asset
  • Strong attention to detail is required
  • High School Diploma

What we offer:

  • Employer funded benefits program
  • Competitive total compensation package
  • Work-life balance
  • Employee Assistance plan
  • Employee Discount Platform
  • Career progression
  • Casual work environment
  • Social events and sports teams

About Us:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery.

Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertzâ€™ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers.

With over 1700 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz!

title: Assembly Operators - Day shift
description:
Based in Alexandria, Ontario, KP Building Products - Windows Division is a high-quality window and patio door manufacturer that has been a member of the Kaycan family since 2014. We foster a strong and lasting employment relationship, enhanced by the strength of the group to which we belong.

We are currently seeking Assembly Operators to complete our day shift team.

Shift : Day - Monday to Friday 7am - 3pm

We offer :

  • Salary : 15$/hr
  • Flexible group insurance program
  • Pension plan
  • Work boot allowance
  • Opportunity for growth and development

Duties:

  • Handle power tools and small hand tool
  • Operate machines and equipment
  • Assemble material and parts
  • Inspect manufactured products for defects and conformance to specifications
  • Reroute defective products

Requirements :

  • No experience required - Full training will be provided
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment

While we appreciate all expressed interest in joining our team, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Assembler
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a Assembler at our 352 Arvin Ave. location.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the Assembler is responsible for performing a variety of production tasks, including but not limited to: assembly, training, inspecting, problem solving, machine operator as well as communicating manpower and scheduling issues with supervision. Employees will be responsible for adhering to the policies and procedures outlined in the IATF Quality System and practice continuous improvement wherever possible.

Responsibilities:

  • Assemble customer supplied automotive parts to meet specified quality standards.
  • Record daily production ensuring accuracy and submit to Supervisor.
  • Handle product properly at all times, and assemble according to specifications.
  • Ensure that materials or equipment required be kept in a clean manner before and after shifts and report any maintenance issues to Supervisor.
  • Conduct a final inspection before customer product is packed and/or labeled.
  • Handle product properly at all times and package according to specifications.
  • Ensure that work area is clean and orderly throughout and after the shift.
  • Comply with company work and safety rules at all times and report all accidents, incidents and potential hazards immediately.
  • Participate in corrective/preventative action when required.
  • Practice continuous improvement; identify processes or procedures that will result in production of non-conforming product, or identifying any processes or procedures that can be improved and result in better company performance.
  • Adhere to all procedures and policies as outlined.
  • Perform duties assigned from time to time by supervisor.

Qualifications:

  • Grade 12 or equivalent preferred.
  • Experience in manufacturing environment is preferred.
  • Effective communication skills, verbal, and written
  • Interpret technical drawings and specifications
  • Ability to work rotating shifts, 1 week day shift (6:00am-3:00pm) and 1 week afternoon shift (3:30pm-12:15PM)

Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources at

hr@tiercon.com

.

title: SMT (Surface Mount Technician) Afternoon Shift
description:
As a member of the SMT Department, you will be part of the manufacturing group that assembles our products.

About Evertz:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery.

Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertzâ€™ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers.

With over 1700 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz!

title: Assembleur / Assembleuse (SOIR)
description:
Boni de rétention après 1 an - 2000$

500$ -  payable après 6 mois travaillés

1 500$ - payable après 1 an travaillé

Travaille 36h - Payé 40h

Souper, fait sur place, inclus

 

SOMMAIRE DU POSTE

En tant qu’assembleur/assembleuse, vous devrez effectuer le montage, l’ajustement et l’installation des panneaux et de certaines composantes de l’unité de ventilation.

 

PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS

  • Assembler, ajuster et installer les panneaux extérieurs et le plancher sur la structure;
  • Installer les panneaux et les composantes à l'intérieur de l'unité;
  • Préparer la structure en fonction du type de panneau à installer;
  • Sceller les panneaux et certaines composantes pour en assurer l'étanchéité;
  • Lire et interpréter les plans;
  • Effectuer toute autre tâche à la demande de son supérieur immédiat.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUISES

  • Connaissance des unités de mesure (métrique et impérial);
  • Habileté à utiliser différents outils (manuels, pneumatiques et électriques);
  • Bonne condition physique;
  • Dextérité manuelle;
  • Aisance en hauteur (Maximum de 12 pieds).

AVANTAGES

  • Assurance collective
  • REER
  • Bonus de rétention après 1 an 2000$
  • Vêtements fournis
  • Congés personnels
  • Cafétéria hors du commun (repas à moindre coût)
  • Programme d’aide aux employés
  • Club social
  • Environnement de travail ultra propre, vitré et usine climatisée
  • Prime pour référence d’employés
  • Travaille 36h payé 40h
  • Prime de soir
  • Souper, fait sur place, chaud et santé inclus

title: Production Specialist Electronics Assembly Line
description: The client is seeking an Electronics skilled Technician to augment our production capabilities. This individual will be required to use network and spectrum analyzers,perform electronic component assembly, have soldering skills and complete some hands-on mechanicalassembly. This ideal person will be PC literate and willing to work in a start-up environment that is trying to mature rapidly. While this is an entry level position, it has the potential for the right individual to progress in the company. We are willing to discuss both full time and contract arrangements.

title: Opérateur de marchine, montage en surface (SMT), carte de circuits imprimés
description:
Opérateur de marchine, montage en surface (SMT), carte de circuits imprimésFaites progresser votre carrière chez ABB avec une équipe mondiale qui alimente la transformation de la société et de l'industrie afin de bâtir un avenir plus productif et durable.Chez ABB, nous avons l'objectif précis de favoriser la diversité et l'inclusion dans tous ses aspects : genres, LGBTQ+, facultés, ethnicités, générations, etc. Ensemble, nous entreprenons un parcours où chacun d'entre nous, respecte et célèbre les différences individuelles

Le segment d'affaires Bâtiments intelligents transforme les bâtiments commerciaux, industriels et résidentiels de manière numérique afin d'en optimiser le confort, l'efficacité, la sûreté et la sécurité, et ainsi améliorer la qualité de vie dans les bâtiments de l'avenir grâce à des solutions, des services et des produits d'électrification sûrs, intelligents et durables.En travaillant chez ABB, vous aurez accès à un programme complet d'avantages sociaux, à un régime d'épargne-retraite collectif, ainsi qu'à des possibilités d'avancement au sein de l'entreprise.
Vos responsabilités

  • Opérer et surveiller une machine automatisée pour l'installation de composants électroniques de technologie montage en surface (SMT).
  • Ajuster et mettre en route l'équipement d'impression pour l'application de pâte à souder pour la technologie de montage en surface.
  • Charger, repérer et positionner les chargeurs (feeders) pour alimenter la machine selon le programme sélectionné.
  • Alimenter la machine en cartes de circuits imprimés, surveiller leurs passages lors de la production et nterpréter les non-conformités et initier les actions correctives appropriées.
  • Détecter les dysfonctionnements relatifs aux produits, aux outils de production, initier les actions correctives appropriées et effectuer la maintenance de base.
  • Appliquer les procédures et politiques en matière de qualité et de santé, sécurité et environnement et participer aux diverses activités qui en découlent.
  • Effectuer toute autre tâche connexe.

Votre parcours professionnel
  • Diplôme d'études secondaires.
  • Capacité à lire et interpréter un dessin technique et capacité à lire la sérigraphie sur une carte de circuits imprimés.
  • Connaissance et application des normes d'acceptabilité en vigueur.
  • Connaissance de base des composants électroniques, y compris l'orientation, la polarisation et les valeurs des composants.
  • Connaissance des matières et produits utilisés et capacité à les sélectionner selon le procédé (RoHS ou non).
  • Connaissance de base en décharge électrostatique (ESD)
  • Connaissance de la norme IPC-A-610, un atout.
  • Maîtriser le français et/ou l'anglais, parlé et écrit.

Benefits
  • Plan retraite
  • Mutuelle d'entreprise
  • Programme bien-être
En savoir plus sur nous
Figurant sur la liste des 15 meilleurs employeurs au Canada de Forbes 2020, ABB valorise à sa juste valeur le dévouement, l'engagement et l'expertise de ses employés. À titre d'employeur soucieux de l'équité en matière d'emploi, ABB croit en un effectif inclusif et diversifié. Notre engagement est de veiller à ce que l'ensemble des politiques et des pratiques respectent l'esprit du Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, et nous visons à ce que notre effectif soit véritablement représentatif des quatre groupes désignés, notamment les femmes, les Autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB offrira des aménagements raisonnables aux candidats présentant un handicap, et les encourage à s'identifier comme tels lors du processus de candidature.Au sens de la présente offre, le masculin est utilisé comme genre neutre dans le seul but d'alléger le texte.

title: Operator/Sub-Assembler
description:
Are you able to work in a fast-paced environment? Would you like to learn how to operate a variety of machines and be cross-trained in different tasks? Do you want to have a career in Manufacturing?  Do you have attention to detail, multitasking and the ability to be cross-trained and work with a variety of jobs?

If your response is yes, please keep reading!

About Metalumen

Metalumen is a family-owned company located in Guelph that has been designing, engineering, and manufacturing lighting solutions since 1977. Our products are customized and up to 97% system recyclable. We are committed to a culture based on communication, collaboration, product excellence, on-time delivery, and customer and agent satisfaction.

By applying for this position, you may have the chance to work as part of our family. We are constantly improving our processes to provide the best for our employees. We understand that our customers' satisfaction is the reflection of our employees' happiness.

About the Position

The  Operator/Assembler will report to the Team Lead and is responsible for operating machines-  and assembling parts, according to production needs.

Main Duties

  •  Setup and operate Weld stud /spot welder machine
  • Read, understand and interpret drawings and blueprints and work according to the prints
  • Follow all routing on job travellers
  • Set up and operate robots, machines, jig
  • Participate in first offs, supporting the Lead Hand and Team Lead to properly establish processes and ensuring time studying is done.
  • Measure and suggest new processes to Sub-Assembly and Painting Department
  • Fasten parts according to the Bill of Material and drawings. Follow the Team Lead's orientations
  • Load and Unload and operate paint line
  • Maintain the workplace clean and organized
  • Ensure the projects are being delivered on time and with the expected quality
  • Other duties as per Team Lead and Production Manager requirements

Requirements

  • 1 year of experience in a manufacturing environment
  • Secondary school
  • Setup and operate Weld stud /spot welder machine
  • Understand Diagrams and the use of different hand and measure tools
  • Ability to lift up to 30 pounds
  • Willing to train other employees
  • Willing to work in a team
  • Sense of urgency and ability to work with limited supervision  
  • Attention to detail, excellent attendance, multitask, organization, ability to deal with conflict, and math skills

Benefits

  • Health and Dental after probationary period – 3 months
  • Pension Plan after one year of employment

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code, Metalumen is committed to providing inclusive and barrier-free recruitment and selection process. Please notify Human Resources of any accommodations you may require.

title: Assembler - Breaker Shop
description:
Assembler - Breaker ShopTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB's Distribution Solutions Division provides utility, industrial and commercial customers with safe, smart and sustainable technologies for the distribution of electricity. With ABB AbilityTM enabled digital solutions at its core, our extensive portfolio includes distribution automation products, switching, limiting, measuring and sensing devices, switchgear, modular substation packages, and related services.
Your responsibilities

  • Assembly : Conducts all types of disassembly and assembly work to produce a repaired, refurbished or upgraded product, including the packing where integrated with production lines. Work is typically done manually or by using light hand tools.
  • Quality : Perform duties in a manner compliant with prevailing quality procedures and policies . The job may include regular quality testing as part of a defined production process.
  • Continuous improvement : Suggest and support the implementation of improvement ideas.
  • Health & safety : Conducts shop floor operation in compliance with health & safety guidelines and reports any non-compliance.
  • Organization : Operates within standard operating procedures and maintains a clean work area. Perform other related duties as assigned by Team lead or management.
  • Inventory : Involvement with cycle inventory counts when needed.
  • Housekeeping : Maintain a clean and safe workplace in accordance with 6S protocol

Your background
  • Diploma in Electromechanical technology or similar background is an asset
  • 4-7 years' experience in MV circuit breakers service or manufacturing. Alternatively, a special combination of education and experience and/or demonstrated accomplishments
  • Knowledge of electrical and mechanical operation of modern and legacy breakers is an asset.
  • Thorough knowledge of assembly techniques, tools, materials, machines, and equipment.
  • Read and interpret engineering configuration and wiring drawings.
  • Works from engineering drawings, rough sketches, manuals or verbal instructions.
  • Read, interpret, and follow electrical drawings, understand the use of and is able to use electrical test equipment with minimal supervision.
  • Good oral and written communication skills
  • Good knowledge and use of MS office
  • Able to do repetitive work
  • Able to lift 40 lbs
  • Stand or sit for extended periods of time

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

As a result of continued growth and expansion we are currently seeking Assemblers, Welders, Fitters, Machinists, Machine Operators, Powder Painters, Production Planners, Material Handlers, Kitting Technicians, Labourers, Lead Hands and many more for our manufacturing facilities located in Regina and Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

Take your place in a strong stable company that offers long term employment and a comprehensive benefit program. title: Production Assembler I
description:
WORK LOCATION: 7371 Vantage Way Delta BC, V4G 1C9

WORKING HOURS: 6:30AM to 3:00PM Monday thru Thursday and 6:30AM to 2:10PM
 
QUALIFICATIONS:
Academic: Grade 12 diploma preferred. Courses in mechanical/electrical technology an asset. 

Work Experience: Minimum three years mechanical/electrical assembly and/or metal fabrication experience or equivalent required. Experience in use of pneumatic tools an asset. Forklift certification is required. 

Skills/Other: Ability to read blueprints, competence in mathematics, ability to lift 25 lbs, strong time management skills and ability to change priorities as required. Must have own tools.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Grinding, cleaning, pressure washing parts.
  • Parts assembly (mechanical, hydraulic, electrical) under supervision.
  • Pallet/ crate building.
  • Crating and packaging for shipping.
  • Keep an accurate record of time charged to each job.
  • General shop maintenance and participation in weekly shop cleanup. 
  • Full comprehension of safety requirements.
  • Participates in quality assurance.
  • Other duties as assigned.

EMAIL: careers@hillmar.com

title: Electrical Assembler
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

  • Complete electrical assembly as per engineering’s specifications and standards;
  • Proceed with the installation of the manufactured equipment’s control and distribution panels electrical components;
  • Proceed with interconnections between motor sensors and control panels;
  • Detect and communicate corrections to the engineering team;
  • Weld electrical components when required;
  • Actively participate to the equipment star-up and calibration using measuring tools;
  • Participate to weekly production meetings.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  •  College or professional diploma in automated systems electro-mechanic or college certification in troubleshooting and maintenance of industrial systems;
  • 2-3 years’ experience in assembly of industrial machinery electrical components and wiring;
  • Mastering measuring tools such as a multimeter;
  • Able to read and interpret electrical plans;
  • Knowledge of industrial programmable controllers such as Bradley and Siemens;
  • Experience in welding electrical components, an asset
  • French as a working language, English an asset.
  • High quality standards;

    NJM offers a signing bonus for this position

    BENEFITS:

    As a Pro Mach employee, you receive more than just a paycheck. Total compensation includes your pay (hourly rate), very comprehensive medical/dental programs as well as life insurance, a pension plan and a generous paid time off program. 

    Due to the high volume of incoming resumes, only candidates chosen for interview will be contacted. Pro Mach is committed to providing an accessible workspace. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment process please notify the Company.

    ABOUT NJM

    The world’s proven, trusted, single-source provider of automated packaging machinery for pharmaceutical, nutraceutical, and personal care products, NJM offers both stand-alone solutions and integrated systems for packagers of solid dose and liquid pharmaceuticals, biopharmaceuticals, vitamins, and food supplements. As part of the ProMach Pharma business line, NJM helps our customers protect and grow the reputation and trust of their consumers. ProMach is a family of best-in-class packaging solution brands serving manufacturers of all sizes and geographies in the food, beverage, pharmaceutical, personal care, and household and industrial goods industries. ProMach brands operate across the entire packaging spectrum: filling and capping, flexibles, pharma, product handling, labeling and coding, and end of line. ProMach is headquartered near Cincinnati, Ohio, with manufacturing facilities and offices throughout North America, Europe, South America, and Asia. For more information about ProMach, visit http://www.ProMachBuilt.com and for more information on ProMach Careers, visit http://www.ProMachCareers.com.

    PMCA01

    Experience

    Preferred
    • 2 - 3 years: experience in assembly of industrial machinery electrical components and wiring

    Skills

    Preferred
    • Blueprint Reading
    See job description

title: Journalier assembleur
description:
** PRIME D'EMBAUCHE DE 1 500$**

Tu es à la recherche d'un emploi dans le secteur du métal, acier et aluminium et tu aimerais rejoindre une équipe jeune et dynamique avec possibilités d'avancement ?

Nous sommes à la recherche d'un journalier assembleur de jour à St-Bruno de Montavrille sur la Rive-Sud de Montréal.

Le poste de journalier assembleur est un poste permanent avant plusieurs avantages et un salaire compétitif entre 24 et 26$/h !

Appelle-nous sans tarder et envoie-nous ton CV !

marie-christine.beland@randstad.ca
450 463-4114

Avantages
Voici les avanatges concernant le poste de journalier assembleur à St-Bruno :

-- Prime d’embauche de 1500$ !!
- Poste permanent
- Salaire compétitif entre 24 et 26$/heure
- Équipe jeune et dynamique
- Possibilité d'avancement
- Horaire flexible de jour entrée entre 6h30 et 8h00 pm selon ton choix
- Possibilité de temps supplémentaire
- Assurances payées à 50% par l'employeur
- 2 semaines de vacances dès l'embauche

Responsabilités
Voici les tâches pour le postes de journalier asembleur à St-Bruno :

- Placer et ajyuster les matrices sur les outils de formage
- Placer les pièces chauffées ou non, sur la matrice de presse ou autre outil de forage
- Conduire des presses ou autres machines à forger à chaud ou à froid pour façconner le métal
- Vérifier les produits pour s'assurer de leur conformité quant à leur forme, dimensions
- Effectuer des travaux de menuiserie reliés aux caisses de bois, utilisation de la scie, couleuse et traqueuse
- Couper du bois avec la scie circulaire fixe en respectant les dimensions demandées
- Faire le suivi des travaux auprès du superviseur


Qualifications
Voici les qualifications demandées pour le poste de journalier assembleur à St-Bruno :

- DES complété ou l'équivalent
- 1 à 2 ans d'expérience en travail manuel
- Formation en ferblanterie ou tôlerie un atout
- Minutieux souci du détail
- Conduite d'un chariot élévateur un atout



Sommaire
Ce poste t'intéresse? Appelle-nous sans tarder !

Marie-Christine ou Roxanne au 450-463-4114 ou envoi ton CV à marie-christine.beland@randstad.ca.

N'oublie pas de m'ajouter sur Facebook pour rester à l'affût de nos nouvelles offres d'emplois !

https://www.facebook.com/randstadlongueuil5029/

Connaissez-vous des gens à la recherche d’un emploi? Dites-leur de nous appeler!
Pour chaque personne que vous nous référerez et que nous emploierons durant au moins
4 semaines consécutives ou que nous embaucherons pour un poste permanent, nous vous donnerons 100$. Facile, non?
Appelez-nous aujourd’hui pour plus de détails au 450.463.4114
*Assurez-vous que la personne référée mentionne votre nom durant l’appel.

Le marché de l’emploi d'aujourd’hui regorge de défis. Chez Randstad Canada, nous nous engageons à vous aider à relever ces défis et à trouver les perspectives de carrière les plus prometteuses. Nous pouvons vous aider à faire vos recherches, à présenter votre candidature, à vous préparer à l’entrevue et à décrocher l’emploi qui vous convient.

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Electrical Assembler
description:
Amazing job opportunity!!!

Are you looking for a full-time ELECTRICAL ASSEMBLER job in Brampton? Do you want to get an opportunity to be hired by the company in a few months?

Our client in Brampton is looking for reliable, punctual ELECTRICAL ASSEMBLERS for day and afternoon shifts. This is a full-timE long-term assignment with the possibility of getting hired by the client. We have day and afternoon shifts available.

**MUST HAVE ELECTRICAL ASSEMBLER EXPERIENCE OF 1 YEAR**

**MUST BE AVAILABLE TO BE HIRED BY THE CLIENT IN A FEW MONTHS**

**MUST BE COMFORTABLE WORKING WITH ELECTRICAL WIRES AND PANELS FOR SETUPS**


Read details and APPLY NOW!!!

Advantages
- Regular day shifts of Monday to Friday
- Location is Steeles Ave and Dixie Rd
- Bus accessible location
- Day shift - 7 am to 3:30 pm
- Afternoon shift - 3 pm to 11:30 pm
- Competitive pay rate of $21-22 per hour
- Overtime available based on operations
- A close-knit team with friendly staff members
- All Covid-19 protocols are in place
- Reputable company

Responsibilities
- Follow electrical drawings and schematics as well as assembly instruction sheets, or receives verbal instructions regarding duties to be performed
- Use equipment and hand and power tools to accomplish assembly tasks
- Plan and layout assembly sequence and procedures for specified parts
- Assemble components and subassemblies
- Practice safe and proper electrical procedures
- Report all electrical or design errors to a supervisor so that the problems can be addressed
- Maintain good work habits and demonstrate good work ethic
- Perform other duties or temporary jobs as may be assigned due to changing workloads and manpower requirements
- Perform inspections of assemblies and subassemblies during the building of the machines, and a complete inspection of the machines prior to commissioning
- Establish a safe working environment by following the companies guidelines with regard to the safe use of lockout procedures and proper start-up procedures


Qualifications
- At least 1 YEAR OF ELECTRICAL ASSEMBLY EXPERIENCE
- Warehouse experience is necessary
- Must be able to pass the forklift test to start the job
- Good attendance
- Good communication skills

Summary
If you're interested then APPLY NOW by call or email

CALL US at: 905-799-9972

Speak with Vikramjit or Ali or Avery

EMAIL: vikramjit.bansal@randstad.ca OR ali.wasti@randstad.ca OR avery.salmon@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle.
