accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Production Technician in Bradford Ontario
description:
Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?
Maple Leaf Foods is Canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in Toronto, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf®, Maple Leaf Prime®, Maple Leaf Natural Selections®, Schneiders®, Schneiders Country Naturals® and Mina™. Our Company employs approximately 11,500 people in its operations across Canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the U.S. and Asia.
 
Our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. As we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people.

Maple Leaf Foods Bradford Plant is Hiring!
 
Production Technician: The Production Technician plays an important role at Maple Leaf Foods’ poultry facility. They work in a fast-paced food manufacturing environment and are responsible for helping ensure smooth production operations. The Production Technician supports the success of the plant by ensuring equipment is operating well and troubleshooting and repairing equipment when it is not. The Production Technician also provides coaching and guidance so individual team members can increase their own operational and troubleshooting skills. The Production Technician will also assist in the development and execution of corrective actions in response to performance variances.
       
Responsibilities:
  • Acts as a first point of contact to troubleshoot production equipment issues before contacting maintenance
  • Contributes to a healthy and safe work environment, while maintaining high food safety standards
  • Contributes to the team and the whole facility in a positive way
  • Helps the department to meet targets and goals while maintaining a healthy and safe work environment
  • Maintains productivity that meets/exceeds standards
  • Frequent and appropriate communication with Supervisors throughout the shift
  • Awareness and high sense of urgency
  • Champions and upholds department standards as a role model for other employees
  • Takes appropriate actions to correct variances and make improvements
  • Works closely with Maintenance to help operate, troubleshoot, repair and optimize plant equipment
  • Identify areas of opportunity and help take action to correct issues and make improvements both mechanical and process related
  • Help train employees to better operate department equipment
  • Other responsibilities as required
 
Experience/Competencies:
  • Strong interpersonal skills to support supervisors and other team members while maintaining composure in a fast-paced environment
  • Mechanical ability
  • Able to stand and walk throughout the shift, heavy lifting tasks required
  • Punctual, reliable and responsible, can work well in a team environment and support fellow team members
 
WHY Maple Leaf Foods,
•   Training provided where needed
•   Reputable company
•   Competitive Wages
•   Opportunities to participate in Benefits and Pension plans
•   Great team environment
•   Strong focus on internal advancement
•   Employee Assistance Program

If interested apply to our job posting online at https://careers.mapleleaffoods.com/
This posting will remain open until February 12, 2021.


We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.
 
Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. We ensure that our recruitment practices are supportive of this commitment.

title: Production Technician (AM Shift)
description:
About the Company:

Auxly is a leading Canadian cannabis company dedicated to bringing innovative, effective, and high-quality cannabis products to the wellness and adult-use markets. Auxly's experienced team of industry first-movers and enterprising visionaries have secured a diversified supply of raw cannabis, strong clinical, scientific and operating capabilities and leading research and development infrastructure in order to create trusted products and brands in an expanding global market. Learn more at www.auxly.com and stay up to date at Twitter: @AuxlyGroup;â€¯Instagram: @auxlygroup;â€¯Facebook: @auxlygroup; LinkedIn: company/auxlygroup/.â€¯  

Overview:

Reporting to the Manufacturing Manager, the Production Technician will work in and maintain the standards of a cGMP environment, ensure orders are done accurately and in a timely manner,  process component materials into finished products while maintaining high quality standards.

 

The key candidate will be well organized, have an eye for detail, be a team player, and a good communicator.

AM Shift is 8-430 pm

What can you expect to do:
  • Maintaining process batches within specifications to meet department batch execution targets by ensuring optimal run rates in support of schedule adherence.
  • Completing master batch records, and associated production documentation accurately; Providing Material Safety Data (MSD) sheets for all department chemicals and products.
  • Assisting with processing component martials into finished products while ensuring that quality standards are consistent.
  • Dismantling, cleaning, sanitizing, and assembling manufacturing equipment according to established Standard Operating Procedures (SOPâ€™s) to ensure GMP compliance and meet department changeover targets in support of department and productivity goals.
  • Setting up and operating machines on trial runs to verify accuracy process.
  • Ensuring the proper selection, care and use of tools, parts and equipment while performing all role-related tasks.
  • Supporting the implementation of initiatives that drive efficiency and increase product yield.
  • Preparing equipment and extracted oils for packaging, and operating packaging and labelling equipment.
  • Cleaning and maintaining packaging equipment and room facilities.
  • Maintaining strict inventory records of all dry materials, chemicals and equipment used in the clean room facility.
  • Washing and sterilizing formulation vessels used for packaging, storing supplies and equipment, disposal of waste according to guidelines, and keeping clean room, storerooms and working areas immaculate.
  • Performing administrative tasks related to packing activities such as word processing, record keeping and filing.
  • Other related tasks as assigned.
What we are looking for :
  • Post-secondary diploma in science, technology, or operations is strongly preferred
  • Effective time-management skills and ability to multi-task.
  • Reporting and information management experience; must have proficiency in Microsoft Office and experience with process management, team problem solving, and inventory control.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities and evolving deadlines.
  • Experience in production or manufacturing environments in compliance with Current Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP) is strongly preferred.
What will set you apart:
  • Post-secondary diploma in science, technology, or operations is strongly preferred
  • Experience in production or manufacturing environments in compliance with Current Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP) is strongly preferred.
Ã‚  :

Auxly Cannabis Group Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.â€¯  

We provide accommodation for job applicants with disabilities during the recruitment process in accordance with applicable laws. Please contact us to request accommodation.â€¯

title: Assembleur électrique - soir
description:
Tu as soif d’aventure, de nouveaux défis et tu veux avoir du fun au travail? Tu recherches une entreprise qui t’en donne plus?

Ne cherche plus! Nous avons LA place pour toi!

Ce que nous t’offrons :

  • Un salaire compétitif et progressif selon la convention
  • Des assurances collectives payées à 50% et un REER avec contribution de l’employeur dès ta première journée!
  • Prime de rétention de 2000$ après 1 an avec nous
  • Prime de référencement de 1000$ pour chaque personne que tu nous envoies
  • Une ambiance agréable, une équipe expérimentée et disponible pour te soutenir dans ton développement
  • Une usine propre, climatisée et où nous travaillons sur de beaux projets!

Tu as choisi le quart de soir? Voici ce que c’est :

  • C’est du lundi au jeudi de 17h à 3h!
  • Tu as donc un long week-end et tu ne recommences que le lundi soir!
  • Prime de soir de 1,25$

Ce que tu devras accomplir au quotidien…

  • Lire et interpréter les schémas électriques et mécaniques pour déterminer l’emplacement des composantes dans l’unité de ventilation
  • Identifier les fils à l’aide des couleurs prédéterminées sur les plans
  • Installer toutes les composantes nécessaires à la confection d’une unité
  • Percer les trous dans l’unité en fonction des plans
  • Installer le filage dans toutes les composantes de l’unité
  • Monter les différents contrôles: compresseur, brûleur du panneau, les pièces et les collants
  • Brancher le mécanisme de zones, les volets et les servomoteurs s’il y a lieu
  • Faire la vérification visuelle du contrôle électrique
  • Analyser et effectuer des suivis de dossiers de production

Exigences :

  • DEP en électricité, dans un domaine connexe ou une combinaison formation et expérience pertinente
  • Avoir de bonnes aptitudes physiques puisque l'emploi requiert un travail physique en diverses positions
  • Avoir une connaissance du système de mesures impériales
  • De l'expérience en lecture de plans et de documents (un atout)

Nortek Air Solution, c’est quoi ça? C’est une entreprise qui améliore la qualité de vie des gens. Elle fabrique des projets sur mesure pour la clientèle. Des IMMENSES projets. On peut même entrer dedans! Ici, on fait des systèmes d’échangeurs d’air, de chauffage, de ventilation et de climatisation de toutes sortes. On offre des produits et des solutions ÉCOÉNERGÉTIQUES et durables qui surpassent les attentes de nos clients grâce à l’engagement de notre MERVEILLEUSE équipe envers la qualité, l’expérience client et l’excellence opérationnelle. Nos principales valeurs sont l’entrepreneurship, la confiance et l’initiative vers l’action. Nous avons L’INCROYABLE mission de créé un AVENIR MEILLEUR à chaque jour.

title: Production Technician
description:
Interested in joining a cause-driven, customer focused company dedicated to positively impacting the health of animals, people and the planet? Search our job listings below.


 

Position Description:

To produce veterinary biologics according to a defined production schedule following cGMP guidelines and specific outlines of production to meet market demands for Aquaculture products.

Functions, Duties, Task:

  • Adhere to the principles of “Safety first, Quality always”
  • Perform biologics recovery and purifications using process scale TFF unit, columns and chromatography system.
  • Operate and maintain production instruments and equipment, such as  pH Meters, Conductivity meters, spectrophotometer, TFF equipment, Peristaltic pumps , rotary pumps , chromatography systems/
  • Perform column packing using packing skids, integrity testing on various types of filters and process analysis using spectrophotometer
  • Write and review batch records, SOPs, qualification documents for the downstream operations.
  • Purchase raw material/ production items and make required updates in SAP.
  • Comply with safety requirements, cGMP, SOP and manufacturing documentation.
  • Collaborate with other departments involved in GMP manufacturing for planning production, testing and product release in a timely manner resulting in successful completion of projects.
  • Work cross functional with the upstream manufacturing group to provide resources as needed.
  • Perform tasks under minimal supervision, and within tight time lines to meet production schedules.
  • Assist in the maintenance of production equipment in good condition as per manufacturer’s specifications
  • Responsibilities include cleaning and sterilizing items used in  down streaming applications
  • Maintain the cleanliness of the production areas and assist in disinfection procedures as needed

Minimum Qualification (education, experience and/or training, required certifications):

  • Bachelor’s  Degree in a life sciences (e.g. Biochemistry, Chemistry)
  • 1-3 years of pharmaceutical/biological manufacturing experience in GMP environment
  • 1-3 years of experience in purification of biologics using large scale TFF and chromatography.
  • Process knowledge of TFF filtration and chromatography
  • Experience with operating Unicorn software is required.  

Additional Preferences:

  • Intermediate/Expert computer software skills: MS Office (Word, Excel, Power Point), SAP and control systems.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, both communications and written. The candidate in this position must be able to communicate effectively with Management and staff.

Other Information:

  • Must be able to work shift work (12 hour daytime shifts, 3-4 days/week including some weekends) and overtime as required
  • Required to assist in disinfection procedures involving hazardous chemicals requiring the use of a respirator.
  • Must be able to lift, move and maneuver small-medium sized equipment – up to 25lbs.
  • Requires ability to stand for long periods of time
  • Requires frequent ladder or stair climbing
  • Must be able to read, write, understand, and comply with appropriate standard operating procedures.

Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

title: Production Assembler/Technician's (Multiple Openings)
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

 

Lonza in Kingston, Ontario is actively seeking a Production Assembler/Technician to help with the assembly and testing of cutting edge technology such as the Cocoon® Platform. The responsibilities include: removing parts from inventory, inspecting parts for quality, prepare required tools, fixtures and test equipment, assemble product, test for performance, and package. Measurements, assembly, record keeping among other activities, will require your continued precision, focus and care.

We are looking for individuals who enjoy the manufacturing/production environment and being hands-on.

**Competitive Hourly Pay** Full time and contingent positions available

 

Key responsibilities:

  • Working hygienically in a controlled environment

  • Maintaining accurate documentation and record keeping

  • Work within a self-directed team environment

  • Precision in: Measurements, Assembly, Testing (as per protocols), Record Keeping, Hygiene, Health & Safety  

Key requirements:

  • Must have High School Diploma or equivalent

  • Ability to read technical documentation

  • Ability to use tools, fixtures, and test equipment

  • Working experience in a manufacturing/operations/production role

  • Must enjoy the manufacturing environment and being hands-on

  • Computer skills, MS Office

  • Company Quality System Training

  • Company specified health and safety training

 

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

 

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

 

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Assembly Operator - Evening Shift
description:
Based in Alexandria, Ontario, KP Building Products - Windows Division is a high-quality window and patio door manufacturer that has been a member of the Kaycan family since 2014. We foster a strong and lasting employment relationship, enhanced by the strength of the group to which we belong.

We are currently seeking Assembly Operators to complete our day shift and evening shift teams.

Shift : Evening - Monday to Friday - 3pm to 11pm

We offer :

  • Salary : 15$/hr
  • Evening shift premium : 0.45$/hr
  • Flexible group insurance program
  • Pension plan
  • Work boot allowance
  • Opportunity for growth and development

Duties:

  • Handle power tools and small hand tool
  • Operate machines and equipment
  • Assemble material and parts
  • Inspect manufactured products for defects and conformance to specifications
  • Reroute defective products

Requirements : 

  • High school diploma
  • No experience required - Full training will be provided
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to work standing for extended periods
  • Languages: French or English

While we appreciate all expressed interest in joining our team, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertzâ€™ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers.

title: Composite Technician
description:
Established in 1997, Eastside Industrial started out as a coatings business, preparing and painting fiberglass and metal components for local OEMs.

We are a family business committed to developing our team members to grow within our group of companies and develop their skills as much as possible. We enjoy company events whenever possible and are grateful for the wonderful team we have here at Eastside.

Eastside Industrial is committed to diversifying our customer base in class A coatings and composites manufacturing with our expanding our customer base throughout the continent.

Today, Eastside Industrial serves dozens of OEMs across North America with tooling prototyping, assembly, coatings, and composites manufacturing solutions. Eastside Industrial continues to see growth as we expand our operations to accommodate higher scale and more innovative production methods to continue meeting our current and targeted customer needs.

POSITION PURPOSE:
This position will assist in all aspects of the Composite Technician which includes but not limited to prepping tools for gel coat, placing the fiberglass material load after gel coat and closing tooling, and injecting resin into the closed tool. In addition to this, operate machines or equipment or use hand tools to cut glass mat, shape, splice, and fit materials to form into tools. This job is for a reliable, hard-working individual that has a high level of attention to detail, excellent hand-eye coordination with the ability to work independently and efficiently while being focused on Safety and Continuous improvement aspects.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Working in a safe manner and following all safety rules.
  • Ability to wear ½ mask face Respirator while performing specified work tasks.
  • Assist with tool movements and prep/cleaning for the gel coat booth.
  • Select and cut fiberglass mat and press / or lay mat over the gel-coated plug/tool.
  • Utilizing electric and pneumatic tools.
  • Seal / close tools and inject resin into tools at appropriate vacuum and injection volume.
  • Demold (Remove) the cured parts from the tool and clear excessive material from the edge of the tool.
  • Be prepared to lift 25 pounds from time to time in this role
  • Inspect tools to ensure it meets required specifications and identify any defects present
  • Complete assigned work within given timeframe and according to specifications.
  • Keep all work areas including part storage area clean and organized, emptying scrap and garbage containers as necessary.
  • Cleaning and maintaining work tools such as rollers, brushes, grinders, electric tools and other pieces of equipment.
  • Cleaning and maintaining safety equipment such as respirators and dust masks.
  • Maintain all quality standards in accordance with the specifications for each job in order to meet customer requirements.
  • Performs additional duties as deemed necessary.
  • Takes initiative and is a self-starter.
  • Ability to prioritize and handle multiple duties/projects at one time, work independently. with minimal supervision, and resolve conflict in a professional manner.
  • Maintains open communication and a team-oriented work environment with all departments and all levels of personnel.
  • Demonstrates flexibility and professionalism throughout the day.
  • Adhere to all start/end times including break and lunch schedules.
  • Willingness to work in other areas of the facility as required.

QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE / REQUIRED SKILLS:
  • Preferred: High school diploma or GED from an accredited school system or program.
  • Preferred: 6 months of related experience in an industrial manufacturing environment.
  • Possess knowledge of and ability to identify and work with FRP Materials, machining tools / equipment.
  • Ability to follow verbal and written instructions.
  • Comfortable with repetitive tasks.
  • Position requires physical requirements including lifting, pushing/pulling, lifting, bending/stretching, and standing.

BENEFITS:
  • Dental care.
  • Disability insurance.
  • Extended health care.
  • Life insurance.
  • On-site parking.
  • RRSP match.

COVID-19 considerations:
Eastside ensures all protocols are followed for the safety of our employees, their families, and our customers.
  • Personal protective equipment provided or required.
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place.
  • Social distancing guidelines in place.

title: General Labour/Assembler
description:
General Labour/Assembler

Brampton, ON, Canada Req #3993

Wednesday, January 19, 2022

$2,500 sign-on bonus!


$100 bonus for all fully vaccinated new hires!

Morgan Truck Body, the largest truck body manufacturer in North America, has opportunities for General Labourers/Assemblers!

We promote almost 100% of our production leaders from within. Most start their leadership career in this general labourer/assembler role. Your first promotion can occur between your 6th and 12th month of employment.

Our generous benefits include paid vacation and holidays, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k with company match, and 80% tuition reimbursement as well as many others!

Job Description

The General Labourer/Assembler is responsible for building and assembly of a multitude of pieces as well as completed truck bodies.

You will receive on the job training for:

  • Basic math, tape measurement, and computer skills
  • Working with hand and power tools
  • Reading and interpreting blueprints

Job Duties
  • Read and interpret: orders and specifications, blueprints, instructions and labels which may contain hazardous warnings and cautions
  • Cut wood or metals to specific sizes using a variety of saws, sheers and cutters
  • Fasten parts together with bolts, screws, speed clips, rivets or fasteners
  • Operate pneumatic tools and hand tools
  • Perform set up of machine and preventative maintenance as required
  • Examine finished project for quality and defects
  • Perform safety and quality checks
  • Work and adhere to all safety policies
Minimum Qualifications
  • Must be 18 years old
Preferred Qualifications (not required)
  • Previous experience in manufacturing
  • Previous experience working on truck bodies
  • Construction experience is a plus
  • High School Diploma or equivalent GED
Physical Requirements:

This job operates in a manufacturing plant environment. While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to talk or hear. The team member frequently is required to stand (sometimes for extended periods); walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms, and lift up to 35 pounds. The team member may, at times, sit, bend, stoop, squat, reach overhead, or crawl (may be in confined spaces). The team member is expected to perform repetitive tasks using their hands, and have the ability to climb ladders and/or work in high places.

#LI-TK1

J.B. Poindexter & Co., Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Other details

  • Job Family Morgan Truck Body
  • Job Function Manufacturing
  • Pay Type Hourly

title: Production Technician - 3 month contract
description:
The Job

You will be performing detailed electronic and electro-mechanical assembly in sub-assembly or assembly units, as well as bench testing of Integrated Navigation Bridge System components. In building and testing of electro-mechanical assemblies, the incumbent will hold tolerances to blueprint and/or oral and written specifications.
You will also be responsible for performing parts installation, wiring, cable harnessing and hand soldering using standard sequence and also perform repairs to legacy/customer equipment.

The main responsibilities are:
  • Organize and verify components for assembly or installation
  • Assemble sub-assembly and/or final assembly units in a timely fashion
  • Solder wires and assembly of cable connections as required
  • Build and/or test electro-mechanical assemblies to blueprint and/or oral and written specifications
  • Maintain accurate records of all quality, operations and assembly related documentation and procedures
  • Ensure high quality of executed duties on an ongoing basis to support exceptional standards of quality, delivery, compliance and excellence
  • Comply with OSI Maritime Systems established ISO-9001-compliant development guidelines and standards
  • Comply with workplace operational, environmental, health and safety procedure guidelines

You bring

  • 3-5 years’ electro-mechanical experience in detailed soldering
  • Knowledge of hand tools, power tools, fixtures and measuring devices including DVMs
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Word and Microsoft ExcelAttention to detail in ensuring that quality and efficiency standards are met or exceeded
  • Excellent oral and written English communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Adequate close vision and color & depth perception
  • This position may require lifting and moving products of up to 50 lbs
  • May be required to work overtime as needed
  • Some domestic travel may be required from time to time
  • Experience in electro-mechanical assembly, testing along with following schematics, experience working in an ISO 9001 compliant environment would be an asset.

About US

In 1977, OSI introduced the first generation electronic chart system for the maritime market and revolutionized navigation. Over the years we have had many firsts.Today, OSI Maritime Systems is a leading provider of integrated navigation and tactical solutions designed for naval and maritime security operations. Among those solutions, the company develops and delivers integrated bridge systems for warships, integrated dived navigation systems for submarines, and C2 systems for small craft. Presently, 23navies totaling more than 600 warships and submarines operate using OSI systems.

Due to the nature of our company, all employees must pass specific security criteria. Only candidates who are Canadian citizens, have PR status or have a citizenship from a NATO country, and who satisfy security clearance criteria, will be considered.

Why OSI?

We have a Professional Development program in place that supports our employees in their career development by providing funds, time, and opportunities to become better at what they do.

At OSI you can make a difference. We are a change willing organization that is always looking for new ideas. We strive to improve what it is we do and how we do it. If you have ideas we would love to hear about them.

OSI fosters an inclusive and diverse culture. We celebrate our diversity and strive to be more inclusive because it makes us a better company.

We also offer great benefits:
  • Extended healthcare
  • Dental care
  • Group Retirement Savings Plan
  • Emergency Travel Assistance
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program

title: Assembler
description:
AssemblerTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB Smart Buildings (ELSB) digitally transforms commercial, industrial and residential buildings for the highest comfort, efficiency, safety and security - enhancing quality of life in the buildings of the future, through sustainable electrification solutions, services and products. Working at ABB means having access to a complete benefit package, a group pension plan as well as growth opportunities within the company.
Your responsibilities

  • Assemble components in order to make emergency lighting finished goods;
  • Respect quality standards;
  • Apply quality, health, safety and environmental procedures and policies and participate in the various activities that flow from them;
  • Perform other related tasks;
  • Living ABB's core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues, and the business.

Your background
  • Ability to read and follow work instructions;
  • Ability to interpret a work order, parts lists and assembly drawing;
  • Read assembly drawings;
  • Ability to use hand tools, power or compressed air tools;
  • Capacity to work standing up all day;
  • Good dexterity;
  • Meticulousness;
  • Ability to maintain the workflow according to the established objectives;
  • Autonomy and versatility
  • Team spirit
  • French or English, spoken, written and read

Benefits
  • Medical insurance
  • Disability insurance
  • Retirement plan
  • Schooling allowance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

title: Technicien de production
description:
Technicien de productionFaites progresser votre carrière chez ABB avec une équipe mondiale qui alimente la transformation de la société et de l'industrie afin de bâtir un avenir plus productif et durable.Chez ABB, nous avons l'objectif précis de favoriser la diversité et l'inclusion dans tous ses aspects : genres, LGBTQ+, facultés, ethnicités, générations, etc. Ensemble, nous entreprenons un parcours où chacun d'entre nous, respecte et célèbre les différences individuelles

Le segment d'affaires Mesure et analyse développe, fabrique, vend, livre et assure la maintenance de produits et de solutions afin de permettre aux clients des secteurs industriels et de l'énergie de renforcer l'efficacité et la rentabilité de leurs opérations. Nous sommes déterminés à servir nos clients en leur offrant les meilleures solutions numériques pour répondre à leurs besoins rapidement et de façon fiable, tout en mettant à leur disposition un réseau de services mondial.Basé à la ville de Québec et relevant du superviseur de production, le technicien de production soutien l'unité d'affaire dans la réalisation des objectifs de production fixés en adhérant aux systèmes et processus. L'unité d'affaire produit des analyseurs de produits chimiques qui visent différents marchés.
Vos responsabilités

  • Effectuer l'assemblage optique, mécanique et électroniques de nos analyseurs.
  • Effectuer le contrôle qualité de ces mêmes analyseurs.
  • Réaliser les tests finaux en s'assurant de rencontrer le standard de qualité.
  • Respecter les processus en place.
  • Résoudre les probématiques rencontrer lors de l'assemblage et des tests.
  • Être en accord avec les valeurs fondamentales de sécurité et d'intégrité d'ABB, c'est-à-dire assumer la responsabilité de vos propres actes, tout en prenant soin de vos collègues et de l'entreprise.

Votre parcours professionnel
  • Dîplome d'étude collégial en physique, électronique ou dans un domaine approprié.
  • Un diplôme d'études secondaire jumelé à de l'expérience pertinente sera aussi considéré
  • Avoir une grande capacité d'apprentissage et un sens de l'analyse aiguisé.
  • Faire preuve d'un haut niveau d'autonomie, de responsabilité et de polyvalence.

Benefits
  • Plan retraite
  • Mutuelle d'entreprise
  • Programme bien-être
En savoir plus sur nous
Figurant sur la liste des 15 meilleurs employeurs au Canada de Forbes 2020, ABB valorise à sa juste valeur le dévouement, l'engagement et l'expertise de ses employés. À titre d'employeur soucieux de l'équité en matière d'emploi, ABB croit en un effectif inclusif et diversifié. Notre engagement est de veiller à ce que l'ensemble des politiques et des pratiques respectent l'esprit du Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, et nous visons à ce que notre effectif soit véritablement représentatif des quatre groupes désignés, notamment les femmes, les Autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB offrira des aménagements raisonnables aux candidats présentant un handicap, et les encourage à s'identifier comme tels lors du processus de candidature.Au sens de la présente offre, le masculin est utilisé comme genre neutre dans le seul but d'alléger le texte.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Assembly Operators - Day shift
description:
Based in Alexandria, Ontario, KP Building Products - Windows Division is a high-quality window and patio door manufacturer that has been a member of the Kaycan family since 2014. We foster a strong and lasting employment relationship, enhanced by the strength of the group to which we belong.

We are currently seeking Assembly Operators to complete our day shift team.

Shift : Day - Monday to Friday 7am - 3pm

We offer :

  • Salary : 15$/hr
  • Flexible group insurance program
  • Pension plan
  • Work boot allowance
  • Opportunity for growth and development

Duties:

  • Handle power tools and small hand tool
  • Operate machines and equipment
  • Assemble material and parts
  • Inspect manufactured products for defects and conformance to specifications
  • Reroute defective products

Requirements : 

  • High school diploma
  • No experience required - Full training will be provided
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to work standing for extended periods
  • Languages: French or English

While we appreciate all expressed interest in joining our team, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: SMT Inspector (Afternoon Shift)
description:
As a member of the SMT Department, you will be part of the manufacturing group that assembles our products.
 

Responsibilities:

  • Assist in running the SMT line.
  • Inspect boards post reflow visually and with Automated Optical Inspection (AOI) machine
  • Hand soldering repair when required
  • Maintain clean work environment

Qualifications:

  • Experience with electronic components in an electronic manufacturing environment
  • Strong attention to detail is required.
  • Be results oriented, self-motivated, and a team player
  • Computer knowledge is an asset
  • Hand soldering experience

What we offer:

  • Employer funded benefits program
  • Competitive total compensation package
  • Work-life balance
  • Employee Assistance plan
  • Employee Discount Platform
  • Career progression
  • Casual work environment
  • Social events and sports teams

About Evertz:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery.

Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertzâ€™ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers.

With over 1700 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz!

title: General Labour/Assembler
description:
General Labour/Assembler

Bolton, ON, Canada Req #3992

Wednesday, January 19, 2022

$2,500 sign-on bonus!

$100 bonus for all fully vaccinated new hires!

Morgan Truck Body, the largest truck body manufacturer in North America, has opportunities for General Labourers/Assemblers!

We promote almost 100% of our production leaders from within. Most start their leadership career in this general labourer/assembler role. Your first promotion can occur between your 6th and 12th month of employment.

Our generous benefits include paid vacation and holidays, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k with company match, and 80% tuition reimbursement as well as many others!

Job Description

The General Labourer/Assembler is responsible for building and assembly of a multitude of pieces as well as completed truck bodies.

You will receive on the job training for:

  • Basic math, tape measurement, and computer skills
  • Working with hand and power tools
  • Reading and interpreting blueprints

Job Duties
  • Read and interpret: orders and specifications, blueprints, instructions and labels which may contain hazardous warnings and cautions
  • Cut wood or metals to specific sizes using a variety of saws, sheers and cutters
  • Fasten parts together with bolts, screws, speed clips, rivets or fasteners
  • Operate pneumatic tools and hand tools
  • Perform set up of machine and preventative maintenance as required
  • Examine finished project for quality and defects
  • Perform safety and quality checks
  • Work and adhere to all safety policies
Minimum Qualifications
  • Must be 18 years old
Preferred Qualifications (not required)
  • Previous experience in manufacturing
  • Previous experience working on truck bodies
  • Construction experience is a plus
  • High School Diploma or equivalent GED
Physical Requirements:

This job operates in a manufacturing plant environment. While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to talk or hear. The team member frequently is required to stand (sometimes for extended periods); walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms, and lift up to 35 pounds. The team member may, at times, sit, bend, stoop, squat, reach overhead, or crawl (may be in confined spaces). The team member is expected to perform repetitive tasks using their hands, and have the ability to climb ladders and/or work in high places.

#LI-TK1

J.B. Poindexter & Co., Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Other details

  • Job Family Morgan Truck Body
  • Job Function Manufacturing
  • Pay Type Hourly

title: Kitter/Assembler
description:
Kitter/AssemblerTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB Smart Buildings digitally transforms commercial, industrial and residential buildings for the highest comfort, efficiency, safety and security - enhancing quality of life in buildings of the future through safe, smart and sustainable electrification solutions, services and products.Working at ABB means having access to a complete benefit package, a group pension plan as well as growth opportunities within the company.
Your responsibilities

  • Gather the necessary parts for the assembly kits for production
  • Bring the required materials to the production tables according to the schedule
  • Identify non-conformances and respect quality process
  • Ability to use an electric / manual pallet and a tugger, perform daily inspections
  • Apply quality, health, safety and environmental procedures and policies and participate in the various activities that flow from them
  • Assemble components in order to make emergency lighting finished goods
  • Apply quality procedures and policies
  • Participate in the continuous improvement program
  • Perform other related duties

Your background
  • Electric pallet and tugger training offered (if necessary)
  • Hability to operate a handheld computer (radio frequency)
  • Ability to raise average load occasionally (Max. 50 pounds)
  • Ability to work standing and good dexterity
  • Ability to work in a team or independently and under pressure (promised dates)
  • Open to job rotation
  • French or English, spoken and written
  • Available for overtime

Benefits
  • Medical insurance
  • Retirement plan
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

title: Composite Technician
description:
Established in 1997, Eastside Industrial started out as a coatings business, preparing and painting fiberglass and metal components for local OEMs.

We are a family business committed to developing our team members to grow within our group of companies and develop their skills as much as possible. We enjoy company events whenever possible and are grateful for the wonderful team we have here at Eastside.

Eastside Industrial is committed to diversifying our customer base in class A coatings and composites manufacturing with our expanding our customer base throughout the continent.

Today, Eastside Industrial serves dozens of OEMs across North America with tooling prototyping, assembly, coatings, and composites manufacturing solutions. Eastside Industrial continues to see growth as we expand our operations to accommodate higher scale and more innovative production methods to continue meeting our current and targeted customer needs.

POSITION PURPOSE:
This position will assist in all aspects of the Composite Technician which includes but not limited to prepping tools for gel coat, placing the fiberglass material load after gel coat and closing tooling, and injecting resin into the closed tool. In addition to this, operate machines or equipment or use hand tools to cut glass mat, shape, splice, and fit materials to form into tools. This job is for a reliable, hard-working individual that has a high level of attention to detail, excellent hand-eye coordination with the ability to work independently and efficiently while being focused on Safety and Continuous improvement aspects. 

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Working in a safe manner and following all safety rules.
  • Ability to wear ½ mask face Respirator while performing specified work tasks.
  • Assist with tool movements and prep/cleaning for the gel coat booth.
  • Select and cut fiberglass mat and press / or lay mat over the gel-coated plug/tool.
  • Utilizing electric and pneumatic tools.
  • Seal / close tools and inject resin into tools at appropriate vacuum and injection volume.
  • Demold (Remove) the cured parts from the tool and clear excessive material from the edge of the tool.
  • Be prepared to lift 25 pounds from time to time in this role
  • Inspect tools to ensure it meets required specifications and identify any defects present 
  • Complete assigned work within given timeframe and according to specifications.
  • Keep all work areas including part storage area clean and organized, emptying scrap and garbage containers as necessary.
  • Cleaning and maintaining work tools such as rollers, brushes, grinders, electric tools and other pieces of equipment.
  • Cleaning and maintaining safety equipment such as respirators and dust masks.
  • Maintain all quality standards in accordance with the specifications for each job in order to meet customer requirements.
  • Performs additional duties as deemed necessary.
  • Takes initiative and is a self-starter.
  • Ability to prioritize and handle multiple duties/projects at one time, work independently. with minimal supervision, and resolve conflict in a professional manner.
  • Maintains open communication and a team-oriented work environment with all departments and all levels of personnel.
  • Demonstrates flexibility and professionalism throughout the day.
  • Adhere to all start/end times including break and lunch schedules.
  • Willingness to work in other areas of the facility as required.

QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE / REQUIRED SKILLS:
  • Preferred: High school diploma or GED from an accredited school system or program.
  • Preferred: 6 months of related experience in an industrial manufacturing environment.
  • Possess knowledge of and ability to identify and work with FRP Materials, machining tools / equipment.
  • Ability to follow verbal and written instructions.
  • Comfortable with repetitive tasks.
  • Position requires physical requirements including lifting, pushing/pulling, lifting, bending/stretching, and standing.

BENEFITS:
  • Dental care.
  • Disability insurance.
  • Extended health care.
  • Life insurance.
  • On-site parking.
  • RRSP match.

COVID-19 considerations:
Eastside ensures all protocols are followed for the safety of our employees, their families, and our customers. 
  • Personal protective equipment provided or required.
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place.
  • Social distancing guidelines in place.




    About Eastside Industrial Coatings and Composites :

    Established in 1997, Eastside Industrial started out as a coatings business, preparing and painting fibreglass and metal components for local OEMs.As the coatings business continued to grow with a focus on “A” Finish coatings, Eastside Industrial moved to a larger location (our current space), committed to diversifying into composites manufacturing and expanding our customer base throughout the continent.Today, Eastside Industrial serves dozens of OEMs across North America with tooling prototyping, assembly, coatings and composites manufacturing solutions. Eastside Industrial continues to see growth as we expand our operations to accommodate higher scale and more innovative production methods to continue meeting our current and targeted customer needs.We remain a family owned business focused on growing our team and developing our team to have a successful future with Eastside or a member of the Eastside Group.

title: Technicien de production
description:
Technicien de productionFaites progresser votre carrière chez ABB avec une équipe mondiale qui alimente la transformation de la société et de l'industrie afin de bâtir un avenir plus productif et durable.Chez ABB, nous avons l'objectif précis de favoriser la diversité et l'inclusion dans tous ses aspects : genres, LGBTQ+, facultés, ethnicités, générations, etc. Ensemble, nous entreprenons un parcours où chacun d'entre nous, respecte et célèbre les différences individuelles

Le segment d'affaires Mesure et analyse (PAMA) développe, fabrique, vend, livre et assure la maintenance de produits et de solutions afin de permettre aux clients des secteurs industriels et de l'énergie de renforcer l'efficacité et la rentabilité de leurs opérations. Nous sommes déterminés à servir nos clients en leur offrant les meilleures solutions numériques pour répondre à leurs besoins rapidement et de façon fiable, tout en mettant à leur disposition un réseau de services mondial.Basé à la ville de Québec et relevant du superviseur de production, le technicien de production soutien l'unité d'affaire dans la réalisation des objectifs de production fixés en adhérant aux systèmes et processus. L'unité d'affaire produit des analyseurs de produits chimiques qui visent différents marchés.
Vos responsabilités

  • Effectuer l'assemblage optique, mécanique et électroniques de nos analyseurs.
  • Effectuer le contrôle qualité de ces mêmes analyseurs.
  • Réaliser les tests finaux en s'assurant de rencontrer le standard de qualité.
  • Respecter les processus en place.
  • Résoudre les probématiques rencontrer lors de l'assemblage et des tests.
  • Être en accord avec les valeurs fondamentales de sécurité et d'intégrité d'ABB, c'est-à-dire assumer la responsabilité de vos propres actes, tout en prenant soin de vos collègues et de l'entreprise.

Votre parcours professionnel
  • Dîplome d'étude collégial en physique, électronique ou dans un domaine approprié.
  • Un diplôme d'études secondaire jumelé à de l'expérience pertinente sera aussi considéré
  • Bilingue (francais et anglais)
  • Avoir une grande capacité d'apprentissage et un sens de l'analyse aiguisé.
  • Faire preuve d'un haut niveau d'autonomie, de responsabilité et de polyvalence.
  • Allier haut niveau de qualité et efficacité.

Benefits
  • Plan retraite
  • Mutuelle d'entreprise
  • Programme bien-être
En savoir plus sur nous
Figurant sur la liste des 15 meilleurs employeurs au Canada de Forbes 2020, ABB valorise à sa juste valeur le dévouement, l'engagement et l'expertise de ses employés. À titre d'employeur soucieux de l'équité en matière d'emploi, ABB croit en un effectif inclusif et diversifié. Notre engagement est de veiller à ce que l'ensemble des politiques et des pratiques respectent l'esprit du Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, et nous visons à ce que notre effectif soit véritablement représentatif des quatre groupes désignés, notamment les femmes, les Autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB offrira des aménagements raisonnables aux candidats présentant un handicap, et les encourage à s'identifier comme tels lors du processus de candidature.Au sens de la présente offre, le masculin est utilisé comme genre neutre dans le seul but d'alléger le texte.
skills: ['Respecter les processus en place.']

title: Production Assembler/Technician's (Multiple Openings)
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

 

Lonza in Kingston, Ontario is actively seeking several Production Assembler/Technician's to help with the assembly and testing of cutting edge technology such as the Cocoon® Platform. The responsibilities include: removing parts from inventory, inspecting parts for quality, prepare required tools, fixtures and test equipment, assemble product, test for performance, and package. Measurements, assembly, record keeping among other activities, will require your continued precision, focus and care.

We are looking for individuals who enjoy the manufacturing/production environment and being hands-on.

**Premium Total Reward Package**

 

Key responsibilities:

  • Working hygienically in a controlled environment
  • Maintaining accurate documentation and record keeping
  • Work within a self-directed team environment
  • Precision in: Measurements, Assembly, Testing (as per protocols), Record Keeping, Hygiene, Health & Safety  

Key requirements:

  • Must have High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Ability to read technical documentation
  • Ability to use tools, fixtures, and test equipment
  • Working experience in a manufacturing/operations/production role
  • Must enjoy the manufacturing environment and being hands-on
  • Computer skills, MS Office
  • Company Quality System Training
  • Company specified health and safety training

 

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

 

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

 

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Assemblers
description:
Recognized as one of Canada's 50 Best Managed Companies, Brandt provides top quality products to its customers worldwide. As a result of continued growth, we are currently seeking Assemblers for our new Saskatoon Manufacturing Facility. Responsibilities include:

  • Perform all assembly functions at an acceptable standard level
  • Read blueprints, diagrams and schematic drawings to determine work procedures
  • Operate hoisting and lifting devices to position machinery and parts during the installation, setup and repair of machinery
  • Move materials as required using a forklift
  • Stage materials as required using a forklift
  • Use Power tools as required
  • Reports all damaged goods and or scrap to supervisor
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • Must have some assembly experience
  • Must be able to read and understand shop drawings
  • Must be knowledgeable in the use and operation of all hand power tools
  • Must be able to understand and carry out written and verbal instructions
  • Has some knowledge of proper maintenance of equipment under this classification
  • Must be capable of working under minimum amount of supervision
  • Able to effectively communicate in both technical and user-friendly language when appropriate, with all types of staff, including technical, professional, and upper management
  • Able to build and maintain lasting relationships with business units, corporate departments, key managers, and other stakeholders
  • Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines
  • Must have excellent attention to detail.

title: journalier Monteur-assembleur
description:
Vous aimez le travail manuel ? Vous voulez travailler dans une nouvelle entreprise neuve avec une superbe ambiance de travail ?
Ce travail est pour vous alors !

Voici les tâches pour le poste de monteur-assembleur:
Effectuer l’assemblage des structures d’aluminium;
Effectuer le positionnement et l’installation des thermos et des vitres;
Installer les moulures, les joints d’étanchéités et la quincaillerie;
Procéder à des inspections et des contrôles qualités;
Compléter les produits selon les spécifications demandées;
Effectuer la coupe de moulures, de cornières et de renforts;
Effectuer l’usinage de pièces à l’aide de poinçons et de perceuses;

Nouvelle usine, qui fabrique des murs-fenêtres dans le quartier industriel de St-Hyacinthe recherche actuellement un monteur -assembleur de soir. Cette entreprise ou vous aurez un coup de coeur en arrivant par sa belle lumière intérieure, son équipe jeune et dynamique et avec un équipement à la fine pointe de la technologie n'attend que vous,

Poste permanent
Horaire de soir
Lundi au jeudi 17h-3h am
Salaire de 21.11$ + 1.65$ prime de soir
Assurance collective après 3 mois

Voici les qualifications donc vous aurez besoin pour le poste de monteur-assembleur
Opération d’un pont roulant (un atout);
Dextérité manuelle et minutie;
Facilité à interpréter des consignes plans ou dessins techniques;
Connaitre mesures métrique


Par ailleurs, nos services sont gratuits et nous avons plusieurs opportunités d’emploi à Saint-Hyacinthe et dans la région. title: Assembler
description:
Assembler

Bolton, ON, Canada Req #3127

Thursday, December 30, 2021

COMPANY BACKGROUND:

The Morgan Canada - Bolton Team is dedicated to providing our customers with cost effective truck bodies in the shortest time frame and at the highest quality levels. Whether your needs are for a dry freight body, cube van, refrigerated truck body, or a lift gate, Morgan Canada - Bolton will meet your needs.

Morgan Canada - Bolton has been serving the Canadian transportation industry since 1962 and is now part of Morgan Corporation, the largest manufacturer of medium duty freight and refrigerated van and truck bodies in North America.

Founded in 1952, as a small welding shop in Morgantown, Pennsylvania, on the site where Conestoga wagons were manufactured through the late 1800s, Morgan Corporation has experienced tremendous growth and continues to look for additional expansion opportunities around the world. With a total of 14 manufacturing and six service facilities strategically located across the U.S. and Canada, Morgan is able to provide the quality, service, and prompt delivery our customers expect.

We pride ourselves in team member development, performance, recognition, and a culture of diversity and respect. Whether you are taking the next step of your career or just beginning, joining Morgan's winning team means being part of a great home away from home. You will be challenged. You will be proud.

Typical Job Classifications, Duties, and Responsibilities

The typical job duties for the job classifications as set out in Schedule "A" include, but are not limited to, in addition to the ability to communicate effectively in English (read and write), and the requirement to comply with all safety policies and procedures and to comply with housekeeping functions; to meet performance expectations; to maintain a clean and orderly work area; and to follow Standard Operating Procedures; the following duties responsibilities:

Job Classifications

Assembler Class 1

Job Duties and Responsibilities

  • Perform tasks such as drilling, bucking, impacting, lifting of material, and plug in wiring within all areas of the plant.
  • Train other employees as required.

#LI-TK1
Other details
  • Job Family Morgan Truck Body
  • Job Function Manufacturing
  • Pay Type Hourly
  • Employment Indicator Full Time Hourly

title: Approvisionneur/Assembleur
description:
Approvisionneur/AssembleurFaites progresser votre carrière chez ABB avec une équipe mondiale qui alimente la transformation de la société et de l'industrie afin de bâtir un avenir plus productif et durable.Chez ABB, nous avons l'objectif précis de favoriser la diversité et l'inclusion dans tous ses aspects : genres, LGBTQ+, facultés, ethnicités, générations, etc. Ensemble, nous entreprenons un parcours où chacun d'entre nous, respecte et célèbre les différences individuelles

Le segment d'affaires Bâtiments intelligents transforme les bâtiments commerciaux, industriels et résidentiels de manière numérique afin d'en optimiser le confort, l'efficacité, la sûreté et la sécurité, et ainsi améliorer la qualité de vie dans les bâtiments de l'avenir grâce à des solutions, des services et des produits d'électrification sûrs, intelligents et durables.En travaillant chez ABB, vous aurez accès à un programme complet d'avantages sociaux, à un régime d'épargne-retraite collectif, ainsi qu'à des possibilités d'avancement au sein de l'entreprise.
Vos responsabilités

  • Rassembler les pièces nécessaires aux kits d'assemblage pour la production
  • Amener les pièces nécessaires aux tables selon la cédule de production
  • Détecter les non-conformités et appliquer le processus de qualité
  • Utiliser un transpalette électrique et un tugger, effectuer l'inspection quotidienne
  • Appliquer les procédures et politiques en matière de qualité et de santé, sécurité et environnement et participer aux diverses activités qui en découlent
  • Assembler des composants dans le but de fabriquer des produits finis d'éclairage de secours
  • Appliquer les procédures et politiques en matière de qualité
  • Participer au programme d'amélioration continue
  • Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes

Votre parcours professionnel
  • Formation transpalette électrique et tugger offertes (au besoin)
  • Habileté à opérer un ordinateur de poche (radiofréquence)
  • Capacité à soulever des charges moyenne à l'occasion (Max. 50 livres)
  • Capacité à travailler debout et bonne dextérité
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe ou de façon autonome et sous pression (dates promises)
  • Ouverture à la rotation de postes/tâches
  • Maîtrise du français et de l'anglais, à l'oral et à l'écrit
  • Disponible pour le temps supplémentaire

Benefits
  • Mutuelle d'entreprise
  • Plan retraite
  • Programme bien-être
En savoir plus sur nous
Figurant sur la liste des 15 meilleurs employeurs au Canada de Forbes 2020, ABB valorise à sa juste valeur le dévouement, l'engagement et l'expertise de ses employés. À titre d'employeur soucieux de l'équité en matière d'emploi, ABB croit en un effectif inclusif et diversifié. Notre engagement est de veiller à ce que l'ensemble des politiques et des pratiques respectent l'esprit du Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, et nous visons à ce que notre effectif soit véritablement représentatif des quatre groupes désignés, notamment les femmes, les Autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB offrira des aménagements raisonnables aux candidats présentant un handicap, et les encourage à s'identifier comme tels lors du processus de candidature.Au sens de la présente offre, le masculin est utilisé comme genre neutre dans le seul but d'alléger le texte.
skills: ['Disponible pour le temps supplémentaire']

title: Production Technician
description:
Production TechnicianTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

Based in Quebec City and reporting to the production supervisor, the production technician supports the business unit in achieving the production objectives set by adhering to systems and processes. The business unit produces chemical product analyzers that target different markets.ABB Measurement and Analytics (PAMA) develops, produces, sells, delivers and services products and solutions to enable industrial and energy customers to operate more efficiently and profitably. We are dedicated to serving our customers with the best digitally enabled solutions to meet their needs quickly and reliably, while providing the support of a global service network.
Your responsibilities

  • Perform the optical, mechanical and electronic assembly of our analyzers.
  • Perform quality control of these same analyzers.
  • Conduct the final tests making sure to meet the quality standard.
  • Comply with the processes in place.
  • Troubleshoot problems encountered during assembly and testing.
  • Be consistent with ABB's core values of safety and integrity, that is, take responsibility for your own actions while taking care of your colleagues and the company.

Your background
  • College diploma (DEC) in physics, electronics or an appropriate field
  • High school diploma coupled with relevant experience will also be considered
  • Bilingual (French and English)
  • Strong learning and analytical skills
  • High level of autonomy, responsibility and versatility
  • Strong concern for high quality and efficiency

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

description:

Thursday, July 22, 2021

COMPANY BACKGROUND :

The Morgan Canada - Bolton Team is dedicated to providing our customers with cost effective truck bodies in the shortest time frame and at the highest quality levels. Whether your needs are for a dry freight body, cube van, refrigerated truck body, or a lift gate, Morgan Canada - Bolton will meet your needs.

Morgan Canada - Bolton has been serving the Canadian transportation industry since 1962 and is now part of Morgan Corporation, the largest manufacturer of medium duty freight and refrigerated van and truck bodies in North America.

Founded in 1952, as a small welding shop in Morgantown, Pennsylvania, on the site where Conestoga wagons were manufactured through the late 1800s, Morgan Corporation has experienced tremendous growth and continues to look for additional expansion opportunities around the world. Job Classifications

title: Assembler - Switchgear
description:
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB Distribution Solutions (ELDS) are a global leader in power distribution solutions, delivering pioneering low and medium-voltage innovations and services. We care about your tomorrow, providing solutions for a smarter, safer, environmentally friendly and more reliable flow and distribution of electricity.

Your responsibilities

  • Assembly & control panel wiring: Conducts all types of assembly work to produce a semi-finished or final products/systems/panels (MV switchgear): A to Z assembly as per mechanical /3D and layout drawings. Work is typically done manually or by using light hand tools.
  • Quality: The job may include regular quality testing as part of a defined production process: point to point testing/CT testing/function test
  • Continuous improvement: Suggest and support the implementation of improvement ideas.
  • Health & safety: Conducts shop floor operation in compliance with health & safety guidelines and reports any non-compliance. Maintain a clean and safe workplace in accordance with 6S protocol
  • Organization: Operates within standard operating procedures
  • Inventory: Involvement with cycle inventory counts when needed.

Your background

  • Diploma in Electromechanical technology or similar background is an asset
  • Electrical license 309-442A is an asset
  • 4-7 years' experience in MV (medium voltage) switchgear service or manufacturing. Alternatively, a special combination of education and experience and /or demonstrated accomplishments
  • Thorough knowledge of assembly techniques, tools, materials, machines, and equipment (good mechanical background).
  • Read and interpret engineering configuration and wiring drawings.
  • Works from engineering drawings, rough sketches, manuals, or verbal instructions.
  • Read, interpret, and follow electrical drawings, understand the use of and is able to use electrical test equipment with minimal supervision.
  • Good oral and written communication skills
  • Good knowledge and use of MS office
  • Physical Requirements:
  • Able to do repetitive work.
  • Able to lift 40 lbs.
  • Stand or sit for extended periods of time.

More about us

Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

title: Window Assembler - Multiple shifts - Concord
description:
Pay: Starting $16.45/hr
Location: Concord, ON


Are you in search of a fulltime job? Do you like working with manual/semi-automatic hand tools?
Are you comfortable working in a fast-paced and fast-growing environment?
Do you have an interest in assembling and building things?

If the answer is Yes! We have an amazing opportunity for you. Join the Randstad team at the Manufacturing Plant at Concord!

Shifts Available:
Days: Monday to Thursday; 7:30 AM to 6:00 PM
Days: Monday to Thursday; 6:00 AM to 4:30 PM
Weekends: Friday, Saturday, Sunday; 7:30 AM to 8:00 PM
***4-hour bonus pay for 3 consecutive days of work in Weekend Shift***

Pay: Starting $16.45/hr
Location: Applewood Cres, Concord, ON




Advantages
What is in it for you as the Window Assembler at Manufacturing Plant in Concord:
- Weekly pay
- Competitive pay rate
- Weekend Bonus
- 4% Vacation Pay
- Schedule: Multiple shifts to choose from
- Onsite support to help you succeed and learn new skills


Responsibilities
What will you do as Window Assembler at Manufacturing Plant in Concord:
- Assembly and packaging of windows and window components
- Basic reading skills
- Read a Tape Measure – Metric and Standard
- Operate Hand Tools, Screw Gun, Drills, and tools
- Cleaning of assembled frame
- Other general Windows Assembler duties as required by the Manager / Supervisor / Lead Hand
(Training / Ongoing support provided for all responsibilities)



Qualifications
What will make you an IDEAL candidate for the Window Assembler role at Manufacturing Plant in Concord:
- Operate manual or semi-automatic hand tools
- Ability to use a tape measure
- Lifting up to 50 pounds (regularly)
- Experience working in a plant/manufacturing environment is an asset but not necessary.
- MUST be able to drive to the location (Applewood Cres, Concord) - NOT accessible by Public Transport


Summary
Amazing opportunity for those who are looking to get a job instantly!
Get some Window Assembler experience! and learn some skills!
We are ready for you to join us!!
Start ASAP
Contact ‘Krithika’ today, email on ‘krithika.sridhar@randstad.ca’ and mention “Concord-Window Assembler” in the subject line.
Or Call/Text on 905-867-0297
